loans.name: Aninam Mimi

texts.fr: Aninam est une femme mariée résidant à Agoè et âgée de 45 ayant cinq enfants à charge. Aninam est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne six fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile. Pour financer son achat, Aninam nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois en vue de mieux revendre afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation à leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Aninam is a 45-year-old married mother who lives in Agoè with five children in her care. She earns a living through selling wood charcoal, which she purchases from market six-times per month then resells out of her own home.

Aninam needs this loan to purchase sacks of wood charcoal so she can sell more stock. By doing this, she will be able to earn a greater profit and support her husband in paying for their family's expenses, as well as provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase nine sacks of wood charcoal.

loans.name: Amosse

texts.pt:
O Senhor Amosse é casado e vive com esposa e seus cinco filhos numa casa cedida  pelas irmães franciscanas de marracuene dos quais apenas um é maior de idade. Ele é policia tendo sido vitima das calamidades naturais  do ano 2000 onde perderam todos os seus bens incluindo a casa. Com o presente emprestimo decidiu melhorar e ampliar.  A casa onde vai comprar vinte sacos de cimento, varões de 8 mm e vinte barrotes de pinho.
O seu sonho é abrir um salão de beleza para a sua esposa, ela trabalhava como cabeleleira antes da mudança de residência, mais ainda tem dificuldades financeiras para a realização deste projecto.
texts.en:
Amosse is married. He lives with his wife and their five children - only one of them of age - in a house that was donated by the Sisters of Saint Francis of Marracuene. He is a police officer and him and his family were victims of the natural disaster of the year 2000 when they lost everything, including their home. 
He wants to use this loan to make additions and improvements to the home. He wants to buy twenty cement bags, 8mm beams and twenty pinewood rods.
His dream is to open a beauty salon for his wife. She was a hairdresser before they had to move, but she's had financial difficulties to restart her business.

loans.use: to buy twenty cement bags, 8mm beams and twenty pinewood rods.

loans.name: Ada

texts.es:
Ada esta estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, por medio de sus estudios quiere abrirse camino y por medio de sus conocimientos quiere poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna. Ella comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior pudo pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma pudo seguir con sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Ada is studying accounting.  Through her studies, she wants to break through; and through her knowledge she wants to be able to give her family all that they need to live a dignified life.  She says that through her previous loan, she could pay the fees for her career, and in this way she could continue her studies.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay the new fees for her career, and in this way be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Marisabel

texts.es: La señora  Marisabel vive en el área rural, alcanzó a estudiar hasta el nivel primario, su vivienda  es económico con techo de teja española que carece de algunos servicios básicos, ella es una persona joven trabajadora y con mucho optimismo trabajan día a día junto a sus padres para obtener ingresos económicos para el sustento de su hijo y de ella misma. Se dedica primordialmente a la agricultura, en esta actividad lleva 4 años aproximadamente, donde produce y comercializa sus producción. Lo que obtienen lo lleva a la venta en ferias provinciales de la región y pueblos aledaños, los productos principales que siembra son papa en mayor cantidad, habas, maiz y otros en menor cantidad generalmente para consumo propio. La señora Marisabel se ve en la necesidad de solicitar el préstamo para la compra de semilla de papa, de esta manera poder ampliar su producción, continuar con su comercialización y obtener ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marisabel lives in a rural area. She left school after primary school. Her home is cheap, with a roof made of clay tiles, and some basic amenities. She is a young hard-working person with a lot of optimism. She and her parents are working every day to have the financial means for sustaining her son and herself.

Primarily, she is working in agriculture and has been producing an selling her produce for approximately four years. What she is growing she takes to provincial markets in her region and the surrounding towns.

The main crops she is sowing are potatoes in great amounts and beans, maize, and so on in small amounts and mostly for personal consumption.

Marisabel views it as necessary to request this loan to buy potato seeds in order to expand her production, to continue her sales and get an income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds in order to expand her production, to continue her sales and get an income to improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Villarrica, con el apoyo de sus padres ha podido estudiar y seguir sus sueños de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. 
Ella está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, y por medio de su carrera quiere abrirse camino para poder mejorar su vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of Villarrica. With the support of her parents she has been able to study and follow her dream of being able to improve her living conditions.

She is studying to become a nurse. Through her trade she wants to open a path to improve her life.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her tuition fees, the way she does.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Rina Marisela

texts.es:
Rina, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, no estudio, está soltera y vive con su madre a la cual cuida porque es de avanzada de edad.

Rina, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la agricultura, creció con sus hermanos los cuales junto a su padre trabajaban en la agricultura, ella decidió trabajar en esta labor pero también hace tacos, pastelitos de carne, entre otras cosas para vender y tiene una parcela de cultivos junto a sus hermanos a 2 kilómetros de su casa. 

Rina, necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y abono para sus cultivos, porque en las primeras siembras perdieron todo y la mayoría de la inversión se fue ahí y no tiene para seguir trabajando, para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos y sacar una gran cosecha y todo será posible con el financiamiento. 

El sueño principal de Rina, es obtener excelentes cosechas ya que de eso depende el sustento de ella y de su madre; también desea tener un negocio de comida.
texts.en:
Rina, 39 years of age, went to school until the ninth grade, doesn't study, is single, and lives with her mother whom she cares for because she is advanced in age.

Rina works as a housekeeper and in agriculture. She grew up with her siblings, who along with her father worked in agriculture. She decided to labor in this work but she also makes tacos, meat pies, among other things, to sell and has a parcel of crops together with her brothers wo kilometers from her house.

Rina needs the loan to buy fertilizer and manure for her crops because in the first sowing they lost everything and the majority of the investment with it. She doesn't have it to continue working, to maintain her crops, and to take in a large harvest, and everything will be possible with the financing. Rina's principal dream is to obtain excellent harvests because her sustenance and that of her mother depends on it. Also, she wishes to have a food business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure for her crops.

loans.name: Jose Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio, de 48 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casado y vive con su esposa y sus tres hijas, dos de ellas estudian quinto y noveno grado, mientras que la otra trabaja en los oficios domésticos como la madre.

Ignacio, trabaja la agricultura desde que era un niño, fue el padre quien le inculco estas labores, porque posee una parcela a 20 minutos de su casa y trabaja todos los días en la mañana y en la tarde.		

Ignacio, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos, porque de ello dependen sus cosechas y con el financiamiento logrará darle un buen cuido y obtener una buena cosecha.

El sueño de Ignacio, es obtener una buena cosecha y que sus hijas sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Ignacio is 48 years old, studied until 6th grade, is married, and lives with his wife and 3 daughters. Two of the daughters attend school, 5th and 9th grade, and the third one helps her mother in the household chores.
Ignacio has been working in agriculture since he was a child. It was his father who motivated him to work in this area because they had some land 20 minutes away from their home. He works every day in the morning and the afternoon.
Ignacio needs the loan to buy fertilizers for his fields because his harvest depends on it. With the loan he'll be able to give it good care and obtain a good harvest. Igancio's dream is to obtain a good harvest and that his daughters become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his fields.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa lives in Atsabe and she has been running her business for a few years. She started her business with her own working capital. Her business is pieces of wood. Elisa is married and her husband is an operator.

Elisa has machines for cutting wood. So she is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her capital because she wants to buy additional materials including trees, gasoline, oil, chain, split and spare parts for machine tools and other materials.

She is happy because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, her income can be increased.

loans.use: to buy trees, gasoline, oil, chain, split and spare parts for machine tools and other materials.

loans.name: Madres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Madres Trabajadoras, son mujeres trabajadoras que se unieron para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras, cada una para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Bartola es una de las que integra este grupo, ella se dedica a vender comidas que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Comenta que se hizo ya de muy buena clientela ya que sus comidas son muy ricas y gustan mucho a sus clientes.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser: verduras, carnes, condimentos, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos
texts.en:
The group is called Madres Trabajadores, they are working women who got together to be able to help each other, each one to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones.

Bartola is one of the people who makes up this group. She works selling food that she prepares herself and later goes out to sell as a street vendor. She says that she has created a very good customer base since her food is very delicious and her customers like it a lot.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase supplies to be able to make her dishes such as vegetables, meat, seasonings, baked goods, and more, in such as way as to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, seasonings, baked goods, and more.

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Unión está integrado por 15 mujeres ,están en  el 1° ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Señora Rocio, una humilde peluquera, comenta que por medio de su sacrificio ha podido mejorar sus condiciones de vida, sumado a las capacitaciones que les brinda la fundación paraguaya. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que quiere salir adelante, es por ello que pone todo de sí para poder crecer.
La Señora Rocío solicita este préstamo para la compra de insumos (Cremas, tintes, agua oxigenada, shampoo, enjuagues, y otros)  ya que su clientela creció bastante, y cada vez son más exigentes y quiere poder cumplir con ellos.
texts.en:
The La Union group is made up of 15 women who are in their 1st loan cycle in the women's committee program, where they all work and help each other to be able to improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones.

One of the members is Rocio, a humble hairdresser. She says that through her sacrifices she has been able to improve her standard of living, in addition to the training that the Fundación Paraguaya offers them. She is a very self-sacrificing woman who wants to get ahead, and for this she puts her all into being able to grow.

Rocío asks for this loan to purchase supplies (creams, dyes, hydrogen peroxide, shampoo, rinses, and more) since her customer base has grown quite a bit, and they are more and more demanding and she wants to be able to satisfy them.

loans.use: to purchase creams, dyes, hydrogen peroxide, shampoo, rinses, and other supplies to stock her beauty salon.

loans.name: Diego Armando

texts.es:
En el barrio Santa  Ana de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Nueva Generación.
En este lugar vive el señor Diego, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre pero aun no tiene  hijos. Su mujer es comerciante. 
Don Diego es un hombre que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para salir adelante, el trabaja en una fábrica de¡ la localidad, pero junto a la mujer también se dedican al comercio,  ellos se dedican a la venta  ropa de todo tipo, la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza su mujer porque ella es la que más tiempo tiene para salir a vender pues él trabaja de lunes a sábado en la fábrica, ella deja a crédito y cobran cada 8 días, el en ocasiones y cuando puede vende en su lugar de trabajo, parte de este crédito el espera utilizarlo en esta ocasión para realizar unos arreglos en su casa lo cual les permitirá mejorar su hogar y su calidad de vida.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisas y  materiales de construcción. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos les ayudan mucho. Sus sueños es tener un hijo.
texts.en:
In the Santa Ana neighborhood of the city of Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches which are visited by many all year round by domestic and international tourists, and for being one of the most important ports in the country and in America, located on the edge of the Pacific, the loan group Nueva Generación meets every two weeks.

Diego lives in this place. He is 34 years old and is in a common-law marriage but doesn't have any children yet. His wife is a saleswoman.

Diego is a man who has always liked to work to get ahead. He works at a factory in the area but also, with his wife, he works in sales. They work selling all sorts of clothing, his wife does most of the sales because she is the one who has more time to go out to sell since he works from Monday to Saturday at the factory. She leaves the items on credit and collects every week, and he at times and when he can sells at his workplace. He hopes to use part of this loan to make some repairs on his house which will allow him to improve his home and his quality of life.

This loan will be used to purchase pants, blouses, shirts and construction materials. He has been in the loan group for 2 years and he likes it because the loans help him a lot. His dream is to have a child.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, and construction materials.

loans.name: Adzo  Dovi V.

texts.fr: Adzo est une femme divorcée âgée de 38 ans qui habite à Agoè. Mère d’un enfant, Adzo est une marchande de fournitures scolaire qui s’approvisionne huit fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile pour gagner ses revenus. Pour commander des cartons de cahiers, Adzo nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de venir en aide à son enfant puis couvrir les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Adzo is a 38-year-old divorced mother to one child who lives in Agoè. She earns a living through selling school supplies which she purchases eight-time per month from market then resells out of her own home.

Adzo needs this loan to purchase her supplies so she can earn a solid profit. By doing this, she will be able to support her child and pay for their family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase three boxes of exercise books.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
A “sari-sari” or variety store appeals to customers if it has a wide array of merchandise. This is the reason why Divina wants to avail herself of a PHP 17,000 loan to buy a wider variety of supplies like groceries, snack items, and beverages. These additional items will enhance the competitiveness of her store within their community in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo.

If her sari-sari will grow bigger, according to her plan, its income can sufficiently meet the family's basic needs and will help provide for the school expenses of her children who are studying in college and high school.

Often, her capital is depleted because she puts a priority on the educational expenses of her children. Your financial assistance would be very helpful for her to replenish her stock and gain higher profits. Her husband, Jerry, a roaming vendor, also works diligently to enrich their lives and prepare for the future.

Divina meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups, each composed of 15 to 30 community partners, that gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a wider variety of supplies like groceries, snack items, and beverages.

loans.name: Julio Ruben

texts.es:
En el barrio Santa  Ana de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Nueva Generación.
En este lugar vive el señor Julio, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen un  hijo de seis años de edad el cual estudia en una escuela de la ciudad. Su mujer es ama de casa. 
Don Julio es un hombre que siempre le ha gustado ganarse la vida honradamente y así con el fruto de sus esfuerzo poder llevar el pan diario en su hogar, el se dedica al comercio, vende  ropa de todo tipo, interiores, sabanas y edredones,  su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, mientras el sale a vender por la ciudad y otros lugares  cercanos su mujer le ayuda vendiendo en su casa lugar hasta donde también llegan sus clientes, ya son 3 años que lleva realizando esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse la vida.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, ropa interior, sabanas y todo de lo que el vende. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos él puede sacar adelante su negocio. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Santa Ana in the city of Manta - known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round by national and foreign tourists and known for being one of the most important ports of the country and of the Americas and situated on the shores of the Pacific - every fifteen days the Grupo de Crédito Nueva Generación (Loan Group New Generation) meets.

In this place lives el señor Julio.  He is 26 years old and he maintains an open relationship; and from this relationship, he has a 6 year old son who studies in a school in the city.  His partner takes care of the house. 

Don Julio is a man who has always liked to earn a living honorably, and thus with the fruit of his effort be able to bring bread to his home daily.  He works in commerce. He sells clothing of all types, underwear, sheets, and comforters. His form of selling is from door to door.  While is goes out to sell in the city and other places close by, his partner helps him selling in the house, a place where customers also come to find him.  He has worked for three years in this business, which allows him to earn a living.

This loan is going to allow him to invest in buying clothing, underwear, sheets, and all the things that he sells. He has been with el Grupo de Crédito (Loan Group) for two years, and he likes it because thanks to the loans, he can get ahead in his business.  His dreams are to give the best to his family.

loans.use: To buy clothes, underwear, sheets, etc.

loans.name: Angelica Cristina

texts.es:
En el barrio Santa  Ana de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Nueva Generación.
En este lugar vive la señora Angélica, tiene 23 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  5  y 2 años de edad,  el  mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es obrero.
Doña Angélica hace lo posible por colaborar con los gastos del hogar y mas con los gastos que generan sus hijos que son muchos y que su marido no puede solventarlos, para esto ella  se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Avon, Yanbal y Belcorp (perfumes, cremas, bisutería entre otras cosas) su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres o cuatro días por semana ofreciendo sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva más  2 años en este negocio el cual le permite ganarse algo por su cuenta y ayudar a su  familia.
Este crédito es para comprar cremas, perfumes, bisutería y cosméticos. Lleva 2 años  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con  los créditos  compra productos de oferta que le dan mejores ganancias al venderlas. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the credit group Nueva Generacion meets in the neighborhood of Santa Ana in the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches, which are well visited year round by national and international tourists, and for being one of the most important ports in the country and on the Pacific coast of America.

Angelica lives in this place. She is 23 years old, in a relationship, and the couple has two children of five and two years of age. The older one is in school. Her husband is a worker.

Angelica is doing what she can to help with household expenses and even more with the expenses caused by her children, which are many and her husband can't cover them all. This is why she is selling Avon, Yanbal, and Belcorp products (perfumes, cremes, imitation jewelry, amongst other things). She is selling her products by going from door to door. She is doing this three or for days a week, offering her goods, selling them on credit and charges every week.

She has been in this business for more than two years, which allows her to make some money on her own and help her family.

This loan is to buy cremes, perfumes, imitation jewelry, and cosmetics. She has been in the credit group for two years and likes it because with the loans she buys goods on sale and makes more profit selling them. Her goal is to give the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy cremes, perfumes, imitation jewelry, and cosmetics.

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Judas Tadeo está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, cada una se fijó como meta poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde se esfuerzan por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sara, quien en su encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir en un nivel medio de pobreza. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace y que por medio de su trabajo da a su familia lo que ella no pudo tener.
La Sra. Sara solicita de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, panificados, hortalizas y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con su negocio como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The San Judas Tadeo group is going through their third cycle of the women's committee program. All of them work and help one another to succeed. They all have a personal goal: to improve their living conditions and their families'.
They are participating in the survey to eliminate poverty, so they work hard to improve their living conditions.
One of their members, Sara, showed a poverty level 2 in the survey, that is, a medium poverty level. She sells precooked meals that she prepares and with her work she is able to give her family those things she couldn't have.
Sara is asking for this loan to invest in supplies to be able to prepare more meals, such as vegetables, meat, spices, bread and other items to continue working on her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, spices, bread and other items

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El  comité MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS, tiene 20 integrantes que acceden al programa de mujeres emprendedoras para poder mejorar us condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Cada una está luchando y esforzándose por poder crecer y salir adelante.
Petrona, una de las integrantes, tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que todos los días trabaja, su sueño era desde siempre poder montar su propio negocio, y con su sacrificio pudo lograrlo, ahora su meta es poder ir mejorándolo poco a poco. Hoy se unió al grupo para poder cumplir ese anhelo que tiene y así cumplir con sus sueños.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder surtir su negocio, como ser verduras, carnes, frutas, enlatados, panificados, y otros, y así seguir dando a sus clientes lo que solicitan, agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando.
texts.en:
The committee Mujeres Emprendedoras (Entrepreneurial Women) has 20 members who access the program of entrepreneurial women to be able to improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones.  Each of them is striving and working to be able to grow and get ahead.

Petrona is one of the members.  She has a well stocked grocery store in which she works everyday.  Her dream was always to be able to have her own business; and with her sacrifice, she has able to achieve that.  Now her goal is to be able to continue improving it little by little.  Today she joined the group to be able to achieve this desire that she has, and thus fulfill her dreams.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy input to be able to stock her business, such as vegetables, meats, fruits, canned food, breads, and other things, and thus continue giving her customers what they ask for.  She is thankful for the opportunity that she receives to be able to continue growing and improving.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, meats, fruits, canned foods, breads, and other products to stock a grocery store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria lives in Oecusse,  She is 57 years old, and she has been doing business since 2012 using her own working capital of $600. 

She is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital and buy more supplies to keep in her store, including coffee, ketchup, candles, salt, biscuits, noodles, cigarettes, bottled water, eggs, pens, notebooks, and other things -- not to mention soft drinks and hard drinks.  

She has a small kiosk and uses a push cart aa well.  She wants to open a big store  in the future, so she is taking this loan to improve her management skills for her business.

loans.use: to buy a host of grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en: Sophal’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sophal makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
En el barrio Santa  Ana de la ciudad de  Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año, por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo de Crédito Nueva Generación.
En este lugar vive la señora Marleny, tiene 54 años de edad, está separada, pero  de esa relación tuvo cinco hijos mayores de edad, un hijo vive al lado de su casa pero independiente.
Doña Marleny es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar muy duro para salir adelante y no depender de nadie,  ella para esto se  dedica al comercio, vende zapatos por catalogo y productos de Avon, Yanbal y Belcorp (perfumes, cremas, bisutería entre otras cosas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale casi todos los  días a vender sus  productos los mismos que deja a crédito y que cobra cada 8 días, lleva más  3 años en este negocio el cual le da lo necesario para vivir y al mismo tiempo se entretiene visitando a sus clientes.
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos,  cremas, perfumes, bisutería y varios productos más que ella vende, ella con los créditos compra artículos de oferta ya que luego vende al precio normal y es lo que mejores ganancias le dejan. Lleva 4 ciclos en el  Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos siempre son importantes para ella. Sus sueños son seguir adelante gozando de buena salud.
texts.en:
The New Generation Credit Group meets every two weeks in the Santa Ana neighborhood in the city of Manta. Manta is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year-round by national and foreign tourists, and for being one of the most important ports in the country and in America, located on the Pacific coast.

Marleny lives here. She s 54 years old and is separated, but has five grown children from this relationship. One of her sons lives next to her house, but is independent. Marleny has had to work very hard to get ahead without depending on anyone. She works in sales, selling shoes from a catalogue and Avon, Yanbal and Belcorp products (perfumes, creams, and jewelry, among other things) from door to door. She goes out every day to sell her products, which she sells on credit and collects for every week. She has had this business for more than 3 years, and it provides her with a living as well as entertainment from visiting her customers.

This loan is to buy shoes, creams, perfume, jewelry and other products that she sells. She will buy products on sale and then resell them at a normal price so as to earn more profit. She has been through four cycles with the credit group, and she likes it because the loans are always very important for her. Her dream is to get ahead while enjoying good health.

loans.use: to buy shoes, creams, perfume, jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fruits and other items

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: Nazira was born in 1969. She is married and has 4 children. Nazira lives with her family in a village. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 10 years. She mainly feeds sheep and goats. Nazira has a great experience in this field. Nazira’s husband and son help her with feeding sheep and goat. She buys little sheep and goats, feeds them for some months and sells in a local market. She lives far from town near mountains and every day feeds her sheep and goat in the mountains. Nazira is going to increase the number of sheep and goat she feeds. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats for increased working capital.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a strong woman, married with 2 children, she owns and operates an agriculture business planting and harvesting banana and other fruit trees for sale. Merlinda has been engaged in her business for four years and earns well from these activities.

She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming supplies. Her farm is still doing well and yet, she needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently, she took a new loan to buy fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is 38 years old, and she is married.  She has been working in agriculture, planting trees, for more than 10 years.

Dung lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.  Her family is a low-income household in her village; moreover, the market demand is low in this region. And the income from her business is not high enough to do what she really needs to make her life more comfortable.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet.

This is Dung's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true.

In the future, Dung hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet

loans.name: Saveoun's Group

texts.en: Saveoun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Saveoun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer driver and accountant to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Rebhia

texts.en:
Mrs. Rebhieh, 48 years old, lives with her husband and four of her sons in a village near Nablus. She has been making and selling Palestinian traditional food “falafel” since 2000. Her husband is a carpenter and her sons are still attending schools. 
Rebhieh is requesting a loan of 1500 USD to improve her restaurant and buy more materials such as Humus, flour and oil.
By doing so her family standard living will be improved.

loans.use: to improve her popular restaurant and buy Humus, flour, salt and oil.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
This young farmer with his lovely family lives in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region. Ashot is 27 years old and he has two small children (a son and a daughter). He used to work as in construction but now all his day he spends on his farm and in farming activities. He has cows, calves, bulls, sheep, lambs and a lot of chickens in his farm. His nice wife very skillfully helps him in farming and she makes very tasty assortment of dairy-products for sale. Ashot sells milk, macun (national dairy-product), curd, cheese, meat and also a lot of eggs.

Ashot likes very much his farm works and he keeps it clean and well run, so his farm products also turn to be very good and he manages to sell them very profitably.

With his first Kiva loan Ashot wants to buy one cow for his farm and also fodder for his all farm cattle which will be very successful purchase for him, as he will have more profit from farming and his cattle will have enough fodder for the winter season as well.

loans.use: to buy one cow for his farm and also fodder for his all farm cattle which will be very successful purchase for him

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with 8 children. She describes herself to be risk taker. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regular.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of products. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, mangoes, potatoes. She hopes that in the future, she will have good living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, mangoes,potatoes.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 26 years old, and she is single.  She works hard to support her family. She is on the government staff. 

Although the family works very hard, they cannot afford the cost of her sister's education. This loan of $1,000 will allow Laura to help her sister continue her studies in junior high school. The loan will pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies. 

In the future, Laura hopes that her family are all well-educated and knowledgeable.

loans.use: to pay for her sister's registration, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Jesselyn

texts.en:
Jesselyn is a 20-year-old vocational graduate who lives in Bacolod City. She belongs to a family of three. Her parents are separated. Her father is a teacher in St. Therese Maritime in Iloilo City. Jesselyn lives with her mom. 

The family's total monthly income of PHP 10,000 ($219) is not enough for their basic needs. Jesselyn would like to earn more for herself and for her family, and she believes that the training at BagoSphere will allow her to realize this goal. 

Jesselyn aims to have a stable job with high salary and to help her family battle poverty. Your support in funding her loan will help Jesselyn have a better life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call-center training program.

loans.name: Nueva Creacion 1, 2 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Adarquiris is the coordinator of the Nueva Creacion (New Creation) 1, 2 & 4 Group, which is located in the city of Samana in one of the rural areas surrounded by the waters of the Atlantic ocean. Many of the group members sell goods, such as clothing, bread, ice cream, shoes, and cosmetics. Others sell seafood, run fried food stalls, and operate other businesses.

Adarquiris is a married woman and is the mother of four children and they all live together with her and their father. She said that her most difficult challenge has been to have a successful business. She sells seafood to neighbors in her community, and this loan (her second) will be used to buy different seafood meat like fish, prawns, crabs, etc. She is investing her profits to grow her business by introducing more products. She is hoping to make her dreams come true; to have her own house, a prosperous life, a good business and all her children become professional. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy fish, prawns, crabs, and other seafood.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda is from the village of Sto.Nino, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 64 years old, is married and has four children. Veneranda owns and operates a "sari-sari" retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2014, Veneranda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.

She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Veneranda is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has nine branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs

loans.use: to buy more good items for her store to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is thankful that she was granted a loan which she used to purchase computer parts and accessories needed for her internet cafe.. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like to apply for another Php 19000 which she will use to pay for the repair and maintenance of her computers. Edna is positive that she will have good returns on her investment since it is school time once again. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be extended to her.

Edna aims to purchase more PC to better serve more clients. She desires for her children to finish their studies and earn a college degree. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her computers and to purchase another computer.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
With grateful appreciation, Marcelina wants to convey that your previous financial assistance amounting to PHP 50,000 had been very helpful for her hanging rice business. It was utilized in purchasing more sacks of rice and beverages. As a result, it enhanced her earnings and provided for her family’s daily expenses. Thank you so much!

Despite the death of her ever supportive husband, she remained strong and continued with her productive life through the accompaniment of her children. Persistent as she is, she still plans to improve her business by cooking more hanging rice which remains salable among students and workers, travelers and commuters. Again, she is imploring your kindness to extend her another loan worth PHP 50,000 to buy sacks of rice, woven coconut leaves, and beverages. She also plans to sell used clothes in time for the approaching Christmas season. With high hopes, she wants to earn higher profit so she can better save in case of emergency.

She has been consistent in repaying her previous loan and she can maintain her integrity. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, woven coconut leaves, and beverages; to add used clothes for sale

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en:
Julie Ann is a 23-year-old college undergraduate who lives in Bago City. She belongs to a family of 10. Her father works as a welder in Bago City enterprises while her mother is working in a restaurant in Bago City. 

Julie Ann has seven siblings. She is the eldest in the family.  Her younger sister is already married, while her six other siblings are still studying. 

The family's monthly income is only PHP 13,500 ($296). Julie Ann's aspiration to find means to help her family is why she joined BagoSphere. Apart from helping her family, Julie Ann also wants to work in a company that provides a high standard of customer service along with a good salary. 

She aims to improve her English, help her family, and send her siblings to college once she gets a stable job.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a two-month call-center training program.

loans.name: Lorn's Group

texts.en: Lorn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Lorn makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer and seller to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Nyabugando Baptist School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Julius. He is an administrator at Nyabugando Baptist School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Nyabugando with 470 students. Nyabugando School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Nyabugando School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Julius ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
En total son 17 mujeres inspiradas que se esfuerzan día a día para solventar los gastos del día a día y por sobre todo aumentar sus ingresos, quieren dar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida a sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Martina se dedica a la costura, por medio de su trabajo puede dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Es una mujer muy sacrificada que lucha para poder ganarse la vida de una manera digna.
Ella pide este préstamo para comprar telas, hilos y otros productos de primera necesidad para poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando por mejorar. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
In all, these are 17 women who work hard every day to cover their expenses, and especially to increase their income. Their goal is to give their loved ones a better quality of life.
Martina is a seamstress. She can provide her family with the things she wasn't able to have with her work. She is a hard worker who struggles to earn a decent living.
She is asking for this loan to buy fabric, thread and other basic products to continue working and try to improve. She is thankful for the opportunity she has been given to grow and be better.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and other product for garment making.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is an amazing lady who lives in Dier Al-Balah City Gaza strip. She is working hard to ensure a good life for her father and mother and ensure that they do not need anything. Ghada's father is not able to work. She wants to help him in any way she can and because she is a very productive and ambitious woman, she decided to open her own business. Ghada started her business one years ago.

She sews clothes to sell. After she felt that she had a good experience in this business, she decided to expand and develop her work. Therefore she applied for a loan to help her buy a new sewing machine and yarns and fabrics to increase her income. She needs your support to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine and yarns and fabrics to increase her income

loans.name: Neizel

texts.en:
Neizel hails from the town of Loon, Bohol. She has a two-year-old child. She owns a sari-sari(variety) store, selling assorted canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, insect repellent, coffee, biscuits and soft drinks.
Her partner in life has also an income that could help defray the family's expenses.

She decided to avail a loan to buy assorted groceries like beverages, assorted goods, soft drinks and toiletries. With the presence of these, she could maximize its resources, enabling her to maintain the flow of its merchandise. Thus, she could start to save and invest any possible business to become productive.

Neizel is doing her best to continue support her business to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries like beverages, assorted goods, soft drinks and toiletries

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a Kiva borrower. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be competent. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are regular. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Marie Emile

texts.fr: Marie Emile a 41 ans. Elle a deux enfants et est séparée. Elle vend des sandales depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle demande un microcrédit pour proposer à ses clients une plus grande variété de produits. A l’avenir, Marie Emile espère continuer à gérer son activité et gagner davantage d’argent afin d’offrir une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Marie Emile is 41 years old. She has two children and is separated. She has been selling sandals for over twenty years. She is asking for a micro-loan to offer her customers a larger variety of products. For the future, Marie Emile hopes to continue to manage her business and earn more money, so as to provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sandals

loans.name: Mona

texts.fr: Mona a 40 ans. Elle est divorcée et elle a quatre enfants dont deux sont scolarisés. Les deux autres ont moins de cinq ans, ce qui est en dessous de l’âge de scolarisation obligatoire en Haïti. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, Mona vend des légumes. Elle travaille dur pour offrir une bonne condition de vie à ses enfants. Elle demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock et être toujours en mesure de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en: Mona is 40 years old. She is divorced, and she has four children, of whom two are in school. The two others are younger than five, which is the required school age in Haiti. To support her family, Mona sells vegetables. She works hard to provide good living conditions for her children. She is asking for a micro-loan to increase her inventory and to be able to responding to customer needs at all times.

loans.use: to purchase bags of vegetables

loans.name: Anadie

texts.en:
Her name is Anadie, 39 years old, from the province of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Emanuel, a tricycle driver, and they have they have four children, two are still studying and the other two are already working. No matter how hard life is the couple do their best to make ends meet and give their children education.

Anadie has a tricycle which her husband drives. A tricycle is a motorcycle with a side car that carries around four passengers. It is a common means of transportation in the Philippines and serves as a kind of taxi for short distance travel. A proper and regular maintenance of her tricycle is necessary to ensure efficient and safe service, in view of this she is humbly seeking your help in the amount of 10000 to pay for spare parts and materials needed to maintain her tricycle.

She aims to acquire a van for additional transportation service. Her precious dream is to send all her children to College. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts an other materials for her tricycle's maintenance.

loans.name: Jecel

texts.en:
This young entrepreneur is named Jecel from Naga City, Cebu. She has learned the business of making and selling hanging rice from her mother-in-law who has been in that business for 20 years already. Jecel just started five years ago and she is happy that she can supplement her husband’s income. They are raising three small children, and they want to save enough for the increasing educational expenses.

Hanging rice is called “puso” in Cebu, Philippines. It is boiled rice enclosed in woven coconut leaves, which are usually displayed hanging in the markets or along streets in Cebu. It is famous for travelers because they won’t need a spoon and fork to eat this. They will just open the woven casing and they can bite the rice without mess. Others buy “puso” as a packed meal for school, workplace or trips. Jecel noticed this need of travelers and commuters; hence she was encouraged to venture in this kind of business. Her stall is located in the public market of Naga City, Cebu.

Jecel would like to buy additional sacks of rice and beverages that will surely enhance her profit. She needs PHP 50,000 supplemental capital for these. She is contemplating on other possible businesses that may be prolific for this coming Christmas season. She gets valuable ideas from her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative who meet every week. They share stories about their lives and businesses, and inspire each other by reflecting on the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice and beverages.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman who has two children. She describes herself to be God-fearing. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be power outages.

She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Sumber Usaha Group

texts.en:
After six months maintaining the pigs, the Sumber Usaha group payed off the loan to MUK. This time is the right time to sell the pigs, because it’s near the holiday and the price for pig is very expensive. They all sold the pigs together to the big buyer and earned a satisfied profit. Ni Wayan sold her pigs and all the profit will use to purchase feed and renovate the pig pens. She wants to increase the population of her pigs. Ni Wayan has a plan to increase the quality of her pigs by give them nutritious feed and vitamins and she hopes she can earn more profit.

To increase the business, The Sumber Usaha group continued to borrow the loan from MUK with the same loan size. They feel comfortable to have the loan, because they also have trained by the MUK's staff. The member of Sumber Usaha group consist of 9 women who are not only pig breeders. They also have other businesses, such as small kiosk, farmer, religious articles seller, even as a teacher. The loan is use to support their businesses.

She hopes the business will grow and she will become a successful pig breeder .

loans.use: to purchase superior feed and for renovation of the pig pens.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy soaps, toothpaste, oils, fabric softeners, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Pojoaju Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Kuña Pojoaju” está en su 3º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, a través del cual quieren ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
Cada una pone todo de si y su mayor entusiasmo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias, entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Julia, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, comenta que por medio de su humilde trabajo se ha ido ganando el sustento diario, y aunque es muy difícil hoy por hoy se esfuerza para poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de jeans, camisas, remeras, pantalones, blusas y otros, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus ventas, y cumpliendo con sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Pojoaju” group is on its 3rd cycle of the women's committee program. They are committed to work and help one another succeed. They are participating in the elimination of poverty survey to learn more about their living conditions and their families'.
Every one of them gives it all and they are very excited to be able to improve their living conditions. Julia stands out. She sells apparel clothing and she says that with this humble work she's been able to earn her daily living. Although it's hard, she puts in the effort to continue helping her family.
She is asking for this loan to invest in jeans, shirts, t-shirts, slacks, blouses and other items, increase her sales and keep up with her customers. She is thankful for this opportunity to be able to continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shirts, t-shirts, slacks, blouses and other items

loans.name: Nadienne

texts.fr: Nadienne a 26 ans, elle est célibataire et elle n’a pas d’enfant. Elle gère une petite activité dans laquelle elle vend des légumes, des épices et divers produits. Cela fait plus de deux ans qu’elle gère ce commerce. Elle demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Nadienne is 26 years old. She is unmarried and has no children. She manages a small-scale business selling vegetables, spices, and general goods. She has been managing this business for over two years. She is asking for a micro-loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is married, 25 years of age and lives in Tagulo, SND. LDN. together with his five children. Vicente is operating a sari-sari store to earn a living. He has been in this business for ten years and he earns 5000 PHP every month.

He is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase supplementary goods for his general store. He joined GDMPC in 2014. In the future, Vicente will use his income to support his five children in their studies until they finish college and in their daily needs. Vicente wishes that his business will be more progressive.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for store to sell.

loans.name: Barno

texts.en:
Barno childhood has always lived in a village, where her parents were hardworking and industrious people. They had an animal husbandry business and she helped them. So, she had much experience in this field before she began her business. 1 year ago she started own business deal because she has 2 children and they demand year by year more and more.

Barno buys cows, feeds some months and sells in a local market. She lives in a village and has a good opportunity to develop this business. Barno grows feeds for cows on her land and her husband helps her with feeding cows.

Barno is asking for a loan of 4000 Somoni to buy more cows for increasing her working capital. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cows for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open another salon.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Forty-nine-year old Avelina runs a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells basic house hold commodities such as coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, tooth paste, fabric conditioner and variety of canned goods.
She has five children. Her oldest child is 24 while the youngest is 14.

She has been serving neighbors and local settlers for 2 years now. She is facing financial shortages that could prevent her to improve her business. She decided to join CEVI to access loans.

Avelina is asking for a loan to buy grocery items like beverages, condiments and dry goods. With these, it helps enhance the inventory and attract potential customers to shop. These are vital, that serves the main fuel for her livelihood. Thus, she could able to settle her obligation and start to expand.

Avelina is determined that she could make it to be more productive to improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items  like beverages, condiments and dry goods

loans.name: Hadad

texts.en:
Hadad is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows and also poultry. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more farm inputs. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes Pearl

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes is thankful for the loan that was granted to her by Kiva's lenders for it has helped finance and sustain her direct selling thus she is able to send her children to school and meet the family's daily living expenses.

She trusts that you could again lend her funds in the amount of PHP 20,000 to pay for the advance orders of her clients for personal products such as whitening soaps, cleanser, toner, moisturizer, sunblock, and some bags and wallet. She thanks Kiva and its supporters for supporting her in her livelihood. Her business means a lot to her for it helps fund the school needs of her three children.

Ma. Lourdes aims to put up a boutique to attract more clients. It is every mother's desire to send all her children to college to allow their children better opportunities in life. Every week she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for several sets of beauty products, bags and wallets as well to sell.

loans.name: Song's Group

texts.en: Song’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Song makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Santa Catalina” está en su 8º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y también para poder ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Julia, quien en su  encuesta mostró estar en un novel extremo de indicadores de pobreza, ella es por eso que se unió al grupo, para poder capacitarse y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Julia se dedica a la venta de comidas variadas que ella misma se encarga de hacer y vender por su propio barrio, ella tiene muy buenos clientes que siempre compran de ella las delicias que hace.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, panificados y otros, de manera a poder continuar con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo y mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The “Santa Catalina” group is in its 8th cycle of the women's committee program. They are participating in the elimination of poverty survey. They work hard to improve their living conditions and to be able to help their families.
One of their members, Julia, showed an extreme level of poverty in the survey, and she decided to join the group to be able to receive training, improve her living conditions and her family's. Julia sells a variety of meals that she prepares and sells around the neighborhood. She has very good customers and they always seek the meals that she prepares.
She is asking for this loan to make meals like vegetables, meat, spices, bread and other items to continue working the same way she's been doing so and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, spices, bread and other supplies to make meals to sell

loans.name: Mujeres De Barcelona Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres de Barcelona está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante., se fijaron como meta el crecimiento de cada una, no solo en lo económico sino también como persona. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Buenaventura, ella es una persona muy sacrificada, que todos los días empieza su trabajo desde muy temprano en la mañana, se sacrifica para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de sus ingresos y su trabajo. Ella se dedica a la venta de empandas que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender por su barrio.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar harina, huevo, condimentos, pollo, jamón y queso, y otros productos para poder hacer sus empanadas, y seguir deleitando de esa manera a sus clientes con todo lo que esta haciendo.
texts.en:
The group named Mujeres de Barcelona is in its second cycle of the program of the communal bank of women, in which all of them work and are helped to move forward. The growth of each woman was fixed as a goal, and not only their economic growth but also their growth as a person. They are doing a survey for the elimination of poverty, to be able to improve their life conditions and that of their families.

One of the members is Mrs. Buenaventura. She is a self-sacrificing person, who begins her work very early in the morning everyday. She sacrifices to be able to help her family through her income and her work. She makes a living by selling empanadas which she makes herself and later goes out to sell in her neighborhood. 

She requests this loan to be able to buy flour, eggs, seasoning, chicken, ham and cheese, and other products to be able to make her empanadas, and continue delighting her customers in this manner with all that she is doing.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, seasoning, chicken, ham and cheese, and other products to make empanadas to sell.

loans.name: Baraka

texts.en:
Baraka is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be motorcycle break down. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. He hopes that in the future he will educate his children to university level.

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to add a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Sayly

texts.en:
Sayly was born in the year 1990. She is a young and industrious woman. Sayly is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a doctor. Sayly has her own business deal with farming. She has been busy with this business for more than 5 years. Sayly grows a variety vegetables such as onion, potatoes, carrot, cabbage and etc. Sayly also grows cotton. She works hard every day and she likes to work in the field. Sayly’s family member helps her with managing the business.

Sayly is going to start the autumn season's sowing and with this aim she is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel for the autumn sowing season.

She awaits your mercy and in advance thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel for the autumn sowing season.

loans.name: Florence

texts.fr: Florence a 28 ans. Elle vit en union libre et elle a deux enfants. Elle vend des produits alimentaires pour subvenir aux besoins sa famille et assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock et répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle. À l’avenir, elle espère attirer plus de clients.
texts.en: Florence is 28 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage, and she has two children. She sells grocery items to support her family and to ensure her children’s education. Florence is asking for a micro-loan to increase her inventory and respond to customer demands. For the future, she hopes to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase cases of spaghetti.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
A Senhora Amelia vive na casa propria com o esposo e dois filhos maiores de idade e três netos. Ela é comerciante e tem um estabelecimento comercial. Com o presente empréstimo ela pretende adiquirir material de construção nomeadamente (cimento, blocos e ferro) para iniciar com a construção de uma padaria. 
O seu sonho é ter a padaria a operar e para a realização do presente sonho teve que recorrer a um financiamento devido as dificuldades financeiras para concretização do mesmo.
texts.en:
Amelia lives in her own home with her husband, two adult children and three grandchildren.

Amelia is a trader and runs a store. With this loan she plans to buy building materials, namely cement, concrete blocks and iron, to begin building a bakery.

Amelia's dream is to open a bakery. However, due to financial difficulties she has to take out a loan to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy cement, concrete blocks and iron.

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en:
Eduard is a married man, owns and operates a three wheel transportation for taxi service for many years to earn a living. He had support the family's daily needs with this income, aside from working in a private company. while he works in the day time and after his shift he does transportation services to earn extra money.

Recently, he took a new loan to buy tires and repair his three wheel transportation to commute between his workplace and to other village near town. He plans to buy another unit for his motor for expansion of his business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for repair.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan con 35 años,de estado civil casado, vive junto a su esposa e hijos, en el distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú,en una zona rural.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro hace 11 años.Solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos y para invertir en el mantenimiento de su finca.De esta manera podrá obtener mayores rendimientos.

Juan es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.Ha manejado créditos los cuáles los canceló de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Juan is 35 years old, and is married. He lives with his wife and children, in the Pucará district, Jaén province, Cajamarca department, in rural Peru. The inhabitants of this area work mostly in agriculture, in trade, and with livestock. 

Juan is a farmer, in specific a coffee farmer. He has 11 years of experience in this business. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizers, and to invest in the maintenance of his farm. This way, he can earn better earnings.

Juan is a recurring member of Kiva Field Partner Edpyme Alternativa. He has taken out prior loans, which he has repaid on time.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to invest in the maintenance of his farm.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man. He has one child. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, rice, salt, flour, bread and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are regular. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, salt, bread and flour. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, salt, bread and flour.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is deeply encouraged by Kiva and its lenders for their kind hearts for lending her funds several times in the past, which really helped sustain and grow her rag and doormat making business and her variety store. It has encouraged her to be more diligent in growing her business and she is forever grateful for your help.

Once again she trusts that you could lend her funds in the amount of PHP 25,000 to refill her store with more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda and rice noodles and to partly pay for cloth, thread and needles needed for sewing rags and doormats. The income she derives covers their daily household and school needs of her children.

She aims to put up a bigger store to sell groceries and display her doormats and rags. Every week she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jacques

texts.fr: Jacques est âgé de 38 ans. Il est marié et n’a pas encore d’enfants. Il fait le commerce de vêtements d’occasion dans un espace qu’il a affermé au marché de Petit-goave. Cela fait 10 ans déjà. Il a bénéficié auparavant de prêts qui lui ont permis de faire fonctionner davantage son commerce. Jacques souhaite augmenter son revenu et s’offrir de meilleures opportunités dans le secteur. Sachant qu’il a une forte demande auprès de sa clientèle, il a sollicité un microcrédit afin d’augmenter son stock de marchandises.
texts.en: Jacques is 38 years old. He is married and has no children yet. For ten years now, he has been doing commerce in used clothing in a space he leased at the Petit-goave market. He has benefited in the past from loans, which enabled him to operate his business better. Jacques would like to increase his revenues and provide better opportunities in the sector. Knowing he has strong demand from his customer base, he is requesting a micro-loan to increase his stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothing.

loans.name: Travelian

texts.en: Travelian is a divorced man. He has three children. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. He will use the anticipated profits to open a new business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be humble. He operates a butchery. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. His business goal is to own a wholesale business within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat

loans.name: Edeline

texts.fr: Edeline est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle tient une boutique à domicile. Elle y vend des produits alimentaires, cosmétiques, et des sous-vêtements. Cela fait déjà dix ans qu’elle a mis sur pie cette petite entreprise. Elle y gagne des revenus qui lui permettent de prendre soin de sa famille et de faire un peu d’économie. Mais son rêve est de développer cette activité et maximiser ses bénéfices. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter un stock de produits cosmétiques et des lots de chemisettes.
texts.en: Edeline is 53 years old. She is the married mother of five and has a shop in her home. There, she sells grocery items, cosmetic products, and undergarments.
