She set up this small enterprise ten years ago. She saves income from it, thus enabling her to care for her family and save a little money. But her dream is to develop this business and maximize her profits. She is asking for a loan to purchase a stock of cosmetics and some short-sleeve shirts.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of cosmetic products

loans.name: Hồng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hồng is 39 years old and she is married. She has been operating a food stall selling snacks for 12 years.

Hồng lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Hồng faces is lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to expand her business and increase her income by purchasing more ingredients to cook and sell.

In 2014, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Since then, her life has been increased much. She is the group leader of a four-member group.

In the future, Hồng hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to expand her business and increase her income by purchasing more ingredients to cook and sell.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a married man with four children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a dairy farm. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of farm inputs. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of farm inputs

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen has been raising hogs for more than 10 years now. These serve as the family's main source of income. She is married and has five children. Her youngest child is 18 and still attending college.
Her biggest expenses come from food and school expenses.

Belen needs the loan to buy piglets and pig feed. With these, she will have adequate supply of feeds that are vital in her business. Thus, she will be able to raise quality hogs, enabling her income to increase.

In the future, Belen hopes to expand her project by increasing the number of livestock.

Belen thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Alexinah

texts.en: Alexinah is a married woman with five children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a farm where she keeps cows and sheep. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be having fewer sheep. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more sheep. Her business goal is to own five dairy cows within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy more sheep

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a Kiva borrower. He has three children. He describes himself as hardworking. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his vehicle. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are the general public. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to repair the motor vehicle. He hopes that in the future, he will have increased income. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to repair the motor vehicle

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be faithful. He operates a restaurant. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. His business goal is to have a big hotel within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Ka Laug Ta Yar Village Group

texts.en:
The Ka Laug Ta Yar group members are very thankful for their village's first loan from the Kiva community. Featured borrower Hla and her team members used their loans to expand their duck business by purchasing additional ducks. A few members used funds to cover daily expenses. Kiva's loan freed village members from taking on other loans with much higher interest rates. Instead of paying higher interest rates, village members were able to reinvest more funds into their duck business, which increased their overall income.

The next loan will help 30 members to expand their duck businesses by purchasing more ducklings and duck feed. They are excited to continue to grow with the support of the Kiva community to improve their family's ability to purchase necessities like nutritious food, and support their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase ducks as well as high-quality feed.

borrowers.first_name: Ka Laug Ta Yar Village Group

loans.name: Harilalao

texts.fr:
Harilalao a 39 ans, Elle est mariée et son mari l’appuie dans l'exercice de son activité. Le couple a 3 enfants (20-18-12 ans) successivement en classe de terminale, première et quatrième. 
Harilalao exerce l’activité de boucherie, spécialité HALAL (pas de vente de viande de porcs) depuis 2013. Avant, elle aidait sa sœur dans l’activité de gargote. L’idée de s’adonner à l’activité de boucherie était née suite à un conseil d’un membre de la famille : approvisionnement en viande de bœuf des boucheries du quartier à l’aide d’un fonds encore minime. Le marché est sûr. En raison de la hausse du prix de la viande, elle a besoin de beaucoup plus de fonds pour l’approvisionnement. L’objectif est de pouvoir acquérir une tête de bœufs à l’approvisionnement afin d’éviter de payer les frais de transport à chaque approvisionnement. Le développement de l’activité dépend de la quantité et de la qualité de la viande offerte aux clients.
Le couple est propriétaire du local où vit la famille, leur rêve est de pouvoir agrandir la maison, et continuer à éduquer leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Harilalao is 39 years old. She is married, and her husband helps her operate her business. The couple have three children (aged 20, 18, and 12), who are in the 12th, 11th, and 8th grades, respectively.

Harilalao has been operating a butcher shop since 2013 and specializes in halal (no sales of pork). Before, she used to help her sister at a diner [food service]. The idea of devoting her time to a butcher shop came out of advice from a family member: stocking up on beef from butcher shops in the district with the help of a still-tiny fund.

The market is steady. Given the rise in meat prices, she needs a lot more funds for stocking up. The goal is to acquire a steer as a supply source, so as to avoid paying the transport costs of fresh supplies. The development of the business depends on the quantity and quality of the meat offered to the customers.

The couple own a place where the family lives. Their dream is to expand the house and continue to educate their children.

loans.use: to purchase 100 kg of beef.

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.pt:
Tem 34 anos de idade, mãe de 4 filhos ainda menores e todos com acesso a educação, estudou ate 9ª classe, vive na casa propria a base de negocio que faz a mais de 10 anos de compra e venda de produtos e confecção de alimentos, conta com ajuda do esposo trabalhador da saude. Está a repetir o credito pela segunda vez e com o primeiro investiu no negocio e reembolsou com algumas dificuldades, contudo, lhe foi concedida mais uma chance.
Com o valor do emprestimo, pretende comprar carnes, frangos, bebidas diversas, etc, para ampilar o seu negocio que faz num estabelecimento dentro do mercado.Seu sonho  de poder desenvolver mais o seu negocio.
Seu desafio e a concorrência e a tendência de subida de preços.
texts.en:
Milagrosa is 34 years old and a mother to four young children, all of whom have access to education. She studied up until Year 9 and lives in her own house where she has run a business for over 10 years, buying and selling products and making food. She is also helped by her husband who is a health worker.

Milagrosa is taking out a loan for the second time. She invested her first loan in her business which she repaid with some difficulties, nevertheless she has been given another chance. With the money from this loan she plans to buy meat, chicken and a variety of drinks to expand her business which she runs from a market store. Her dream is to further expand her business. Her challenges are the competition and the tendency for prices to rise.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken and a variety of drinks to expand her store.

loans.name: Felistus

texts.en:
Felistus is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to own a wholesale business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Uraloy

texts.en: Uraloy is a single woman. She was born in 1994. Uraloy has a kind heart and she always helps her parents. She has higher education. Uraloy works in a school. She is a teacher of small grades. Uraloy likes her job and does it with pleasure. She has additional income from buying and selling nuts because her salary is small. Uraloy works hard and her kidneys are ill. She must treat them. Kiva lenders are the only ones who can help her. That’s why she is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment of her kidneys. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment of her kidneys.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
José ya ha formado su propia familia, vive en casa familiar, trabaja todos los días en el campo, cultiva principalmente maíz y frijol, pudo fundar su propio negocio hace aproximadamente 10 años y utilizo el capital propio para emprenderlo.
Invertirá en insumos agrícolas como: abono, herbicidas y semilla mejorada de granos básicos, tendrá a su alcance todo lo necesario para preparar el terreno y sembrar en el tiempo justo con lo que espera tener una cosecha abundante.
Juan aspira seguir trabajando para cumplir con sus obligaciones y ganar popularidad con su negocio en la zona.
texts.en:
José has started his own family, and lives in his family home. He works every day in the fields. He mainly grows corn and beans. He was able to start his own business about 10 years ago, using his own funds.

He will invest in agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, herbicides, and improved basic grains seeds. He will have everything he needs to prepare the land and sow the seeds at the right time, and is expecting an abundant harvest.

Juan aspires to continue to working to fulfill his obligations and gain local recognition for his business.

loans.use: to invest in agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved basic grains seeds.

loans.name: Ishingane Group

texts.fr:
Concilie  fait partie du groupe  Ishingane et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 46 ans et est mariée à Jacques, un infirmier. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 7 à 25 ans, dont  2 étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge 1 enfant orphelin. 

Elle fait le commerce de   haricot  depuis  17 ans. 

Elle est à son sixième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de haricot à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Concilie is part of the group Ishingane and lives in Gitega. She is 46 years old and married to Jacques, a nurse. Together they have five children, from 7 to 25 years old, of whom two are students.

Concilie has in her care one child, an orphan. She has been doing commerce in beans for seventeen years.

She is on her 6th loan at Turame. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of beans to resell, so as to earn more.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of beans to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Suleiman is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Suleiman would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Suleiman will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium, up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/hectare, Suleiman now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en:
Mustapha is maize farmer from Chiroma village. As a member of Babban Gona, Mustapha is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mustapha would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mustapha can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Mustapha is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family. In the end, he hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Xai-Xai província de gaza, tem 38 anos de idade, é solteira mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 1 menor de idade, responsabiliza-se pela sua sobrinha qua vive em sua casa.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2012, este é o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku com qual pretende adquirir um congelador para sua casa.
Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra de residência e ampliar o seu negócio de criação de frangos. O seu maior desafio é manter o seu negócio como base de sustentabilidade.
texts.en:
Isabel was born in Xai-Xai in the province of Gaza. She is 38 years old and a single mother to four children, one of whom is still a minor. She is also responsible for a niece who lives with her.

Isabel began working with Hluvuku in 2012. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku with which she plans to buy a freezer for her house.

In the future Isabel plans to finish building her home and expand her business raising chickens. Her main challenge is to keep her business sustainable.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for her house.

loans.name: Jacqueline Cristela

texts.es:
Jacqueline, de 19 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja para una empresa distribuidora de golosinas, vive junto a su mamá y su prima.

Jacqueline, vende prendas de fantasía y de acero inoxidable como aretes, pulsoras y collares, este negocio lo inició junto a su madre, pero ahora que está esperando un bebé decidió independizarse, el negocio lo abre desde tempranas horas de la mañana y desde su casa promociona sus productos.

Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como cremas y lociones, porque en ocasiones algunos clientes le piden otros estilos de productos que ella no tiene y por ese motivo quiere surtir más el negocio.

Jacqueline, sueña con que su negocio prospere, para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y también sueña con graduarse de la carrera Licenciatura en Administración de Empresas.
texts.en:
Nineteen year old Jacqueline is an enterprising woman. She studied until high school and her partner works for a candy distributor and lives with his mother and cousin.

Jacqueline sells fancy jewelry and stainless steel jewelry such as earrings, bracelets and necklaces. She started this business with her mother, but now that she is expecting a baby she decided to become independent. She opens her business early in the morning and promotes her products from home.

She needs this loan to purchase more merchandise such as creams and lotions since sometimes clients ask for other types of products that she doesn't have. For this reason, she wants to augment her business' merchandise. Jacqueline dreams of her business prospering in order to offer a better quality of life to her child. She also dreams of graduating with a degree in business administration.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as creams and lotions.

loans.name: Guedalia Group

texts.fr: Madeleine est une femme âgée de 26 ans mariée mère de 2 enfants dont 1 scolarisé. Elle exerce son activité depuis deux ans. ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est son dynamise et son courage, son amour de son travail, le respect et l'écoute de sa clientèle. Elle veut acheter 50 000 f des hauts d'habits,  acheter des pagnes à 25 000 f  et acheter 25 000 f d'habits d'enfants. L'utilité du prêt c'est de pouvoir s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin de renforcer son activité. elle a déjà reçu le prêt 2 fois et à rembourser aux bonnes dates.
texts.en: Madeleine is a 26-year-old woman and the married mother of two children, of whom one is in school. Madeleine has been operating her business for two years. What drives her business is her energy, courage, love of work, and the respect and attention for her customers. She wants to purchase 50,000 francs of [shirts and other tops]; some 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) worth 25,000 francs; and 25,000 francs of children’s clothing. The loan use is for stocking up on enough inventory for bolstering her business. She has already received a loan twice before and has paid them back on time.

loans.use: to purchase [shirts and other tops]; some 'pagne' cloth; and children's clothing.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married mother of 2 children. She describes herself as patient. She operates a retail business where she sells clothing. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her customers are of all types.

Joyce describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the 99,000 KES loan to buy more inventory of clothing and shoes. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business.

This Joyce's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a Kiva borrower. He has 2 children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a butcher shop which he has been involved in for 2 years. His business is located in an area with potential.

Paul will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more goat meat. His business goal is to be an exporter of meat within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will have a stable business.

This is Paul's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to open another butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy more goat meat.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a married man, and he has one child. He describes himself as honest. He operates a barber shop which he has been involved in for 3 years.

Jackson describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use this 20,000 KES loan to buy barber shop equipment.

Jackson hopes that in the future he will be prosperous. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy barber shop equipment.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a married man, and he has 2 children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His primary customers are locals.

Robert describes his biggest business challenge to be high fuel prices. He will use this 20,000 KES loan to service and maintain his motorcycle.

Robert hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Leopoldina

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Inhambane tem 40 anos de idade, viúva mãe de 6 filhos apenas 2 são maiores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2012, este é o seu 6º empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende efectuar pagamentos despesas escolares para os seus filhos.
Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra de residência para dar conforto a sua família e ampliar o seu negócio de venda de produtos de beleza.
texts.en:
Leopoldina was born in Inhambane and is 40 years old. She is the widowed mother of six children of whom just two are adults. All her children go to school and she is not responsible for anyone else.

Leopoldina began working at Hluvuku in 2012. This is her sixth loan with Hluvuku which she plans to use to pay her children's school fees.

In the future she would like to finish building her home to make her family more comfortable and to expand her business selling beauty products.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is a married man. He has seven children. He describes himself to be innovative. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, bread, flour, salt, cooking oil and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, flour, salt, cooking fat, rice, sugar and other items. His business goal is to own a wholesale business within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, flour, salt, cooking fat, rice, sugar and other items

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos con 36 años de edad, de estado civil casado,vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su esposa e hijos,en el distrito de Pimpingos,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Santos cuenta con buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Santos se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de cafeto,variedad Catimor, resistente a enfermedades y plagas, plantación, está en tercer año de producción, tiene cuatro años de edad,con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 5 años. Adicionalmente cría ganado vacuno, contando a la fecha con 1 res de su propiedad, así mismo cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátano, vituca). El destino del crédito sera para mantenimiento y cultivo de café en producción, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2016, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Santos es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Santos is 36 years old, married, and lives in his own house made of simple materials. He lives with his wife and children in Pimpingos district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department, Peru. Santos has good work and personal references from the inhabitants of the area. People in this area work primarily in farming, business, and livestock.

Santos farms, specifically Catimor variety of coffee, which is resistant to infestations and plagues. He is in his 3rd year of production, and his plants are 4 years old; he has 5 years of experience in this work. In addition he raises cattle, and has at the moment 1 steer. He also raises small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and others) and grows daily needs crops (yucca, plantain). The loan will be used to perform maintenance and grow coffee crop, ensuring a good production in the 2016 season which will be reflected in the greater volume of sales resulting in greater income in order to improve his quality of life.

Santos is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to perform maintenance and grow a crop of coffee, ensuring a good production in the 2016 season.

loans.name: Reina De Jesus

texts.es:
Reina, de 51 años de edad, solo estudio hasta tercer grado, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijas y su esposo trabaja como fontanero.

Reina, administra una tienda que anteriormente era de su suegra, ella decidió administrarla porque su suegra se dedicó a vender ropa; sus pequeñas niñas le ayudan en la tienda, la cual abre todos los días a las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 6:00 p.m.

Reina, necesita el préstamo para surtir la tienda con productos de primera necesidad, con el financiamiento logrará incrementar sus ventas y de igual forma sus ingresos.

El sueño de Reina, es tener una tienda grande para vender más y atender a sus clientes de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Reina is 51 years old and only studied up to Grade 3. She lives with her husband and her two daughters. Her husband works as a plumber.

Reina runs a store that used to belong to her mother-in-law. She decided to manage it as her mother-in-law works selling clothing. Her young children help her in the store which is open every day from 6 am until 6 pm.

Reina needs the loan to stock her store with basic food products. With this financing she can manage to increase her sales as well as her income.

Reina"s dream is to have a large store and serve her clients in the best manner.

loans.use: to stock her store with basic food products.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is business woman. She is applying for a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a kiosk which she has been involved with since 2013; she started her business with her own working capital of $400.

Paulina is earning a good income from her kiosk. She will use her loan to buy some additional supplies to stock her kiosk such as detergent, sugar, cooking oils, slippers, cigarettes, coffee, snack, biscuits, noodles, soft drinks, and other things to sell.

Because many people like to buy her goods, she is is very happy to do her business. She also keeps animals such as cows, pigs, and chickens.

loans.use: to buy detergent, sugar, cooking oils, slippers, cigarettes, coffee, snacks, biscuits, noodles, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
For the past 15 years, Antonio has owned a sari-sari (variety) store and sold goods ranging from eggs, seasonings, edible oil, assorted canned goods, biscuits, shampoo, toothpaste and soft drinks. He is a married man and has two grown children.

He would like to develop ways to make his business more sustainable. He has very limited funds to continue operating his livelihood. He decided to request a loan to purchase a variety of stock like beverages, condiments and toiletries. With the presence of these, he could maximize his resources, enabling him to maintain the flow of merchandise.

Antonio is looking forward to handling his livelihood as to become successful in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy assorted grocery items like beverages, condiments and toiletries

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente está solicitando un nuevo crédito porque no cuenta con la liquidez necesaria para fortalecer su negocio, debido a que los ingresos son de subsistencia, comprara cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos, de esta manera permanecerá trabajando y atiendo a sus clientes.
El financiamiento anterior ha sido una herramienta muy importante para don Vicente, pues así ha logrado que su negocio permanezca funcionando, las circunstancias familiares se mantienen.
texts.en:
Vicente is applying for a new loan because he doesn't have the necessary funds available to give his business a boost since he lives off his income. He plans to buy pigs and extract to feed them so that he can keep working and attend to his customers.

His last loan was very important for Vicente because he was able to keep his business running and his family afloat.

loans.use: to buy pigs and extract to feed them so that he can keep working and attend to his customers.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a maize farmer from Gari village. As a Babban Gona member, Adamu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Adamu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Adamu will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Adamu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/ha, Adamu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lucia Margarita

texts.es: Lucia vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo y venta de flores Ginger desde hace mas de 10 años y es gracias a su trabajo como logra solventar algunos de los gastos de su hogar, comercializa sus plantas con las floristerias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas flores mayor para seguir cultivando y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Lucia lives in her own home with her life partner and their two children. She has worked growing and selling ginger flowers for over ten years and it is thanks to her work that she is able to cover some of the expenses of her home. She sells her plants to the florists found near her place of residence. She is requesting a loan to buy more wholesale flowers to continue growing and in that way be able to have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale flowers.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman. She describes herself to be ambitious.

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, cooking oil, eggs, bread, flour, salt, soda and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, cooking oil, bread, flour and other items.

Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children to the university level.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, cooking oil, bread, flour and other items.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be honest.

He operates a farm where he keeps sheep for wool and meat production. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be fewer sheep. He will use the 15,000 KES loan to buy more sheep.

His business goal is to buy dairy cows within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more sheep

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: To earn a living, Felisa is engaged in the hog raising business. She is a 57-year-old woman from Mahaplag, Leyte and a mother of two adult children. Felisa has been engaged in this business of raising pigs for eight years. In the future, she wants to improve her business so she could build her own big piggery. As for now, Felisa is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional piglets to raise and to pay for feed.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and to pay for feed

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a single woman. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a retail business where she sells shoes, clothes and curtains. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of shoes and clothes.

She hopes that in the future, she will open more business outlets. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Claudia Lisseth

texts.es:
Claudia, de 28 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora, estudió hasta bachillerato, está separada de su esposo por situaciones personales que no pudieron solucionar, vive junto a su madre, sus hermanos y su hijito de apenas un año de edad.

Claudia, se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace un año, ella lo inicio después de separarse de su esposo, pero ha tenido diferentes empleos, anteriormente trabajó para una financiera y cuatro años en una empresa de revelado de fotografías, sin embargo ha tenido que luchar desde que es una mujer independiente, pero Dios le ha dado fuerzas para seguir adelante. 

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar más ropa para vender, porque se acerca la temporada de fin de año y muchas personas optan por comprar ropa nueva y no quiere perder está oportunidad para vender sus productos.

Claudia, sueña con lograr que su hijo llegue a ser un hombre ejemplar para la sociedad.
texts.en:
Claudia is 28 years old and a determined woman. She has a high school education and is separated from her husband because of personal circumstances that they couldn't solve. She lives with her mother, siblings and her small son who is barely a year old.

Claudia has been selling clothing for a year.  She started this business after separating from her husband but has had various jobs. Previously she worked at a financial institution, and for four years at a photo studio. She has had to struggle since she has been an independent woman, but God has given her strength to keep going.

The loan she is requesting is to buy more clothing to sell because the New Year's season is approaching, when many people choose to buy new clothes, and she doesn't want to lose this opportunity to sell her goods. Claudia dreams of seeing her son grows up to be an example for his community.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Edy Rafael

texts.es:
Edy, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está acompañado y se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, tiene dos hijos y su pareja se dedica a la venta de pupusas los fines de semana.

Edy, tiene una tienda de productos básicos y además se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería desde hace varios años, ya que su padre les enseño a trabajar en el campo y su esposa también se involucra en atender la tienda y en la venta de pupusas y de bebidas.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar ganado para repasto y obtener un ingreso extra que le ayude a darle mejores condiciones a su familia.

El sueño de Edy, es mejorar su vivienda y considera que con mucho trabajo lo podría lograr.
texts.en:
Edy, 33 years old, studied until second grade. He is married and works in agriculture and livestock. He has two children and his wife works selling pupusas on the weekend.

Edy has a small store of basic products and has also worked in agriculture and livestock for several years, since his parents taught him to work in the field. His wife also takes part in helping with the store and in selling pupusas and drinks.

The loan will be used to buy cattle for grazing to obtain extra income that will help him improve his family's living conditions.

Edy's dream is to improve his home and he believes that with a lot of work he will be able to achieve it.

loans.use: to buy cattle for grazing to obtain extra income.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita lives in Aileu. She is a tailor, and she is happy to do her activities. She said living in a town is very competitive in earning money, unless she can do some activities which are profitable in order to survive.

Looking for ways to earn money, Rita came out with an idea to do sewing for all people. She started doing her sewing in 2007 with her own working capital of $150.. 

Rita is applying a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin, because she wants to buy more materials like cotton sewing materials, sewing needles, and other materials she needs.

loans.use: to buy cotton sewing materials, sewing needles, and other material she needs for her sewing business..

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is a single man. He describes himself to be determined.

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high fuel costs. He will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were successfully repaid. He will use the anticipated profits to buy another motorcycle.

He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando con 30 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus hijos, en el distrito de Callayuc,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Rolando se dedica al cultivo de café,específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro hace más de 10 años.Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de abonos y invertir en el mantenimiento de su finca. De esta manera podrá adquirir mayores rendimientos.

Rolando es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.Ha manejado tres créditos los cuáles los canceló de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Rolando is 30 years old and lives in a common law marriage. He lives with his spouse and children in the Callayuc district in the province of Cutervo, which is in the Cajamarca department in Perú. The inhabitants of this town work primarily in agriculture, commerce and farming.

Rolando works cultivating coffee and has over ten years of experience in the business. He is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizers and in maintaining his property. In this way he can earn more income.

Rolando is a long-time member of Edpyme Alternativa. He has taken out three loans previously, which he paid back in a timely manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of fertilizers and invest in maintaining his farm.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as committed. 

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, salt, soda, and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of products. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, bread, flour, and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will have increased profits. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, bread, flour, and other items

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan con 37 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia, junto a su cónyuge e hijos en el distrito de Cañaris,provincia de Ferreñafe,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro hace 15 años.Solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos y para invertir en el mantenimiento de su finca. De esta manera podrá obtener mayores rendimientos.

Juan es socio reactivado para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Juan is 37 years old and is in a common-law marriage. He lives in his own home with his spouse and children in the district of Cañaris, in the Ferreñafe province of the Lambayeque department in Peru. The majority of the inhabitants of this location earn a living in farming, trade, and cattle raising.

Juan earns a living by farming, specifically growing coffee, and he has 15 years of experience in the industry. He is requesting a loan to buy compost and to invest in the maintenance of his land. In this way he will be able to obtain greater yields.

Juan is a reactivated member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy compost and to invest in the maintenance of his land.

loans.name: La Colina Group

texts.es:
Yolanda continúa con su negocio de venta de salteñas (al centro, viste solera blanca y calza negra). el crédito anterior lo utilizó para comprar un horno industrial, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo vender toda su producción. En esta oportunidad lidera la banca de emprendimiento. Su negocio es la venta de salteñas, las salteñas son empanadas tradicionales que se hornean su contenido es de carne de pollo y de res son merienda de media mañana, “horneo y salgo a vender todos los días…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de insumos de cocina como, harina, carne, condimentos y otros. Su sueño es tener una micro empresa de salteñas, ella desea comprar insumos de cocina por mayor  para producir en mayor cantidad. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Yolanda solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos de cocina por mayor para vender salteñas por mayor.
texts.en:
Yolanda (in the middle, wearing a white top and black pants) still has her business selling "salteñas," traditional baked empanadas filled with chicken and beef and eaten as a mid-morning snack. She used the previous loan to buy an industrial oven. She was punctual with her payments because she was able to sell all of her products.

This time she's the leader of the communal bank. Her business is selling salteñas. "Every day I bake and go out to make sales," she said.

The advantage of her business is making daily sales; the disadvantage, the lack of flour, meat, spices, and other cooking ingredients. Her dream is to have a small salteña business. She wants to buy cooking ingredients wholesale to make larger quantities. This is her second loan sequence with the institution in the four years she has been in this line of work.

For those reasons Yolanda's requesting a loan to buy cooking ingredients wholesale so she can sell salteñas in bulk.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients wholesale to sell empanadas in bulk

loans.name: Valentinus

texts.en:
Greetings from Valentinus in Flores, eastern Indonesia. 

Valentinus joined Kopernik’s tech agent network in January last year. He received training from Kopernik to develop his skills in selling green technologies such as water filters, solar lamps, and cookstoves in his community. 

Valentinus is a civil servant. He is excited to sell technologies to give his family additional income and also to help his community, which has little access to electricity or clean water.

Valentinus has successfully paid off his first loan and would like to expand his technology sales business. He would appreciate receiving another loan of IDR 10, 000,000 He is really excited to get more technology inventory and expand his market.

loans.use: to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters, and clean cookstoves to his community

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is married, with three children. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, cooking oil, bread, flour, salt, soda, and other items. 

He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, cooking oil, bread, flour, and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. 

Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, cooking oil, bread, flour, and other items

loans.name: Norwinah

texts.en:
Norwinah is 38 years old and married, with one child. 

She has operated her variety store for nine years. She would like to keep her business profitable.  That’s why she would like to borrow additional capital amounting to PHP 10,000. 

She will use this loan to buy soft drinks, snack foods, bottled water, canned goods, and other grocery items. 

She believes that she should be able to generate better income through this additional capital.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, snack foods, bottled water, canned goods, and other grocery items to sell

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en:
Gulsara was born in 1986. She is married and has two little children. Her husband is a kind man and always helps her. For more than eight years, Gulsara has had her own business selling women's underwear. Gulsara has a selling place in a local market. She always keeps a good assortment of goods, which is why she has regular customers.

Gulsara is going to buy goods to increase the assortment for the new season. In this way she will attract more customers. Gulsara is asking for a loan with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy women's underwear for the new season.

loans.name: Reina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Reina, de 45 años de edad, tiene muchos años de ser comerciante, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada, tiene tres hijos que actualmente asisten a la escuela y su pareja es panificador.
  
Reina, tiene una tienda desde hace siete años, pero también hace pupusas los fines de semana para vender, porque a ella siempre le ha gustado ganar su propio dinero y aportar para los gastos del hogar.

Reina, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos como: jabón, detergente, café, pan, arroz y frijoles para su tienda, para incrementar sus ventas y obtener mejores ingresos.

Ella, sueña con hacerle mejoras a su vivienda y ver a sus hijos crecer y graduarse de la universidad.
texts.en:
Reina is 45 years old and has been a small business owner for many years. She has a sixth grade education, Is married, and has three children who currently attend school. Her partner is a baker. 

Reina has had a store for seven years, but also makes pupusas (Salvadoran stuffed grilled tortillas) on weekends to sell, because she has always liked to earn her own money and contribute to the household expenses.

Reina needs the loan in order to buy products such as soap, detergent, coffee, rice and beans for her store, in order to increase her sales and obtain better income.

She dreams of making improvements to her home, and seeing her children grow up and graduate from university.

loans.use: to buy products such as soap, detergent, coffee, bread, rice and beans for her store.

loans.name: Eneyda Eunice

texts.es:
Eneyda, de 24 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, está acompañada y tiene una hija de siete años de edad y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura.

Eneyda, se dedica a los oficios del hogar y a cuidar a su hija, pero también realiza actividades agrícolas como siembra de hortalizas y también ayuda a su pareja en los trabajos agrícolas.

Eneyda, necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y de frijoles.

Ella sueña con ver  a su hija crecer y que siga estudiando para que en un futuro sea profesional.
texts.en:
Eneyda is 24 years old and a housewife. She is married and has a seven-year-old daughter. Her partner is a farmer.

Eneyda looks after the household tasks and cares for their daughter, but also does farm work such as growing vegetables, and helps her partner with the farming.

Eneyda need the loan in order to buy fertilizer for growing 7000 m² of corn and beans. She dreams of seeing her daughter grow up and continue studying so that she can be a professional in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for cultivating 7,000 square meters with corn and beans.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is 49 years old and the married father of four.  He is a Palestinian refugee. 

Five years ago, he opened an auto repair shop to cover the needs and expenses of his family. 

Reflecting the low social and financial place of Palestinians in Lebanon, he left school at early age and started working in car repair with his father's friend. He gained experience and professional skills in this domain.  His customers trust his work blindly. 

Wissam is working hard to develop his business.  Thus today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary tools to improve his business and provide his customers with better and quicker service. 

Wissam hopes to expand his business in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy tools to improve his auto-repair business and provide his customers with better and quicker service

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia has been involved in business activities since 2014. She started her business with her own working capital of $200. 

Amelia has a shop. So she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy more supplies of what people like, such as candies, eggs,  noodles, cooking oils, detergents, biscuits, cigarettes, coffee, pens, rice, slippers, and shampoo, including soft drinks and hard drinks. 

She is happy with the loan that Tuba Rai Metin offered, for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy candies, eggs, rice,  noodles, cooking oils, detergents, biscuits, cigarettes, coffee, pens, rice, slippers, shampoo, soft drinks, and hard drinks.

loans.name: Zenobio

texts.es:
Zenobio con 45 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su cónyuge e hijos ,en el distrito de Cañaris,provincia de Ferreñafe,país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Zenobio se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 10 años.Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de abonos y para el mantenimiento de su finca. De esta manera realizará mejoras e incrementará los rendimientos de su cultivo.

Zenobio es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.Ha manejado tres créditos los cuáles los canceló de forma puntual.
texts.en:
45-year-old Zenobio is in a civil union and lives together with his spouse and children in his own house made of rustic materials in Cañaris district, Ferreñafe province, in the country of Peru. The majority of this locality's residents earn a living at agriculture, commerce, and livestock.

Zenobio earns a living in agriculture, specifically coffee cultivation, with more than 10 years of experience in the field. He requests a loan for investing in buying fertilizers and for the maintenance of his farm. In this way, he will make improvements and will boost the outputs of his crops.

Zenobia is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa. He has handled three loans, which were paid off punctually.

loans.use: to invest in buying fertilizers and to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is married, with five children. She describes herself to be God-fearing. 

She operates a retail business where she sells bread, sugar, cereals, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of bread, flour, sugar, cereals, and other items. 

Her business goal is to open a supermarket within five years. She will use the anticipated profiits to open other business outlets.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bread, flour, sugar, cereals, and other items.

loans.name: Rosalío

texts.es:
Rosalio es un hombre de 23 años de edad, con una linda familia con la que vive en una comunidad del caserío el oratorio.
Rosalio cuenta que gracias a los créditos que ha tenido la oportunidad de acceder sus sueños ha ido realizando, cuenta que con el préstamo anterior pudo comprar sus materiales de construcción y la construcción de su casa comenzó, con este avance él está muy contento. Rosalio nuevamente se le presenta la necesidad de un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de semillas de papa y fertilizantes, con estos insumos Rosalio considera cultivar lo más pronto posible y obtener una buena cosecha.
Sus aspiraciones en la vida son, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia contando con su propia casa.
texts.en:
Rosalio is a 23-year-old man with a beautiful family whom he lives with in the community of the Oratorio hamlet.

Rosalio states that thanks to the loans, he has had the opportunity to access the dreams that he has been achieving. He says that with the previous loan he was able to buy his construction materials and the building of his house has begun, and he is very happy with this progress.

Rosalio has now been presented with a need for a loan that he will use to buy potato seeds and fertilizers. With these supplies, Rosalio wants to plant them as soon as possible and have a good harvest.

His life goals are to improve his family's quality of life by having his own home.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es: Julio de 66 años de edad vive en casa propia con grupo familiar, el se dedica desde hace mas de 30 años a la ganaderia y agricultura trabajo que inicio comenzar por las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar y es asi como hasta el dia de hoy a podido salir adelante con su familia, el cliente esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ganando y asi seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Julio is 66 years old and lives in his own home with his family.  He has made a living for more than 30 years in livestock and agriculture; work that he began because of the needs present in his home, and this is how until today he has been able to get his family ahead in life.  The client is requesting a loan in order to buy more cattle and thus continue with his work that generates good profit.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Eriberto

texts.es:
Eriberto con 29 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia, junto a su esposa e hija en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona urbana. Eriberto cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría al comercio y crianza de animales.

Eriberto se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de cerdos, así mismo de animales menores como patos y carneros, con una experiencia en el rubro hace más de 02 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y alimento para la crianza de los mismos. De esta manera hará hacer crecer más su negocio, obtendrá mayores ingresos y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.

Eriberto es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido un préstamo de S/.1,000.00 a 12 meses y lo viene pagando puntualmente.
texts.en:
Eriberto is 29 years old and lives with his partner. He lives in his own home with his wife and daughter in Zaña provincia in Chiclayo departamento of Lambayeque region, Perú, in an urban area. Eriberto has good employment and personal references from people who live in the area. People here are mostly engaged in running small businesses and raising livestock.

Eriberto raises and sells pigs, as well as small animals such as ducks and sheep. He has been working in this occupation for more than two years.

He is requesting the loan so that he can buy animals and feed for raising them. In this way he will make his business grow further, earn greater income and be able to improve his family's quality of life.

Eriberto is a continuing member of Edpyme Alternativa. He has had a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles over 12 months, and has been making his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar energy system for lighting to help improve her family's living conditions

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia de 51 años es una comerciante que se dedica a la venta de ropa y utensilios de plástico desde hace 3 años. Este negocio le genera los ingresos necesarios para su sustento y el de su familia. Como ella es una mujer separada, ha tenido que salir adelante con sus seis hijos, sin embargo esta situación no la ha detenido ya que ella aspira en un futuro que su negocio se amplíe y así poder tener más ingresos para la familia. Actualmente Amelia debe caminar aproximadamente  una  hora para poder tener acceso a cargar su celular, ya que su negocio utiliza este medio para promover sus ventas y es necesario para ella siempre mantenerlo con carga, debido  a que en la comunidad de Olanchito, Honduras donde vive no hay acceso a energía eléctrica, levantarse temprano por las mañanas a realizar las labores del hogar también se dificulta un poco. Por estas razones Amelia solicita a Soluz Honduras este préstamo para adquirir un Kit solar para iluminación que le ayudará a mejorar notablemente su vida diaria, ya que tendrá acceso a cargar su celular y asimismo tendrá iluminación en la vivienda lo que le ayudara a poder iniciar sus labores más temprano y dedicar más tiempo a su negocio.
texts.en:
Amelia is 51 years old.  She is a merchant who has sold clothing and plastic utensils for the past three years.  This business generates the necessary income for her sustenance and that of her family.  Since she is separated, she has had to get ahead with her six children.  Nevertheless, this situation has not stopped her.  She hopes that in the future that her business will grow and thus to able to have more income for the family.

Currently Amelia has to walk about an hour to be able to have access to charge her cell phone, since her business uses this method to promote her sales, and it is necessary for her to always have to charged.  Also in the community of Olanchito, Honduras where she lives, there is no access to electricity, so to get up early in the mornings to do the chores is also a little difficult.

For these reasons, Amelia is requesting this loan from Soluz Honduras to get a solar kit for illumination which will help her to notably improve her daily life.  She will have access to charging her cell phone and also have light in the house which will help her to be able to start her chores earlier and spend more time on her business.

loans.use: To buy a kit of solar lamps for illumination which will improve the living conditions of her home.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a 56-year-old woman who dreams of having a stable business in the future, a business that can help her raise her family. She has two children; ages 22 and 20 years old. 

Antonia is from Baybay, Leyte.  She is engaged in buying and selling frozen goods. She has been doing this for four years. Her husband is a carpenter and works hard to provide the needs of their family. 

To uplift their livelihood, Antonia is asking a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy frozen products such as hot dogs, chorizo, and ham. 

She hopes that in this way she can help her husband enhance their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy frozen products, such as hot dogs, chorizo, and ham

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is married, with two children. He describes himself as ambitious. 

He operates a retail business where he sells bread, sugar, flour, and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are locals. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of bread, flour, sugar, cereals, and other items. He also runs a motorcycle transport business. 

He will use the anticipated profits to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bread, flour, sugar,  and other items.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a widowed woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and goats. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fewer goats.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more goats. Her business goal is to have four dairy cows within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more goats

loans.name: Sombun's Group

texts.en: Sombun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sombun makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as farm laborer and nurse to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en:
Najwa is a 44-year-old married mother of three. Due to the low financial situation of her husband she decided, three years ago, to open a grocery shop to help her husband in satisfying their children's needs. She is a hard worker and ambitious woman who has a good reputation among her customers.

Najwa is trying hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her merchandise with new items and products to satisfy her customers' special requests.

Najwa hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new items and products to satisfy her customers' special requests

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel con ayuda de préstamos mantiene la carpintería funcionando y generándole los recursos económicos necesarios para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar junco y madera, surtirá el inventario para reparar y fabricar muebles, sabe que permanecer en el mercado no es fácil pero espera que con la nueva inversión continuar superándose.
texts.en: With the help of loans, Manuel is able to keep his carpentry shop functioning and generating the financial resources necessary to meet his obligations. He is asking for a new loan to buy reeds and wood to stock the inventory to repair and make furniture. He knows that staying in the market isn't easy but he hopes that he will continue to overcome obstacles with the new investment.

loans.use: to buy reeds and wood to stock the inventory to repair and make furniture

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is single and she is working in a private company in order to  make a living. She helped her parents by providing them a motorcycle used for transportation services. To improve the services she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to buy spare parts and other accessories. She is planning to build a store in their village to let her parents managed while she is working. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorcycle repair.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a Kiva borrower. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of collard greens, cabbages and carrots. She hopes that in the future she will have a stable business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of collard greens, cabbages and carrots.

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
Fidelina tiene un taller de costuras, vive con su familia, compuesta por su esposo, que trabaja como albañil y una hija que actualmente estudia; ella adquirió está habilidad de muy pequeña, trabaja en un horario hábil y ya es muy reconocida por el buen trabajo que realiza.
Para Fidelina es importante mejorar día con día su trabajo para tener ingresos estables, solicita un crédito para comprar una maquina nueva de coser, le ayudara a tener un equipo de trabajo más apropiado para agilizar sus actividades y mantener la preferencia de sus clientes.
Su sueño es apoyar mediante su trabajo a su hija para que continúe sus estudios.
texts.en:
Fidelina has a sewing workshop. She lives with her family, which is made up of her husband who works as a bricklayer and a daughter who is now in school. Fidelina acquired this ability when she was very young; she works a business schedule and is already well known for the work that she does.

For Fidelina it is important to improve her work day by day in order to have a stable income. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a new sewing machine. This will help her to have equipment more suited to speeding up her work and to maintaining the favor of her customers.

Her dream is, through the means of her work, to support her daughter so that she can continue her schooling.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Mom makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Socheat, a farmer with a wife and five children, lives in Prey Kor Village which is far from the power grid. Besides farming, Socheat brews white wine to earn extra money for his family. As a farmer and also a businessman, he wants to expand his business with two hectares more land and make his family live in comfortable conditions.

However, he is facing some problems related to home energy because of the remote area. His house has no reliable energy source. He has to go and charge a car battery every two or three days for daily usage. Sometimes because of busyness he doesn’t have time to charge the battery and the whole family is in pitch black conditions for the whole day.

He is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a high quality home solar energy system. After using solar home energy, he believes his family's conditions would be better and safer. He also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home energy system.

location.town: Prey Kor Village, Donrei Phong Commune, Chhlong Di

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel, tiene 43 años de edad, es casado, su esposa tiene 41 años de edad, han procreado cuatro hijos, dos ya tienen su propio hogar, junto a ellos viven dos de 18 y 8 años de edad; su negocio es la crianza de cerdos, trabaja todos los días, lo desempeña de manera independiente desde hace 12 años.
Invertirá en cerdos, concentrado y vitaminas para tener más animales y aumentar las posibilidades de atender a nuevos clientes, solicita el crédito para realizar la compra de contado, pues de esta manera ahorrara gy su margen de ganancias será mayor, espera tener un resultado positivo y resarcir su deuda.
Sus objetivos son continuar mejorando el negocio y darle a sus seres queridos un estilo de vida más digno.
texts.en:
Manuel is 43 years old and married. His wife is 41 years old. They have four children, two of whom already have their own homes. Their children ages 18 and 8 live with them. His business is raising pigs and he works every day. He has done this by himself for the last twelve years.

He will invest in pigs, concentrate and vitamins to have more animals and to increase the potential for attending to new customers. He is asking for the loan to make the purchase in cash, since he will save money in this way and his profit margin will be greater. He hopes to have a positive result and to repay his debt. His goals are to continue improving the business and to give his loved ones a more dignified lifestyle.

loans.use: to invest in pigs, concentrate and vitamins to have more animals and to increase the potential for attending to new customers

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.en:
Zebiniso was born in 1976. She lives with her family in Tajikistan. She loves her country much and wants to see her country as a developed country. Zebiniso is the careful mother of three children. Two of them are not adults. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Zebiniso is the main one to feed and bring up her children.

Zebiniso runs her own business deal. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than three years. She mainly raises sheep. Now she has 12 sheep. She feeds sheep at her house. Zebiniso tries to develop her business because her business is the main source of the family income. She is going to repair the house they are living in because her house is in bad condition. Zebiniso is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy building materials such as wood and slate for repairing her house. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as wood and slate for repairing her house.

loans.name: Ana Gaudalupe

texts.es:
Ana, de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada y por el momento no tiene hijos y su pareja es empleado en una empresa de atún y mariscos.

Ana, actualmente trabaja como empleada de oficios domésticos y anteriormente ella labora en un restaurante de lunes a domingo por ocho horas al día.

Ana, necesita el préstamo para comprar una ternera, para tener un ingreso extra.

Ana, sueña con tener su propia casa, porque por el momento viven con los suegros.
texts.en:
Ana is 21 years old and studied up to university. She has a partner and has no children at the moment. Her partner is employed in a tuna and shellfish company.

At the moment Ana is working as a cleaner. Before this she worked in a restaurant from Monday to Friday for eight hours a day.

Ana needs a loan to buy a calf for some additional income. She dreams of having her own home because at the moment she is living with her in-laws.

loans.use: to buy a calf for some additional income

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en:
Specioza lives in Kagadi-Uganda and trades in textiles. She established this business in 2000 so that she could earn a living. Specioza also does farming in order to supplement her major source of income.

Specioza is married and has four children. Her dream is to educate all her children. The major challenge is that her business is seasonal. She now needs money to buy more clothes and increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and increase her stock.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Medza

texts.en:
Medza is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be God fearing. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour, soap, salt and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals.

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, bread, sugar, rice, milk and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, bread, sugar, rice, milk and other items.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as humble. She operates a retail business where she sells lessos (african attire), movies and music CDs. Mwanaisha has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are repeat customers.

Mwanaisha describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of lessos and CDs. Her business goal is to have more business outlets within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children through university level. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of lessos and CDs.

loans.name: Jonathan Josue

texts.es:
Jonathan, de 19 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado y se dedicó a trabajar con su padre y con personas que le buscaban para prestar sus servicios, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a la sastrería y tienen un hijo de dos años de edad.

Jonathan, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas desde hace dos años, él comenzó ayudándole a un vecino y así fue obteniendo experiencia y luego decidió sembrar sus propios cultivos de hortaliza y ahora es su principal fuente de ingresos económicos.- Jonathan, extrae sus cosechas y sale a vender hortalizas por las casas; pero además vende al mayoreo a las tiendas grandes; las hortalizas las tiene cerca de su casa y está pendiente de cuidarlas para que los depredadores no la dañen y no tiene horario de trabajo.

Jonathan, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono, insecticidas y fertilizantes para cosechar buenas hortalizas libres de plagas y ofrecer a sus clientes verduras sanas y que las ganancias sean más abundantes para poderle dar lo necesario a su familia.

Jonathan, sueña con poder sembrar más y poder distribuirle a tiendas grandes y además desea poder reparar su casa.
texts.en:
Jonathan, who is 19 years old, studied until the eighth grade and made a living working with his father and with people who sought him to borrow his services. He is attached and his partner makes a living at the tailor's shop. They have a two-year-old son. 

Jonathan has made a living planting vegetables since two years ago. He began by helping a neighbour and that way, he obtained the experience and later decided to plant his own vegetable crops. Now, it is his principal source of economic income. Jonathan extracts his crops and goes out to sell vegetables to houses; but also sells wholesale and to large stores. He has the vegetables close to his house and is attentive to taking care of them so that predators do not damage them, and he does not have a work schedule.

Jonathan needs the loan to buy manure, insecticide, and fertilizer to harvest good, pest-free vegetables and offer healthy vegetables to his clients. The earnings will be more abundant and allow him to give what is necessary to his family. 

Jonathan dreams of being able to plant more to distribute to large stores, and he also desires to be able to repair his house.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticide, and fertilizers to harvest good, pest-free vegetables.

loans.name: Kahanda Tweyimukye Group

texts.en:
Theopister is 35 and a member of Kahanda Tweyimukye group is a hardworking married woman with four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is farmer and at the same time a business lady involved in fresh food selling where she gets income to look after her family needs. Selling fresh food items like potatoes, matooke, tomatoes, onions and beans is a very good business where one cannot go wrong even though her products are exposed to perishing after some time.

She is further faced with a challenge of paying fees yet her wish is to educate her children up to university. Theopister will use the requested loan under her group to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Mwatumu

texts.en:
Mwatum is a married woman with nine children. She describes herself as innovative. She operates a retail business where she sells utensils and has been involved in this business for nine years.

Mwatum's business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of utensils. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years.

This is Mwatum's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of utensils

loans.name: Varditer

texts.en: Varditer is 65 years old retired woman. She is a widow and she has no children. Now she lives in Kapan city of Syunik region with her sister in a cute flat. For 30 years she used to work at the Kapan city’s post office but now her only source of income is her pension.
