She mentions that she lives with her sister in discomfort since their bathroom is old and in a very bad condition. With everyday use it becomes very hard and even dangerous since the water pipes are very old and some are already broken. This loan of 300.000 Armenian drams she greatly use in order to repair the bathroom of her flat and also to change all the water pipes in it .

loans.use: to repair the bathroom of her flat and also to change all the water pipes in it

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Kagadi-Uganda and has been in the business of trading motorcycle spare parts since 2010. Joseph started up this business in order to earn a living. He is married with two children. He also does mechanics and farming to supplement his income.

Joseph has a dream of educating his children. His major challenge is competition from people with similar businesses. He needs money to buy more motorcycle spare parts to enlarge his business.

loans.use: to buy more motorcycle spare parts for selling

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer con 33 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive junto a su madre en el distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, al cultivo de arroz,siendo esta el de mayor producción, así como el comercio en general.

Wilmer se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público, cuenta con una mototaxi propia con la cuál realiza dicho servicio, con una experiencia de más de 01 años en el rubro. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales de corral. Solicita préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su unidad móvil. De esta manera podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.

Wilmer es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Este es su segundo crédito.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 33 years, is single, and lives with his mother in the district of Pucará, province of Jaén, and department of Cajamarca in the country of Peru. Most of the inhabitants of this place make a living in agriculture, growing rice, which is the largest production in the area, as well in commerce in general.

Wilmer makes a living by providing public transport services; he has his own motorcycle taxi that he uses for this service and has more than a year of experience in this business. He also makes a living by raising farm animals. He is asking for the loan to invest in maintaining his vehicle. In this way he will be able to acquire acceptable utility to improve his quality of life. 

Wilmer is a returning member at Edpyme Alternativa. This is his second loan.

loans.use: to invest in maintaining his vehicle

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 23 years old. She is unmarried with three children. She has had a tailoring business for four years.

Betty will be using the loan to purchase material for sewing clothes and hopes this will help her expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable business and educate her children successfully.

loans.use: to purchase material for sewing clothes to help her expand her business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 38 year old married man with children, and he lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. His main business is agricultural produce buying and selling for products such as maize, beans and coffee, depending on seasonality. In addition, Moses does commercial farming for extra income.

After realizing that his family demands were increasing, he got involved in this business and has plans to expand into bigger stores. However, limited capital affects his stock levels during the peak season, and there is also the challenge of unpredictable price changes that he must manage. Moses will use the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is a 51-year-old produce dealer dealing predominantly in maize and local brew as his major sources of income. He supplements his income with his proceeds from farming. Tom lives in Kagadi-Uganda. He is married with 12 children.

He started up this business purposely to create employment for himself and to take care of his family. He now needs money to buy beans and maize for selling because it is the peak season. However, price fluctuations and high transportation costs are his major challenges. He is thankful to Kiva for the previous loan that enabled him to buy alcohol and produce for selling.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize for selling

loans.name: Juana Dinora

texts.es:
Juana, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado y por la situación económica de su familia, no estudio porque tenía que ayudarle a su madre con los oficios domésticos, está casada y su esposo trabaja en el ejército, tienen dos hijos de 17 y 14 años de edad los cuales estudian.

Juana, se dedica a los oficios domésticos desde que era pequeña pues su madre le enseñaba a realizar esta labor y ella  gustosamente le ayudaba para aprender más sobre esta actividad, su esposo trabaja en el ejército desde hace seis años de tener este trabajo, el cual ha ha sido de gran ayuda para poder sostener su hogar.

Juana, necesita el préstamo para poder iniciar una tienda de productos de la canasta básica como arroz, azúcar, aceite, sal, verduras, pastas, entre otros, con esta inversión espera tener ganancias para poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa y con la educación de sus hijos.

Juana, sueña con tener una gran tienda donde pueda ofrecerle a sus clientes diversos productos de la canasta básica y además desea poder ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios para que puedan terminar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Juana, who is 38 years of age, studied until the third grade and due to the economic situation of her family, stopped studying because she needed to help her mother with household duties. She is married, and her husband works in the army. They have two children who are 17 and 14 years old, and they are studying.

Juana has been dedicated to her household duties since she was young because her mother taught her to perform this work. She gladly helped her mother to learn more about this occupation. Her husband has worked in the army since seven years ago that he had the job, which has been a big help in being able to maintain their home. 

Juana needs the loan to be able to be able to start a shop selling products of staple goods such as rice, sugar, oil, salt, vegetables, and baked goods, amongst others. With this investment she hopes to have the earnings to be able to help her husband with household expenses and with the education of their children.

Juana dream of having a big shop where she can offer diverse products of basic goods to her customers, and on top of that she desires to be able to help her children with their studies so that they can finish a university degree.

loans.use: to be able to start a shop selling products of staple goods such as rice, sugar, oil, salt, vegetables, and baked goods, amongst others.

loans.name: Ana Marisol

texts.es:
Ana, de 36 años de edad, es madre soltera, estudio hasta tercer grado, no logró continuar en la escuela porque en su hogar había mucho trabajo, es madre soltera y vive solo con su hijo que está estudiando primer grado.

Ana, se levanta muy temprano para preparar a su pequeño para llevarlo a la escuela de su comunidad, mientras ella trabaja en la misma escuela cocinando los alimentos para todos los alumnos y por la tarde se dedica a producir pan y venderlo en el mismo cantón para obtener otros ingresos económicos, pero además de eso siempre se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas.

Ana, está solicitando un préstamo para comprar semilla, abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para sembrar maíz y frijol para aprovechar la época lluviosa.

Ana, sueña con tener una tienda de productos básicos e implementar la panadería en la misma tienda y para tener una fuente de ingresos económicos estables y permanentes.
texts.en:
Ana, at the ago of 36, is a single mother. She went to school through third grade. She wasn't able to continue in school because in her home there was a lot of work. She is a single mother and lives with only her son, who is in first grade.

Ana gets up very early in order to prepare her little one to take him to the school in her community, while she works in the same school cooking food for all the students. In the afternoon she works to produce bread and sell it in the same canton in order to obtain other economic income, but in addition to this, she always does agricultural work.

Ana is applying for a loan to purchase seeds, compost, pesticides, and herbicides to plant corn and beans in order to take advantage of the rainy season.

Ana dreams of having a store with basic products and setting up a bakery in the same store, and having a stable and permanent source of economic income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, pesticides, and herbicides to plant corn and beans in order to take advantage of the rainy season.

loans.name: Banumathi And Group

texts.en:
43-year-old Banumathi leads a group of 5 in Kulithalai, Tamil Nadu. They come from similar backgrounds, working hard to sustain their families.

Banumathi and her family have no access to toilets, and therefore, they have to resort to open defecation using the false privacy of nearby fields and surrounding shrubbery. Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, her family is at risk of being infected and falling ill often, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month. The women and daughters in the family are exposed to the additional risk of molestation.

Seeking to improve their situation, she seeks a loan. She will use the loan amount to construct a toilet in her home. The other members also need a loan to construct toilets in their respective homes. As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses, and they will repay the loan amount on time. Your loan will provide all 5 families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: To improve sanitation facilities in her home by installing a toilet

loans.name: Jeya And Group

texts.en:
Jeya has formed a self-help group with her friends in Kulithalai, in the rural part of Karur, in Tamil Nadu. She works as a daily wage laborer in the agricultural fields. She works hard to support her family of six, and saves diligently. However, the finances are not adequate for her family to access basic necessities like toilets in their home. They have to trek long distances at dawn to use the fields to relieve themselves. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse.

Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Jeya and her family. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, together, Jeya and her group seek a group loan of Rs. 70,000 to build a toilet at their respective homes. Your loan will provide these 5 families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: To build a toilet in her home

loans.name: Maria  Nelly

texts.es: Maria dd 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, se dedica ala evnta de medicna popular desde hace varios años y gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante con su familia, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando puertas y ventanas pero con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razon se acerco a INTEGRAL para solicitar un credito para la compra de puertas, ventanas y pago de mano de obra oara tener un vivienda mas segura.
texts.en:
María, 40, lives in her own house with her son. She has earned a living selling popular medicine for several years and has been able to get ahead with her family thanks to her job.

She wants to improve her home with windows and doors but doesn't have enough money from her earnings. That's why she went to Integral to request a loan to buy doors and windows and to pay for labor to have a safer home.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows and to pay for labor

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a resident in the town of Batuan, Bohol. She is married and has two children ages 11 and 19 years old. For a long period of time, she has been working in the rice paddies to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She grows and sells rice to the local dwellers in her place.

She is a hard-working mother who is doing her best for the sake of her children. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers. These will generate a higher yield and allow her to slowly improve her financial cash flow.

She hopes to expand her business more in the future through expanding her farm to increase her income and to be able to continue finance the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertlizers

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 74 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. Her business is dairy farming. She has been in the business for 15 years. Anna earns a monthly income of twenty thousand Kenyan shillings.

This is her fifth loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Anna will use the loan to purchase animal feeds. With the profits from expanded business, she will improve her business and the standard of living for her family.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a big business and a stable family.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a married woman who lives in the city of Baybay, Leyte. She is a mother of two children, ages 8 and 6 years old. Marivic earns a living through buying and selling home care, personal care, health, fragrance, baby care, cosmetics and beauty products. Marivic has been proficiently running this business for seven years.

Aside from this, she also sells fish from her husband’s catch. The profit that she earns is a great help in paying their daily expenses, such as food, and some of their household expenses, such as bills and some household needs. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy personal collection products, such as lotion, baby powder, fragrances, cosmetics, beauty soap, and some home care products, such as laundry soap and toilet cleaner. She will also need the loan to buy fishing materials, such as a fishing net and a fishing knot to enhance the catch of her husband and improve their sales as well.

In the future, Marivic wishes to expand her business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy lotion, baby powder, fragrances, cosmetics, beauty soap and some home care products such as laundry soap and toilet cleaner, and a fishing net and a fishing knot.

loans.name: Enoch

texts.en:
Enoch is a farmer in Kajara Ntungamo. He is married with five children. His main income source is the plantation. He also rears cows to supplement his income.

He uses the income from these activities to pay school fees . He applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from Ugafode to mulch his plantations so that he can increase his yields and sales in the near future.

He is appreciative of the Kiva funding and partnership.

loans.use: to buy mulch.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 45 years old. She is married and blessed with four children. Her business is operating a quarry. She has been in the business for 15 years and earns a monthly income of 11,000 Kenyan Shillings.

This is Ruth's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy charcoal to sell, in order to diversify her source of income.

Ruth will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children as well as increase her savings. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 66 years old. She is a widow and blessed with six children. Her business is dairy farming. Margaret has been in the business for 50 years. She earns a monthly income of 21,000 Kenyan Shillings.

This is Margaret's third loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy animal feeds. She will use the profits from expanded business to service her loan. Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia con 33 años de edad, de estado civil madre soltera, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,aparatosamente de Lambayeque,país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Julia se dedica a la crianza y venta de chivos, desde hace 15 años de experiencia en el rubro. Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y comida para estos. De esta manera le facilitará seguir trabajando y seguir obteniendo sus propios ingresos.

Julia si cuenta con experiencia crediticia, es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Julia is 33 years, is a single mother, and lives with her children in the district of Cayaltí, province of Chiclayo, and department of Lambayeque in the country of Peru. Most of the inhabitants of this area make a living in agriculture and commerce and by raising cattle.

Julia makes a living by raising and selling goats and has more than fifteen years' experience in this business. She is asking for the loan to buy animals and food for them. In this way she will be able to keep working and keep earning her own income.

Julia does have loan experience, but she is a new member at Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy animals and food for them

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows onions, tomatoes, maize and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy seeds, agrichemicals and other items. She hopes that in the future she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy seeds, agrichemicals and other items.

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en:
Ritah is a Kiva borrower. She has 2 children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, soap, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, soap and other items. Her business goal is to open another shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will open a mini supermarket. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, soap and other items.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as trustworthy. She operates a farm where she grows kale, tomatoes, onions and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be weather changes. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and agrochemicals. Her business goal is to expand the farm within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and agro chemicals.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita has been engaged in farming for 15 years now. She grows vegetables like ampalaya (bitter gourd), corn and rice. She resides in the town of Sagbayan, Bohol.

Rosita is a 59-year-old married woman and has four grown children. Her husband is also a farmer. He helps plow the field and take care of the vegetation.

Rosita would like to improve her livelihood by acquiring additional funds to finance her current means of living. She has requested a loan to buy organic fertilizers, as well as corn and vegetable seeds. These are essential for ongoing improvement in her present business. This will mean an abundant harvest and therefore her income will go higher.

Rosita is hoping that someday she will become a successful farmer that can provide organic vegetables to the community in which she lives.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers, as well as corn and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Obeida

texts.en:
Obeida, an ambitious 24-year-old guy, lives with his mother and father in a camp for Palestinian refugees located in North Lebanon. While his mother is unemployed, his father is an employee ensuring that the family has a stable monthly income.

With the support of his father, Obeida opened his own coffee shop three years ago, in the area where he lives. It is a very popular street of the camp with many shops and stores.

For the moment, Obeida's main goal is to preserve his shop's sustainability. Therefore, for the first time, Obeida is asking for a 1,029,988 LBP loan from Kiva's partner Ibdaa. He needs to renew the decor of his coffee shop and to buy a television. Then, his shop will attract more clients which will boost his business and increase his revenue.

Obeida is a hardworking young man whose aim is to build a good future while helping his parents with the family expenses despite the hard conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: To buy a television for his coffee shop

loans.name: Ruma And Group

texts.en:
Ruma leads a group of 5 women in Assam. Chandan, Namita, Lili and Sarmila are the other members in the group. Ruma is a mother of one son and runs a tailoring and cloth business at home. She needs a loan to purchase a new sewing machine and stock for her clothes business. She plans to sell cloth items like salwars, blouses, kurtis, shirts, etc. With the expansion in her business, Ruma believes she will be able to earn an additional monthly income of 1,500 INR.

All women in the group plan to expand their respective businesses. So, to meet their working capital requirement, this group applied for financial help of 120,000 INR together. With this loan, they will expand their businesses and will earn more income.

loans.use: to purcahse a sewing machine and additional stock of cloth to expand her tailoring business.

loans.name: Twinomugisa Saaco Group

texts.en:
Margret is a 42-year-old mother of five children. She owns a retail shop, a business she has done for over 10 years. Since her husband died, she has solely looked after her children some of whom have finished school. She also grows maize and beans for supplementary income.

In future she plans to build a house for herself and also grow her business into a wholesale shop. She is challenged by a lack capital to expand her shop and price fluctuations of the products she deals in. She describes herself as hardworking.

Margret wants to use this loan to buy sugar, soap and other general merchandise to sell. She is a member of Twinomugisa SAACO Group where members guarantee each other to get loans as they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Johanna De La Paz

texts.es:
Johanna, tiene una venta de comida rápida como hamburguesas, panes con pollo, hot dogs y tacos, aprendió a desarrollar está actividad de sus parientes, tiene un horario de una a siete de la tarde; ella es una madre soltera que tiene que trabajar para sacar adelante a su hija de nueve meses, manifiesta no tener respaldo económica del extranjero.
Planea invertir el crédito en pan, carnes, embutidos, aderezos, tortillas, entre otros materiales para tener un inventario que le permita preparar la comida rápida, considera  que si mantiene su negocio funcionando tendrá oportunidades de superación junto a su hija.
Los sueños que desea ver concretos son tener un negocio más amplio y  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Johanna sells fast food such as hamburgers, chicken sandwiches, hot dogs, and tacos. She learned how to carry out this business from her parents. She has a schedule from one to seven in the afternoon. She is a single mother who has to work in order to raise her 9-month-old daughter. She states that she doesn't have economic support from abroad.

She plans to invest the loan in bread, meats, cold cuts, seasonings, and tortillas, among other materials, in order to have an inventory that will allow her to prepare fast food. She considers that if she keeps her business functioning, she will have opportunities to improve herself, along with her daughter.

The dreams that she wants to see realized are to have a bigger business and to have her own house.

loans.use: to invest in bread, meats, cold cuts, seasonings, and tortillas, among other materials, in order to have an inventory that allows her to prepare fast food.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Don Pablo de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hija, el se dedica al cultivo de maiz desde hace varios años y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como ha logrado salir adelante, el quiere mejorar su vivienda contruyendo la pared de la parte principal de su casa pero con lo que ganan de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razon esta solicitando un credito para la compra de los materiales de contruccion necesarios para poder tener una vivienda mas segura para su familia.
texts.en:
Pablo is 51 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and their daughter. For several years he has worked growing corn. What he obtains from his sales is how he's managed to get ahead.

He wants to improve his home, building a wall in the main part of his house, but with what he makes from his sales, he doesn't have enough to make it happen. For that reason he is seeking a loan to buy the necessary construction materials in order to have a safer home for his family.

loans.use: to buy necessary construction materials.

loans.name: Beatris

texts.en: Beatris is a businesswoman with a kiosk. She is requesting a loan of $ 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. Beatris opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital of $ 1,000. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as detergents, sugar, snack, cooking oils, slippers, cigarettes, coffee, sardines, biscuits, noodles, lighters, closed up, eggs, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.  She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin so she can have more working capital to buy more goods. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy, detergents, sugar, snack, cooking oils,slippers,cigarettes, coffee,sardines,biscuits,noodles, lighters, closed up, eggs, soft drinks, hard drinks.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco, actualmente vive con su esposa y cinco hijos, de 36, 34, 30, 28 y 18 años de edad, ellos ya son independientes, hace un año y medio estableció una venta de frutas y verduras, trabaja de lunes a domingo en el mercado municipal, es así como puede generar ingresos para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Comprará tomates, chiles, papas, pepinos, cebollas, manzanas, papayas, ejotes, etc., ofrecerá mercadería más surtida, fresca y de calidad a sus clientes, espera tener acceso a nuevos ingresos y resarcir su deuda.
Los objetivos que tiene son continuar trabajando con créditos en Padeocmsm y kiva para mantener su negocio y brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Francisco now lives with his wife and five children, ages 36, 34, 30, 28, and 18. They are already independent. A year and a half ago he established a sales stand for fruits and vegetables. He works from Monday to Sunday in the municipal market. This is how he is able to generate income to meet his obligations.

He will buy tomatoes, peppers, potatoes, cucumbers, onions, apples, papayas, green beans, etc. He will offer a better stock of fresh, quality merchandise to his customers. He hopes to have access to new income and make good on his debt.

The goals that he has are to continue working with the PADECOMSM and Kiva loans in order to maintain his business and offer good service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, peppers, potatoes, cucumbers, onions, apples, papayas, green beans, etc., so that he can offer a better stock of fresh, quality merchandise to his customers.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, bread, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour and other items. Her business goal is to open another business outlet within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour and other items.

loans.name: Karen Estefany

texts.es:
Karen se siente satisfecha por los buenos resultados que ha tenido al invertir el crédito anterior en la venta de pupusas y antojitos, comenta que su familia tiene el mismo núcleo, pero que hoy tienen mejores condiciones de vida, pues sus ingresos han mejorado.
Está motivada a seguir trabajando con créditos para surtir su negocio, en esta oportunidad lo necesita para comprar arroz, maíz, frijoles, aceite, quesillo, etc., así la pupusería mantendrá su continuidad.
texts.en:
Karen is very satisfied with the good results she had investing the last loan in selling pupusas [stuffed corn tortillas] and snacks. She says that her family is essentially the same as always, but today they have a better quality of life since her income has improved.

She is motivated to keep working with the help of the loans in order to stock her business. She needs this loan to purchase rice, corn, beans, oil, fresh cheese, etc. in order to maintain her pupusa business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, corn, beans, oil, fresh cheese, etc. in order to maintain her grocery store.

loans.name: Maria Berta

texts.es:
María, de 53 años de edad, es una mujer humilde de buenos principios, no estudio porque la escuela más cercana  estaba a 8 kilómetros de su casa y no había transporte, actualmente está acompañada y tiene 7 hijos en común de los cuales solo una hija vive con ello y los demás ya se casaron y viven aparte. 

María, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y para cuidar de sus hijos, ella apoya a su esposo en las actividades agrícolas y esa es su fuente de ingresos y también su esposo hace viajes con su carrito para tener una fuente de ingresos para el sostén de su familia. 

María, necesita el crédito para reparar el vehículo con él que su esposo trabaja, porque es una fuente de ingresos para ella y no puede trabajar. 

María, sueña con seguir apoyando a su esposo para que puedan seguir trabajando juntos, para sacar a su familia adelante y poder darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 53 years old. She is a humble woman of good principles. She didn't go to school because the closest school was 8 kilometers from her house, and there was no transportation. Currently she is married and has 7 children. Only one daughter lives with them. The rest are married and live elsewhere.

María works taking care of the home. In order to care for their children, she supports her husband in his agricultural work, which is their source of income. Her husband also uses his car to make income to support his family. María needs the loan to repair the vehicle with which her husband works, because it is a source of income for them, and doesn't work. María's wish is to continue supporting her husband so that they can keep working together, in order to move their family forward and to be able to give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle with which her husband works.

loans.name: Vasanthi And Group

texts.en:
Thirty-six-year-old Vasanthi hails from the Namakkal district of Tamil Nadu. She lives with her husband and her two children. She does not want shortage of income to be the reason her children do not have access to formal education. She currently works as a daily wage labourer in the agricultural fields. She earns a monthly income of Rs. 2700 from this. She believes she can earn better if she starts her own business. She thus underwent training under Gramalaya Microfin Foundation to develop her skills to start her own business making Pottu Kadalai Urundai (roasted gram laddu). The only thing stopping her from starting her business is the lack of funds.

Vasanthi formed a group with four other women from the same village to apply for a group loan to start her business. The other members of the group also seek funds to start their own respective businesses so they can lead a better and more comfortable life.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and start her business of making and selling roasted gram laddus

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros tiene 15 años de experiencia en la actividad la cual inicio con capital propio, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, con el credito que solicito anteriormente pudo comprar mercaderia para surtir su negocio, en esta ocasion esta solicitando nuevamente un credito para la compra de mas ropa para damas y caballeros y asi poder seguir con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Sandra is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a home they own. She works selling clothes for women and men. She has 15 years experience in this business that she started with her own capital. With what she obtains from her sales she is able to meet some of the household expenses.

With the loan she previously sought she was able to buy merchandise to stock her business. On this occasion she is again seeking a loan to buy more clothes for women and men, in order to be able to continue with her sales that generate good earnings for her.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for men and women.

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en:
Forty-five-year-old Desideria earns a living by raising and selling hogs. She is married and has five children. Two of her children are still attending school ages 17 and 18 years old respectively. Aside from hog raising, she also engages in a gasoline retailing business, serving neighbors and local settlers in her place. Her husband is a farmer. Together with her family, she lives in the town of Pilar, Bohol.

Desideria would like to boost her business. She has requested a loan to purchase pig feed and anadditional supply of gasoline. With the availability of resources, she could improve her livelihood and be able to continue to support the needs of her family. Thus, she could now raise and sell quality hogs. It would enable her to have more stocks of gasoline ready to be sold. In that way, her earnings will grow and continue to provide for the needs of her children.

Desideria is determined and looking forward to continuing to improve both of her businesses to become progressive.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and additional supply of gasoline

loans.name: Ibrohimjon

texts.en:
Ibrohimjon is a young and industrious man. He was born in 1992 in Tajikistan. Ibrohimjon is married and does not have any children. He has been a master of repairing cars for more than three years. Little by little with the passing of time, Ibrohimjon has developed his knowledge and abilities. He tries to service his clients with high quality.

Ibrohimjon now needs financial support because his mother is ill. He is asking for a loan of 7,500 TJS to buy medicines for his mother's treatment. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for his mother's treatment.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Jose es un padre de familia con 43 años de edad, vive con su familia en una comunidad de Sololá.
Jose con su préstamo pudo comprar sus semillas de maíz y fertilizantes y una buena cosecha obtuvo al final de este año, por esa razón él está muy contento  porque su vida se ha visto beneficiado, la cosecha que obtuvo una parte la vendió y la otra para alimentación de su familia, con los ingresos que obtuvo con la venta la remodelación de su casa pudo realizar. Él tiene nuevamente la necesidad de un préstamo para la compra de semillas de papa esto para realizar su cultivo de esta temporada. Jose espera contar con el crédito para mejorar su cultivo y darle a su familia una calidad de vida mejor.
texts.en:
José, 43, is a parent. He lives with his family in a community in Sololá.

José was able to buy corn seeds and fertilizer with his loan, and he got a good harvest at the end of the year. That's why he's very happy, because his life has benefitted. He sold part of his harvest and the other part was food for his family. With his income from the sales he managed to remodel his house.

He needs another loan to buy potato seeds to plant his crop this season. José hopes to have the loan so he can improve his crop and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds

loans.name: Enid

texts.en:
Enid is a widow with three siblings and two children who all go to school. She operates a retail shop in a trading centre dealing in general merchandise. She is strategically located and also boasts of a wide range of home product sales that she offers her customers. A times she gets challenged with limited capital to provide a variety of the other items on demand. She has applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 from UGAFODE to buy more stock of beverages, food stuffs, stationery, toiletries among other items that she will sell to her customers.

Enid is pictured with the UGAFODE credit staff in her shop.

loans.use: to boost her retail trade.

loans.name: Jose Javier

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa e hijos, no tiene familiares en el extranjero que le ayuden con remesas, se dedica a vender verduras para tener ingresos que utiliza en cubrir parte de las necesidades de su familia y lo tiene desde hace cinco años.
Invertirá en zanahorias, papas, aguacates, tomates, elotes, repollos, tomates, etc., tendrá un negocio más competitivo y atenderá mejor a sus clientes, sus esfuerzos están enfocados en tener mayores ganancias para cumplir con sus responsabilidades.
José sueña con ser un ejemplo a seguir para que sus hijos sean personas de bien que aporten a un cambio positivo en la sociedad.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and children. He doesn't have family who live abroad and help him with remittances. José's business is selling vegetables to earn the income he needs to cover some of his family's expenses. He has had his business for five years.

José will invest in the purchase of carrots, potatoes, avocados, tomatoes, ears of corn, cabbage etc. which will give him a more competitive business and allow him to provide his customers with better service. José's efforts focus earning a better profit to help him fulfill his responsibilities.

José hopes set a good example for his children so they can be good people who contribute to positive changes in society.

loans.use: to invest in carrots, potatoes, avocados, tomatoes, ears of corn, cabbage etc. so he can have a more competitive business and provide his customers with better service.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a Kiva borrower. She has 8 children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, juices,cooking fat and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, juices,flour and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will open a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, juices,flour and other items.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en: Veronicah is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be visionary. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 13 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock of tailoring materials. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to fend for the family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es: Fausto de 37 años se dedica a la agricultura de granos básicos y hortalizas desde hace nueve años, siempre ha trabajado muy duro para brindarles a su esposa y sus dos hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Por esa razón adquirió un sistema solar que le ayudo mucho con la falta de iluminación ya que en la comunidad de Olanchito, Honduras donde vive no hay acceso a energía eléctrica, sin embargo la batería que es uno de los componentes del sistema solar se ha dañado debido al uso y esto ha ocasionado que su familia haya vuelto a iluminarse  con lámparas a base de kerosén y caminar largas distancias para tener acceso a cargar sus celulares. Por esta razón Fausto solicita a Soluz Honduras este préstamo que le ayudara a adquirir una batería para la reactivación del sistema  y poder gozar nuevamente de los beneficios que  ofrece la energía solar, como tener buena iluminación a la hora de que su hijo realiza sus deberes escolares y también su familia por las noches después de un largo día de trabajo podrán relajarse un poco viendo  televisión.
texts.en:
Fausto, who is 37 years old, has worked in agriculture for nine years, raising basic grains and vegetables. He has always worked very hard to offer his wife and his two children a better quality of life.

For this reason, he acquired a solar power system that helps him a lot with the lack of electricity, since in the community of Olanchito, Honduras, where he lives, there is no access to electrical energy. Nevertheless, the battery that is one of the components of the solar power system has been damaged due to use, and this has caused his family to return to illuminating with lamps that use kerosene and to walk long distances to have access to charge their cell phones.

For this reason, Fausto is applying to Soluz Honduras for this loan, which will help him to acquire a battery to reactivate his system and be able to again enjoy the benefits that solar energy offers, such as having good lighting at the hour when his son does his schoolwork. In addition, his family will be able to relax a little in the evenings, watching television after a long day of work.

loans.use: to buy a battery that will help to reactivate his home's solar power system

loans.name: Keerthika And Group

texts.en:
24 year old Keerthika lives with her husband and her child in a village in Tamil Nadu. Eventhough Keerthika and her husband work hard to earn a decent income of Rs. 10750 every month, to sustain their family, they find it difficult to meet basic household expenses. Keerthika thus decided to switch from her current irregular work of working as a daily wage labourer in the agricultural fields to starting her own business. Keerthika underwent training in making Pottu Kadalai Urundai (roasted gram laddu). She now wants to start making and selling them to earn better.

Keerthika is the leader of a group of 5 women who have come together to apply for a group loan to fund the start of their respective businesses. Just like Keerthika, the other members have also undergone training to start their businesses. The loan will help them start their businesses and earn better for their families. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and start her roasted gram laddu making business

loans.name: Cruz Antonio

texts.es: Cruz de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su padre, el se dedica desde hace mas de 18 años al cultivo de maiz e inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y ya posee muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de insumos agricolas para su cultivo de maiz como abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plgas, etc. y mejorar el terreno para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi poder tener mejores igresos economicos.
texts.en:
Cruz, 33, lives in his own home with his father. For more than 18 years, he's earned a living growing corn. He began with his own capital and sells his products in the areas around the region where he lives. He already has many customers.

With the sales he makes, he's able to pay for some household expenses. He's seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs for his corn crop, like compost, fertilizers, pesticide, etc. and to improve the land to he'll be able to continue his work and thus have better income.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for his corn crop, like compost, fertilizers, pesticide and to improve the land.

loans.name: Sumaq Causay De Acorcona Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SUMAQ CAUSAY DE ACORCONA”; Este banco se ubicado en el sector de Acorcona  en el distrito de Vilcabamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alina, la socia tiene 36 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de  cultivo de  frutas, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua  vendiendo  plátanos, paltas, café entre otros a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y abono.
Los socios agradecen  a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank "Sumaq Causay of Acorcona." This bank is located in the area of Acorcona in the Vilcabamba district in the department of Cusco.

One of the members is Alina, who is 36 years old, single, and has one son. She works growing fruit and has been in this business for awhile. Her business is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into it each day.

She is a responsible and earnest person. She continues selling bananas, avocados and coffee, among other products, to customers who request them. This is how she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. The members thank those who are part of this dream through this medium and promise to comply with the payments of their dues by the deadline.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a farm where she grows maize and beans. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in  weather. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy maize and bean seeds for planting, and fertilizer. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her farming. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy maize and bean seeds for planting, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura de 37 años sabe los beneficios que la energía solar produce en la vida de las personas, ella ya cuenta con un sistema de iluminación sin embargo por el uso y el paso del tiempo, algunos componentes del sistema solar se han dañado. Laura junto a su esposo Walter  se dedican a la caficultura y siembra de granos básicos lo que les genera ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus cinco hijos, sin embargo esta tarea requiere que puedan levantarse muy temprano por  la mañana y acostarse muy tarde por la noche, lo  cual se le dificulta debido a la falta de iluminación ya que en la comunidad de  Olanchito, Yoro donde ellos viven no cuentan con este servicio, por esta razón Laura está solicitando a Soluz Honduras este préstamo para adquirir un paquete sostenible(bateria, controlador e inversor )y volver a reactivar su sistema solar para que este pueda ayudarles con la iluminación en la vivienda,  mantener sus teléfonos celulares con carga y para que los niños puedan realizar de mejor manera sus tareas.
texts.en:
Laura is 37 and knows how beneficial solar energy is for people. She has a lighting system, but because of use and the passage of time, some parts of the solar system have broken.

Laura and her husband Walter make a living farming coffee and staple goods, which earns them money to support their five children. This work requires them to get up very early in the morning and go to bed late at night, which is difficult due to a lack of light. The community in Olanchito, Yoro, where they live, does not have this service.

As a result,Laura is seeking this loan from Soluz Honduras to reactivate her solar system to help them with light in the house, keep their cell phones charges and allow their children to better do their homework.

loans.use: to purchase a sustainable package (battery, controller, inverter) to reactivate her solar system.

loans.name: Angelina Lindaura

texts.es:
Angélica comparte su vivienda con dos hijos de 11 y 15 años de edad, hace un año su pareja falleció, se dedica a vender tamales y atoles para sostener su hogar, el oficio lo aprendió de su madre siendo una jovencita, a la edad de 21 años se vio obligada a fundar su propio negocio, debido a las dificultades en que vivían.
Comprará azúcar, harina, canela, leña, bolsas, pollo, maíz y otros materiales necesarios para preparar tamales y atol para vender, tendrá un inventario surtido a su alcance y a un costo menor, su finalidad es tener estabilidad económica para remodelar su vivienda, no representa mucho riesgo en desarrollar sus actividades.
Sus sueños son tener un negocio más competente, ofrecer un techo seguro a sus hijos y seguir trabajando con créditos en Padecomsm para progresar.
texts.en:
Angélica shares her home with two children who are 11 and 15 years old. One year ago, her spouse died. She earns a living selling tamales and atoles to support her household. She learned this work from her mother when she was young, and had to start her own business at 21 due to the difficulties she faced.

She will buy sugar, flour, cinnamon, firewood, bags, chicken, corn and other materials needed to prepare tamales and atole to sell. She will have an assortment of inventory at her fingertips at lower cost. Her goal is to have economic stability to remodel her home. Developing her activities does not represent a high risk.

Her dreams are to have a more proficient business, provide a secure roof to her children and continue working with PADECOMSM loans to progress.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, cinnamon, firewood, bags, chicken, corn and other materials needed to prepare tamales and atole to sell.

loans.name: La Campana Group

texts.es:
Marcia es una mujer de 41 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 20 años, y su negocioe s la venta de ropa de segunda mano y venta de artefactos de temporada.
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por recibir la migración campo ciudad.
Marcia es morena de baja estatura y físico robusto (sentada al centro. Lleva una cartera blanca), su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como transportista y con sus hijos que estudian y trabajan. Viven en una casa propia construida de madera que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Las ganas de mejorar su negocio la llevaron  a liderar la banca de emprendimiento los negocios de los socios, son; tienda de barrio, venta de productos naturales para la salud, venta de cosméticos, taller de stops, venta de refrescos, confección de tejidos y venta de huevo. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano y artefactos eléctricos, su forma de vender es ambulantemente, para vender ropa cada día carga su morral lleno de prendas para buscar un sitio comercial y armar su puesto de venta, su segunda actividad consiste en ofertar productos domésticos como cafeteras, sandwicheras, termos y otros a empleados en sus puestos de trabajo, “me dedico al comercio ambulante toda mi vida…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con rutas establecidas, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar mercadería. Su sueño es tener su propia tienda, ella desea comprar mercadería de temporada por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuenciad e préstamos con la institución en 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad de forma continua.
Es por esos motivos que Marcia solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería de temporada por mayor para vender por mayor.
texts.en:
Marcia is a 41 year old woman. She is married and has two children aged 10 and 20 years. Her business is selling used clothing and selling seasonal items.

She is enterprising, a good mother and very responsible. Her business is carried out in the ‘Plan 3000’ neighborhood which is known as a place people migrate from the country to the city.

Marcia is dark-skinned, short and robust (she is seated in the center with a white purse ). Her native language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband who works as a driver and her children who study and work. They live in their own house made of wood that has all the basic services. The desire to improve her business led her to head a communal bank whose members have businesses like: a neighborhood store, selling natural health products, an automobile shop, selling soft drinks, making fabric and selling eggs.

Her business is selling used clothing and electric products. She sells itinerantly. To sell clothing she carries her knapsack every day full of clothing to find a commercial area and sets up her sales space. Her other activity is offering domestic products like coffee machines, sandwich makers thermos and others to other employees at their work place. "I have worked in itinerant sales all my life", she commented. The advantage of her business is that she has established routes, her disadvantage is the lack of money to buy merchandise. Her dream is to have her own store. She wants to buy seasonal merchandise wholesale. This is her first loan with the institution in the ten years she has done this work without stop.

It is for these reasons that Marcia is requesting a loan to buy seasonal merchandise wholesale to sell wholesale.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise wholesale to sell wholesale.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad es una gran persona, luchador que todos los días trabaja por su amada familia, él tiene 40 años de edad,  y gracias al crédito pudo comprar sus fertilizantes y semillas de cebolla a Dios gracias una buena cosecha pudo obtener, y con sus ganancias las necesidades de su familia logro cubrir. El cultivo de cebolla ha sido su mayor fuente de ingresos, por esa razón con el afán de seguir cultivando y con ello generando ingresos nuevamente solicita un préstamo para la compra de semillas de cebolla y fertilizantes.
Su gran anhelo es mejorar la calidad de su vivienda para una mejor.
texts.en:
Natividad is a great person, a fighter who works everyday for his dear family. He is 40 years old and thanks to a loan, he was able to buy his fertilizers and onion seed. Thanks to God, he had a good crop and was able to cover his family's expenses with his earnings.

His onion crop has been his best source of income. As a result, with the hope of continuing to grow it and thus generating new income, he's seeking a loan to buy onion seeds and fertilizers. His biggest desire is to better the quality of his home.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Hace seis años que José María se ha dedicado a la siembra y cosecha de granos básicos junto a su familia, esta actividad es muy productiva para él ya que de allí obtienen sus ingresos para sostener el hogar. José María es un  joven de 26 años y aún está soltero, pero en un futuro desea tener su propia familia y como hombre responsable  darle una vida mejor y que  pueda tener muchos beneficios, como por ejemplo el acceso a la iluminación, ya que en la comunidad de Olanchito, Yoro, donde el reside no cuentan  con energía eléctrica y esto dificulta algunas tareas del hogar y ocasiona tener que iluminarse con lámparas a base de kerosén que aparte de generar problemas de salud ocasiona gastos para su economía. Por estas razones José María solicita a Soluz Honduras un préstamo para adquirir un kit solar para iluminación y comunicación, el cual le ayudara a tener una mejor calidad de vida para él y su futura familia.
texts.en:
For six years, José María has worked along with his family sowing and harvesting basic grains. This activity is very productive for him, since from it he earns income to support his home.

José María is a young man, age 26. He is still single, but in the future he wants to have his own family and, like a responsible man, to give them a better life and help them have many benefits, like, for example, access to lighting, since in the community of Olanchito, Yoro, where he lives, there is no electric energy. This makes some household tasks difficult, and causes them to have to light the house with kerosene lamps, which, aside from causing health problems, incur expenses for their budget.

For these reasons, José María is requesting a loan from Soluz Honduras, in order to acquire a solar kit for lighting and communication, which will help him and his future family have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a kit of solar lamps for lighting, which will greatly improve his family's quality of life.

loans.name: Emily

texts.es:
Emily es una mujer de 40 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tienen una hija de 3 años y su negocio es la confección de camisetas y ropa deportiva.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la ‘zona la merced’ caracterizada por encontrarse sobre la ladera oeste de la ciudad.
Emily es morena de cabello largo negro y físico mediano, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio y con su hija que aún no está en edad escolar. Viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la confección de ropa deportiva como; poleras, camisetas, shorts, pantalones y chaquetas, “mis hermanos mayores me enseñaron a costurar, ahora es mi propio negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que vende por mayor, la desventaja es la falta de máquina de coser. Su sueño es consolidar su taller de costura para recibir pedidos de empresas por mayor, ella desea comprar una máquina de coser overlock. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Emily solicita un préstamo para comprar una máquina de coser industrial para confeccionar ropa deportiva.
texts.en:
Emily is a 40-year-old woman. She lives with her partner, and they have a 3-year-old daughter. Her business is the production of t-shirts and athletic clothing.

She is a good mother, enterprising, and very responsible. She carries out her business in the “La Merced” zone, which is located on the western side of the city.

Emily has a dark complexion, long black hair, and a medium build. Her native language is Aymara, and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her partner, who works in the same business, and with her daughter, who has not yet reached school age. They live in a rented room made of brick, which has all the basic services.

Her business is the production of athletic clothing, such as polo shirts, t-shirts, shorts, pants, and jackets. “My older siblings taught me how to sew, and now it is my own business,” she comments. The advantage of her business is that she sells at wholesale. The disadvantage is the lack of a sewing machine. Her dream is to strengthen her sewing workshop in order to receive wholesale orders from businesses. She wants to buy an overlock sewing machine. This is her first loan cycle with the lending institution in the five years in which she has been working in this business.

It is for these reasons that Emily is requesting a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine to make athletic clothing.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine to make athletic clothing.

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es:
José, de 54 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador muy reconocido en su comunidad, estudio hasta tercer grado,  porque su familia no tenía los ingresos suficientes para poder darle los estudios, está casado y tiene 4 hijos en común, dos ellos ya están casados y viven aparte. 

José, es ganadero desde joven porque su papá le enseño ese oficio, para que tuviera una herramienta para generar ingresos; pero aparte de eso también le enseño la agricultura y gracias a eso es un hombre responsable y trabajador.

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca lechera para engordarla y poder vender los derivados de la leche.  

Su sueño es, seguir trabajando para poder garantizar el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
José, 54, is a hardworking man who's very well known in his community. He studied until third grade because his family didn't have enough income to give him schooling. He's married and has four children. Two are marries and live separate from him.

José has been a rancher from a young age because his father taught him the job so he would have a tool to earn income. Aside from this, he was also taught agriculture and thanks to this is a responsible and hardworking man.

José needs the loan to buy a milk cow to fatten, and to be able to sell milk products. His dream is to continue working to be able to guarantee his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow to fatten, and to be able to sell milk products.

loans.name: Dildakan

texts.ru: Дилдакан, 62 года, замужем, 4 детей. У нее высшее образование, с 1998 года она занимается сельским хозяйством. У Дилдакан есть 2 коровы, 8 овец и 5 лошадей, на 1,54 Га земли выращивает картофель и кукурузу. Также Дилдакан занимается пчеловодством, в пасеке имеется 60 ящиков пчелосемей. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 35,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Дилдакан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Dildakan is 62, married, and the mother of four children.  She has a college education and has been involved in agriculture since 1998.  She currently has two cows, eight sheep, and five horses, and she grows potatoes and corn on 1.54 hectares of land.  She is also involved in bee-keeping and her apiary consists of 60 hives.  She makes a monthly income of 35,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her business, Dildakan has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy a few calves and increase her cattle headcount.  She is planning to re-invest the earnings from her loan into further growing her farming business.

loans.use: to buy a few calves in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Rosario Marilu

texts.es:
Rosario, tiene como negocio la venta de variedad de bebidas refrescantes, lo tiene en funcionando desde hace cinco años, ya ha ganado popularidad entre sus clientes, está casado, vive con su esposa e hijos en un ambiente muy armonioso.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar agua, gaseosas y jugos, con lo que presentará a sus clientes nuevas opciones de compra, está motivada a trabajar muy duro para incrementar sus ventas y ganancias, ya que así disminuirá las carencias de su hogar.
La visión es mantenerse trabajando de manera honrada para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y ver crecer  a sus hijos  en un ambiente saludable.
texts.en:
Rosario’s business is the sale of a variety of refreshing beverages. She has been operating this business for five years. She has already gained popularity amongst her customers. She is married, and lives with her spouse and children in a very harmonious environment.

She will use the loan to buy water, soda, and juice, which will present to her customers new options for purchase. She is motivated to work very hard to increase her sales and profits, since this way she will decrease the deficiencies of her home.

Her vision is to support herself by working in an honorable matter, in order to bring daily support to her home and see her children grow up in a healthy environment.

loans.use: to buy water, soda, and juice, which will present new options for purchase to her customers.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos, en este momento no cuenta con los recursos económicos para continuar con su negocio, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, insecticidas y herbicidas, asimismo pagara los costos de preparación de la tierra para sembrar maíz, espera obtener una cosecha más abundante.
Al utilizar créditos ha mantenido su fuente de ingresos activa, las cosechas son cada vez mejores, su familia se mantiene y viven con estilo de vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Carlos is requesting another loan because at the moment he doesn't have the financial resources to continue with his business. He's going to buy soil amendments, insecticide, and herbicide, and pay to prepare the land for planting corn. He hopes to get a more abundant harvest.

With the loans he has maintained a steady income. The harvests are better all the time, he's supporting his family, and they're living a more comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, insecticide, and herbicide, and to pay to prepare the land for planting corn

loans.name: Dzhanylkan

texts.ru: Джанылкан, 60 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, сейчас на пенсии. Джанылкан в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи в 1998 году начала свой бизнес в полеводстве и животноводстве. Благодаря упорному труду она на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеет корову, 10 овец, 2 лошади. На участке 4,34 Га она выращивает картофель и фасоль, есть фркутовый сад. Видя хороший источник дохода в сельском хозяйстве, Джанылкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений для обработки почвы и выращивания экологически чистой фасоли. Доходы от кредита Джанылкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства, что позволит накопить на покупку коров.
texts.en: Dzhanylkan is 60, married, and the mother of five children.  She has a specialized secondary education and is now retired.  As she was looking for a source of income for her family, she started her own crop farming and animal husbandry business in 1998.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has one cow, 10 sheep and two horses on her farm.  She also grows potatoes and beans on 4.34 hectares of land and she has an orchard.  Having found a good source of income in agriculture, Dzhanylkan has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  This loan will help her to buy mineral fertilizers to prepare her land and to grow organic beans.  Dzhanylkan is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her farming business, which will in turn allow her to save enough money to buy a few more cows.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to cultivate her land and grow organic beans.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: Hace 8 años que Reina se  dedica a la agricultura y a la siembra de granos básicos como frijol, maíz y café junto a su esposo Rigoberto. Tiene 46 años y ha trabajado muy duro para darle un mejor futuro a su familia. Por lo que con su esfuerzo ha logrado que sus hijos puedan estudiar y ya solo hace falta la hija más pequeña a la cual Reina también quiere ofrecerle la mejor  educación, sin embargo este objetivo siempre se ha complicado ya que en la comunidad de Olanchito, Honduras, no hay acceso a energía eléctrica, lo cual genera problemas cuando su niña necesita hacer tareas o algún trabajo escolar. Asimismo para ella y el resto de la familia es un inconveniente ya que al no tener electricidad deben iluminarse con lámparas a base de kerosén  y ocote lo cual es dañino para la salud por los gases tóxicos que despide. Por estos motivos Reina está solicitando a Soluz Honduras un préstamo para adquirir un sistema solar el cual le ayudara con los problemas de iluminación y carga de celulares
texts.en: Eight years ago Reina began working in agriculture and growing staple grains such as beans, corn and coffee, together with her husband Rigoberto.  She is 46 years old and has worked very hard to provide a better future for her family.  Through her effort she has managed to allow her children to go to school, and now only her youngest daughter remains, to whom Reina also wants to provide the best education.  Nevertheless, this goal has always been complicated since in the community of Olanchito, Honduras, there is no access to electricity.  This generates problems when her daughter needs to do homework or other school work.  Similarly, for her and the rest of the family, it's an inconvenience in that without electricity they must use kerosene or pine oil lamps which are damaging to their health because of the toxic gases they emit.  For these reasons, Reina is seeking  a loan from Soluz Honduras to acquire a solar powered lighting system that will help with lighting problems and charging cell phones.

loans.use: to buy a solar powered lighting system that will better the living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Wend Layembre Group

texts.fr: karidiatou, est une femme agée de 34 ans, mariée mère de 5 enfants. elle exerce son activité depuis 3 ans. ce qui fait marcher son activité c'est son dynamisme, sa diversité de ses repas, le respect et l'écoute de sa clientèle, la bonne emplacement de son restaurant. Elle veut acheter du haricot à 50 000 f, acheter des bidons d'huile à 50 000, 50 000  de maïs et 25 000 f de bois. L'utilité du prêt c'est de pouvoir s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin de satisfaire ses clients. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 3 fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Karidiatou is 34, married, and the mother of five children.  She has been working for three years.  The success of her business lies in Karidiatou's energy, in the variety of the dishes that she prepares, in the location of her restaurant, and in the relationships she has built with her customers (relationships based on respect and active listening).

Karidiatou wants to buy 50,000 francs worth of beans, 50,000 francs worth of oil cans, 50,000 francs worth of corn, and 25,000 francs worth of wood. This loan means a lot to her because it will allow her to buy enough supplies to meet the needs of her customers.  She has already taken three previous loans, which were all repaid on time.

loans.use: to buy beans, several cans of oil, corn and wood.

loans.name: Florette

texts.fr:
Florette est une femme de 35 ans qui vit en ville avec son mari et ses 2 enfants. Elle tient un commerce de produits locaux dans le grand marché de la ville depuis 4 ans. 
Elle est aussi emprunteuse chez Vahatra depuis 4 ans. Les prêts d’avant lui ont permis de diversifier les produits locaux à vendre. Les bénéfices servaient à renforcer le capital de l’activité. Avec ce prêt, elle projette d’augmenter son stock de produits locaux en achetant 500 Kg de sucre, 50 litres d’huile, 100 Kg de café et 200 Kg de farine. 
Elle espère gagner plus de bénéfices qu'avant pour arriver à constituer beaucoup d’épargne afin de construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Florette is 35; she lives in the city with her husband and her two children.  For the past four years, she has been selling local food products at her city's main market.  She has also been a client of Kiva's partner, Vahatra, for four years.  Her previous loans have helped her to diversify her inventory of local products, and her profits have allowed her to boost her capital.  

Florette is planning to use this loan to increase her stock of local products and she will spend her money to buy 500 kilos of sugar, 50 liters of oil, 100 kilos of coffee, and 200 kilos of flour.  She is hoping to increase her profits, which will help her to save more and to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy 500 kilos of sugar, 50 liters of oil, 100 kilos of coffee and 200 kilos of flour to resell in her shop.

loans.name: Turiyage Group

texts.fr:
Rénilde fait partie du groupe  Turiyage  et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 43 ans et est mariée à Léon, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants, dont  3 étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de bière  depuis  3 ans. 

Elle est à son troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bière  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait augmenter son capital.
texts.en:
Rénilde is a member of the Turiyage group and she lives in Gitega.  She is 43 and married to Léon, a farmer.  Rénilde and Léon have five children, three of whom are in school.  Rénilde has been selling beer for three years.

This is Rénilde's third loan with Kiva's partner, Turame.  Thanks to this new loan, financed by Kiva, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of beer for resale, which will in turn help her increase her income.  In the coming years, Rénilde would like to continue to boost her capital.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy large quantities of beer for resale.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Valentín, de 64 años de edad, es un hombre honesto, estudio hasta segundo grado, porque la escuela estaba lejos y la situación económica de su familia no se lo permitió, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos en común.   

Valentín, es agricultor y trabaja desde muy pequeño porque su padre le enseño el oficio y principios que le permiten hoy ser una persona ejemplar y reconocida en su comunidad, que a pesar de las dificultades económicas ha logrado sacar a delante a su familia de la mano de su pareja.

Valentín, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas, ya que están en la etapa que necesita el abono para poder obtener más rendimiento en sus cosechas.  

Sus sueños son poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Valentín, 64, is an honest man who went as far as second grade in school, because the school was far away and the financial situation of his family did not allow him to attend. He is married with 2 children.

Valentín is a farmer, and has been working since he was very young, because his father taught him the occupation and the principles that today allow him to be an exemplary person, well known in his community, who despite financial difficulties, and with his wife's help, has succeeded in helping his family get ahead in life.

Valentín needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies, as they are at the stage where they need fertilizer to obtain greater yield in their harvests.

His dream is to be able to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Together with her husband, Dulce earns a living through buying and selling multicabs (a kind of custom-made vehicle that can accommodate up to 20 passengers); they buy used multicabs and modernize some needed parts to improve the model.

They also own an auto shop located in their town. They have been operating this for 14 years to provide for the needs of their family. Dulce is a married woman and a mother of four children, aged 15, 13, 12, and 11 years old.

Thus, she is asking for a bigger amount of loans for additional capital to buy muliticabs. 33-year-old Dulce wants to sustain her business for her family. She wants to give a good education to her children for them to have better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy multicabs to resell.

loans.name: Nehemiah

texts.en:
Nehemiah is a Kiva borrower. He has four children. He describes himself to be reliable.

He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, rice, bread, flour, cooking oil, and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, salt, and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years.

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, salt, and other items.

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.es:
Hermenegildo con 57 años, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa familiar,junto a su cónyuge en el distrito de Nueva Arica,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Hermenegildo cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Hermenegildo se dedica a prestar servicio de peón jornalero, con una experiencia de hace más de 05 años en el rubro. Solicita préstamo para la compra de algunas herramientas de jornalería las cuales las utiliza en su labor diaria.

Hermenegildo si cuenta con experiencia crediticia, en Edpyme Alternativa es su tercer préstamo.
texts.en:
Hermenegildo is 57 years old and has a common law marriage. He lives in his family house with his spouse in the District of New Arica, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region, Perú. Hermenegildo has very good personal and professional references from the residents of the area. The inhabitants of this locality make their living in agriculture, livestock and trade.

Hermenegildo makes his living by serving as a journeyman laborer, with more than 5 years of experience in this business. He is asking for a loan in order to buy some journeyman tools which he uses in his daily work.

Hermenegildo is a repeat borrower with Edpyme Alternativa, this is his third loan.

loans.use: to buy some journeyman tools.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 37 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. Her business is a small shop. She has been in the business for six years. She earns a monthly income of 6,000 KES.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of sugar, salt, bread, rice, etc., for sale.

She will use the profits from expanded business to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a big business and a stable family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sugar, salt, bread, rice, etc., for sale.

loans.name: Ratna And Group

texts.en:
