With the hope of becoming a successful entrepreneur, Ratna formed a group with six other women: Kabita, Lily, Rina, Dipti, Sangita, and Dipa. They hail from the state of Assam.

Ratna is a widow and a mother of three. She is a clothing seller, doing door to door selling in the nearby villages. With the increasing cost of living, her monthly income is not sufficient to meet the expenditure of the family.

Thinking of the advantage the upcoming festivals bring, she wants to expand her business volume. She plans to sell kurtis, pants, shirts, etc., but the lack of working capital is stopping her from expanding her business.

The rest of the members in her group also want to expand their respective businesses. So, to meet their working capital requirement, they applied for a loan for 236,000 INR together. With the loan, Ratna will be able to add more stock to her clothing business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to expand her clothes selling business.

loans.name: Juliah

texts.en:
Juliah is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be ambitious.

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cereals and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals and vegetables.

loans.name: Oquilya

texts.en:
Oquilya is a sari-sari store owner from Albuera, Leyte. She is married and a mother of five children; ages 10, 8, 5, 3, and 1 year old.

Her husband is a tricycle driver and works hard to provide for the needs of their family. Thus, Oquilya is asking for a loan to buy assorted grocery items such as canned goods, spices, noodles, cooking oil, eggs, chips, biscuits, candies, sugar, powdered milk and chocolate drink, toiletries, laundry soap and drinks. She will also need to buy spare parts for their tricycle.

In the future, Oquilya wishes to have a stable and sustainable livelihood to have enough income for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, spices, noodles, cooking oil, eggs, chips, biscuits, candies, sugar, powdered milk and chocolate drink, toiletries, drinks, etc., as well as spare parts.

loans.name: Jeannine

texts.fr:
Jeannine a 32 ans. Elle est mère célibataire d'un jeune garçon de 12 ans. Ce dernier est en classe de 4ème actuellement et n'habite pas avec elle mais avec ses parents à la campagne. Elle leur envoi de l'argent mensuellement et régulièrement pour leurs dépenses.
Elle tient un taxi-phone il y a long temps et depuis 2013 elle démarrait l'activité de vente des volailles pour augmenter et améliorer le revenu. Elle voudrait développer cette deuxième activité d'où la raison de sa demande de prêt. Sa priorité est l'éducation de son fils et puis elle épargne pour pouvoir réaliser son rêve de construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Jeannine is 32 years old. She is an unmarried mother of a young boy, aged 12, who is currently in the 8th grade. The boy does not live with her but rather with his relatives in the countryside. Jeannine sends them money monthly and regularly for their expenses.

Jeannine has owned a pay phone for a long time. And, in 2013, she started a business selling poultry in order to increase and improve her income. She would like to develop this second business, thus the reason for the loan request. Her priority is her son’s education and then her savings, so that she may realize her dream of building a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Manale

texts.en:
Manale is a 41 year-old Lebanese married woman, living with her husband, and mother of three children, all of whom are still studying. She cooperates with her husband in order to satisfy their daily needs.

Manale works as a teacher in a local school. Currently, with the aim of buying books for the new school year, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She states that with her Kiva loan, she will be able to help them to pursue a good education what makes her very happy.

loans.use: to buy books for the new school year

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.en:
Leocadia has traded in textile clothes and cosmetics, plus tailoring, as her major sources of income since 1995, and she supplements her income with cattle rearing and a maize milling machine.

She lives in Kagadi-Uganda; she is 52 years old and married. She engaged in business because she loved tailoring.

She needs a loan to buy clothes and increase her stock. She has dreams of expanding her business; however, her major challenge is competition from people with similar business.

Leocadia is thankful to Kiva for the support given her through the previous loan since she was able to buy clothes to sell and realized tangible benefits.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita lives in the rural town of Sagbayan, Bohol . She raises hogs to earn a living. She has been selling hogs to the locals and town settlers in her place for almost 10 years now. She has four children. Two of them are still attending school.

She decided to increase her current business but the main issue is insufficient numbers of pigs being raised. Therefore Rosita is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner CEVI because she has to to buy piglets.

In this way she will be able to cope with demands. She can use the profit amount as savings to fulfill the future needs as well.

Rosita is very thankful to Kiva and CEVI.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Katikengeye Tulibamwe Group

texts.en:
Monic is a female, aged 30 years, and a mother of three children. She is married and living in Kagadi-Uganda with her family.

Monic owns a restaurant, which she started in 2010 due to her love for catering and also to earn a living. She does farming too to supplement on her income. She has been able to educate her children and look after her family.

Her dream is to buy land for commercial agriculture in future. She will use this loan to buy chairs and utensils for her restaurant. She is a member of Katikengeye Tulibamu group where members guarantee each other to get loans as they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy chairs and utensils for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making baskets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal, 4 sacks of rice, and boxes of soap.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 36 años, vive en Atlántida, Honduras y conoce las ventajas que un sistema solar ofrece ya que hace varios años  adquirió uno, debido a que en su comunidad no hay acceso a energía eléctrica. Sin embargo al pasar el tiempo y por el uso del mismo, algunos componentes del sistema solar se han dañado y Rosario ha tenido que desactivarlo, ya que no tiene los recursos suficientes para la reactivación.  Rosario tiene un negocio donde vende productos alimenticios y de higiene personal y desde hace tres años se dedica a la siembra de palma africana, lo que junto a lo que le aporta su esposo; quien vive fuera del país, le ayuda para el sostenimiento de sus dos hijos. Ella necesita reactivar su sistema para poder darles una mejor atención a sus clientes, ya que tendría una buena iluminación y además sus niños podrían elaborar sus tareas sin ninguna dificultad.  Es por esto que solicita a Soluz Honduras este préstamo que le ayudara a poder adquirir  el paquete de productos sostenibles que su sistema solar necesita para poder reactivarlo y gozar nuevamente de los beneficios que le ofrece a ella, a su familia y a su comunidad.
texts.en:
Rosario is 36 years old. She lives in Atlántida, Honduras and she knows the benefits of solar-generated electricity. A number of years ago, she acquired such a system because there is no electric power in her community. As time passed and as she used her system, a few of the system's components have broken and she had to deactivate the system. She hasn't had enough money to reactivate it. 
Rosario has a business selling basic foodstuffs and toiletry items. Three years ago she also began cultivating african palm trees, which she does along with the support of her husband, who lives out of the country and helps her care for their two children. 
She needs to reactivate her electricity system to improve the service to her customers by providing better lighting. This will also enable her children to study without difficulty. For this reason, Rosario requests a loan from Soluz Honduras, which will help her purchase a package of sustainably-produced products which her solar system needs in order to be reactivated. This way she will again enjoy the benefits which it offers to her, her family and the community.

loans.use: to purchase the components she needs to repair her solar electricity system.

loans.name: Seiphorn's Group

texts.en: Seiphorn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Seiphorn makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer and officer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat is 38 years old and he lives in Kapan city of Syunik region. Marat has no higher education but since having big family he managed to settle a business thanks to which he sustains his family needs. Marat has three daughter and all of them are still school-aged. Marat with his own car gives taxi services and he also drives people to very far distances (to Russian Federation or to Georgia as well). Since being very accurate and attentive driver he always manages to have orders and a lot of regular customers from his city. Marat’s car is always clean and comfortable and he drives slowly and safely. Being the only bread-winner in his family he works all the days of the week and sometimes he even has to drive till late at the night.

Now this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams is very urgent and important for him as his car’s engine is out of order and he must repair it quickly but well enough in order to work without problems and manage all the taxi service orders.

loans.use: to repair his car’s engine as it is out of order so as to work without problems and manage all the taxi service orders.

loans.name: Hope Foundation Silc Group

texts.en:
Zelda 56 years, is a widow living with 3 grand children from Kyenjojo, Uganda. She established a food stall selling fresh food like beans tomatoes, vegetables, onions and banana among others. She has been operating it for over ten years supplemented with crop farming income. Zelda started this business after she lost the husband where she even failed to raise school fees for her children who ended up dropping out from school and all got married. These children started producing and in the same way their parents would not meet some needs like paying school fees due to poor foundation hence she had to take over the responsibility of school fees for the 3 grand children.

With the help of the group, she has been getting loans to pay school fees and is a good member of Hope Foundation Silc where group members guarantee other for any loan amount when need arises. Therefore, Zelda is requesting for a loan facility to pay school fees for her grand children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her grand children.

loans.name: Khan's Group

texts.en: Khan’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Khan makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer and seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a wife and mother dedicated to her work. At age 32, she spends every day of the week, Monday through Sunday, on her mixed farm, tirelessly working. Naomi is one of the most hardworking and dedicated women on planet Earth. She is based in Kamobo, a remote village in the Nandihills area of Kenya. Since she was a girl, she learned to do all of the tasks involved in farming, thanks to her parents' teaching. Naomi and her husband are blessed with a lovely family of three children.

Naomi has been a farmer for more than ten years. She keeps poultry for eggs and cows for milk and grows maize and vegetables for sale. She also engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path (assisting farmers in carrying farm produce using her bicycle). Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Naomi is very passionate and optimistic about the future of farming in Kenya.

Naomi is seeking a loan to expand her farm. She intends to buy farm implements. This move is quite a big deal for her. With the loan she will be able to buy farm inputs such as animal feeds and fertilizers that will help in increasing production in her farm.

In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my children.”

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is therefore listing Elvie's business again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Ma. Melba

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ma. Melba works hard to support her family.

She has a business farming vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Ma. Melba is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her vegetable-farming business.

Ma. Melba has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en:
Cerelina is 34 years old and married with two children. One of her children who is currently in school.

Cerelina is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been raising livestock for 8 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Marie Olga

texts.fr:
47 ans, Olga est mariée et son mari est chauffeur de taxi. Il n'est pas encore propriétaire du véhicule. Le couple est parent de trois enfants de 13, 17 et 19 ans. Ces enfants sont tous scolarisés dans des écoles chrétiennes privées et sont respectivement en classe de 4ème, 1ère et Terminale. 
Elle travaillait dans une entreprise de zone franche auparavant puis elle était nounou. En 2013, elle commençait à exploiter l'activité de vente des tissus. C'est une activité rarement pratiqué dans le lieu où elle vend, donc elle n'a pas de concurrent. Le développement et l'amélioration de son commerce fait partie de sa priorité actuellement. d'où la raison de sa demande de crédit. Il y a aussi les études de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Olga is forty-seven years old and married to a taxi driver. Her husband does not yet own his taxi vehicle. The couple has three children (thirteen, seventeen and nineteen years old) who all attend private, Christian schools. They are in the fourth grade, first grade and final year respectively.

Olga used to work in the duty-free area, then she was a children's nanny. In 2013 she began selling fabric. This is not a product which is sold by many people so she doesn't have many competitors. Her current priority is to develop and improve her business so she is requesting this loan. She will also use some of it to provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fabric remnants, fabric for aprons and other fabrics.

loans.name: Velomanana Angeline

texts.fr:
Angeline est une jeune femme active  et dynamique de 24 ans. Elle est mariée et son époux est chauffeur de taxi-bus. Le couple a trois enfants de 1, 3 et 6 ans. Les deux premiers  sont scolarisés dans une école primaire publique de son quartier. 
Angeline choisissait d'accéder dans le secteur commerce comme activité source de revenu pour gagner sa vie. Les marchandises ne sont pas fixes mais varient selon les saisons, les circonstances et surtout les besoins des consommateurs. En cette période de rentrée scolaire, les marchandises proposées sont des fournitures scolaires.
Le développement de cette activité fait partie de sa priorité et le prêt va lui permettre d'en réaliser une partie.
texts.en:
Angeline is a young, dynamic, twenty-four-year-old woman. She is married to a taxi-bus driver and they have three children (one, three and six years old). The eldest two attend a local, public primary school.

Angeline decided to work in commerce to earn a living and she sells various items depending on the season, her situation and the needs of her customers. At the moment she is selling school equipment as it is the start of the school year. Her loan will help her to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy exercise books, pens, erasers, slates, coloured pencils, rulers and other stationery supplies.

loans.name: Sardian

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Sardian works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming coconuts. Sardian is borrowing PHP 45,000 through NWTF to buy fruit and vegetables to sell on her food stall.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Madilyn

texts.en:
Madilyn is 39 years old and single with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Madilyn is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Madilyn has been in this business for 4 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Mariette

texts.fr:
A 63 ans, Mariette continue encore d'exercer l'activité familiale: élevage de porc. Elle exerçait déjà cette activité quand elle vivait encore avec ses parents. Selon elle l'élevage de porc la passionne beaucoup, et elle peut exploiter d'autres activités avec comme les cultures des légumes, gestion d'un petit commerce. En plus, son mari travaille dans une entreprise de fabrication et distribution des engrais et provendes. 
Le couple est parent de 9 enfants âgés de 20 à 40 ans. Ils sont tous déjà indépendants et autonomes. Le but de son travail acharné c'est pour sa sécurité et sa retraite. Il 'y aura pas de pension à toucher.
texts.en:
Mariette is sixty-three years old and is still working in the family business raising pigs. She began working in this business when she was still living with her parents. She enjoys this work and it enables her to earn money by growing vegetables and selling various products. Her husband works in a fertilizer and animal feed manufacturing unit.

The couple has nine children aged between twenty and forty years old. They are all independent and live away from home. Mariette continues to work to maintain her financial security and provide for her retirement. There is no pension available.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and feed for them.

loans.name: Godliver

texts.en:
GODLIVER, who is in her early 50s is married with one grown up child. She has been a food vendor for seven years now. She works from 6am to 4pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be GODLIVER's 21st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase mamalishe stock and now the business is doing great. She can now serve many clients and is really happy with the loan. She used the profits to buy a plot of land, put electricity in her house, repay her loan and cover the household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the mamalishe store. She dreams of owning a hotel one day.

GODLIVER will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in mamalishe store.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 47 years old. He is married and blessed with four children. His business is poultry farming. He has been in the business for three years. He earns a monthly income of twenty eight thousand Kenya shillings.


This is his first term with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to purchase chicken feeds. He will use the profits from his business to educate his children as well as service the loan. His hopes and dreams are to be large scale poultry farmer one day.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feeds.

loans.name: Agata

texts.en: Agata is a Kiva borrower. She has 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals from her farm. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy farm inputs to enable her produce more cereals. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is a hardworking female entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She would like to borrow PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from food vending.

Vanessa dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 19 year-old Lebanese man, who is single and lives with his parents and sibling. His father provides the main source of income for the family while Ali focuses on his study.  Ali is a student in law school. Today, he is in need of a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay his university fees. In the future, he is planning to request more loans to ensure a great educational path for him to be able to work at a proper company and gain good experience in his field.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a cyber café where he offers internet browsing and printing services. He has been involved in this business for 12 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy cyber café equipment. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy cyber café equipment.

loans.name: Wajiha

texts.en: Wajiha is a 34-year-old married woman living with her husband and her five children. Her husband is the main income source in the family and works as a mechanic. With the aim to help her children with their education, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to be able to pay their school educational fees. Her only dream is to ensure that they have a happy life and help them to achieve high educational levels, and to ensure that she always satisfies their needs.

loans.use: to pay her children's school educational fees.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina tiene una tortillería y en la época de fin de año vende pólvora, vive con sus hijos, los cuales ya están acompañados, ella está soltera y tiene apoyo de sus parientes, cuenta con varios años de dedicarse a este negocio, lo aprendió por cuenta propia, manifiesta que según sea la temporada o fechas especiales ofrece diferentes productos.
La idea de solicitar un crédito es prepararse para la temporada que se acerca de fin de año, comprara maíz y pólvora, adquirirá la mercadería al mayoreo lo que le permitirá pagar un precio más bajo, espera que con esta inversión su negocio sea más rentable y ofrecer a sus clientes nuevos productos. 
Su visión es ampliar su negocio, construir una casa nueva y resarcir su deuda.
texts.en:
Marina has a tortilla business and at the end of the year, she sells gunpowder. She lives with her children, who are partnered. She is single and has the support of her relatives. She has been working at her business for some years, she learned it on her own and says that according to the seasons or special dates, she offers different products.

The idea to ask for a loan is to prepare herself for the upcoming season of the end of the year, she will purchase corn and gunpowder. She will get the merchandise in bulk which will allow her to pay lower prices, She hopes that with this investment, her business will be more profitable and to offer her customers new products.

Her vision is to expand her business, build a new house and pay off her debt.

loans.use: to purchase more corn and gunpowder, she will get the merchandise in bulk which will allow her to pay a lower price.

loans.name: Marvin Edilberto

texts.es:
Marvin, es una persona muy trabajadora, estudio hasta quinto grado, porque su familia no tenía los recursos económicos necesarios para que él pudiera continuar con sus estudios, está acompañado y no tiene hijos.

Marvin, se dedica a prestar sus servicios como taxista desde hace 3 años, este trabajo lo aprendió por medio de un amigo que se dedicaba a la misma actividad; Marvin, trabaja todos los días en su moto-taxi en la misma zona donde vive.

Marvin, necesita el préstamo para pagar el mantenimiento de su unidad de transporte y para comprar algunos repuestos.

Él, sueña con poder construir su vivienda y poder procrear hijos.
texts.en:
Marvin is a very hardworking person. He went to school through the fifth grade because his family didn't have the economic resources necessary for him to continue his studies. He is in a relationship and has no children.

Marvin has been a taxi driver for three years. He learned this occupation through a friend who does the same work. He works every day in his moto-taxi in the area where he lives.

Marvin needs the loan to pay for the maintenance on his taxi and to buy some spare parts.

He dreams of being able to build his own house and of having children.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance on his taxi and to buy some spare parts.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta es una mujer de 46 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de productos básicos gracias a su espíritu emprendedor cuenta cada día con más clientes que solicitan de sus productos, por lo que se siente muy feliz de contar con una buena clientela. Marta con mucho esfuerzo logro construir su vivienda en la que vive desde hace 14 años, actualmente su única compañía es una nieto de 3 años de edad al que cuida con mucho cariño. Marta desea surtir más su tienda de productos básicos y de esta manera aumentar sus ganancias, ya que es su única fuente de ingresos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cereales, lácteos, golosinas, bebidas frías entre otros productos para surtir su negocio. Con el crédito anterior Marta logro mejorar el cuarto de su vivienda, por lo que se siente muy agradecida.
texts.en: Marta is a 46-year-old woman who works selling basic products. Thanks to her enterprising spirit, she has more customers every day who request her products, so she is very happy to have a good customer base. Marta, with a lot of effort, managed to build her house in which she has lived for 14 years. Currently, her only company is a 3-year-old grandson who she cares for with a lot of love. Marta wants to stock her store with basic products and in this way to increase her earnings, since it is her only source of income. For this, she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in cereals, dairy products, candies, cold drinks, and other products to stock her business. With the previous loan, Marta managed to improve her house's room, for which she is very grateful.

loans.use: to invest in cereals, dairy products, candies, cold drinks, and other products to stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riego se dedica al cultivo de guayabas desde hace 2 años comercializa sus prodcutos en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene clientes establecidos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa con su padre, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de controles de plagas, abonos y fertilizantes para tener una buena cosecha de guayabas y tener buenos ingresos economcios.
texts.en: The young man, whose face has been pixelated because he is 26 years old and lives in a high risk zone, has worked cultivating guavas for 2 years. He sells his products in the neighboring towns and has established customers. With the earnings that he gets, he manages to cover some of the household expenses. The young man lives at home with his father, he is asking for a loan to purchase pesticides, manure, and fertilizer to have a good guava harvest and to have good income.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides, manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 26-year-old married woman living with her husband. She is the mother of two children who are still attending school. Her husband represents the main source of income for the family; he works as electrician and also as a DJ.

Today she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to be able to pay her children's educational fees.

This is her first loan, but she said that she will be a permanent client and is eager to borrow additional loans in the future.

loans.use: to pay her children's educational fees.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest.

Violet operates a farm where she grows maize and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in weather.

She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

Violet's business goal is to increase her farming area within five years.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana con 55 años de edad,de estado civil separada, vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Sebastiana cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los habitantes de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,siendo el cultivo de arroz el de mayor producción, así como el comercio en general.

Sebastiana se dedica ala cría y comercio de ganado porcino. Así mismo a la cría de animales menores como son gallinas, patos,etc. La venta de las crías de su ganado y animales menores las realiza en su casa, con una experiencia en el rubro de más de 07 años.Solicita préstamo para invertir en la construcción de nuevos corrales de cría para su ganado y para la compra de ganado porcino para engorde. De esta manera podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.

Sebastiana es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, es su séptimo crédito, su anterior crédito fué de s/4000 a 15 meses.
texts.en:
Sebastiana, 55 years old, separated, lives with her children in the district of Pucará, Jaén province, Cajamarca department in the country of Peru. Sebastiana has very good personal and work references from the inhabitants of the zone. The people in this place work primarily in agriculture, with rice cultivation having the largest production, and also in general trade.

Sebastiana works raising and selling pigs. She also raises small animals such as chickens, ducks, etc. She sells the offspring of her pigs and small animals at her house, with over 7 years of experience in the field. She asks for a loan to invest in building new breeding pens for her animals and to purchase pigs to fatten. In this way, she will be able to get an acceptable profit to improve her quality of life.

Sebastiana is a recurring borrower with Edpyme Alternativa, this is her seventh loan, her previous loan was for 4000 Peruvian soles for 15 months.

loans.use: to invest in constructing new breeding pens for her animals and to purchase pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en:
Therese is a 48-year-old married woman living with her husband; she is the mother of two children. Her husband is the main income source in the family; he works in a company, and she is a housewife taking care of her family.

Due to the hard financial circumstances and with the aim to help her children with their education, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to be able to pay her children's school educational fees.

Her only dream is to ensure them a healthy life.

loans.use: to pay her children's school educational fees.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a farm where she grows maize and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Veronica will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Benzie

texts.en:
Benzie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Benzie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net, wood, gasoline, etc. for her business.

She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Benzie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net, wood, gasoline, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 24 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur; she has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Myrna requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Marco

texts.es: Marco de 34 años es un hombre luchador, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, allí tiene una pequeña parcela de tierra donde cultiva palma africana y mangostín desde hace tres años y también   trabaja  en el área de la agricultura y ganadería en una finca por lo cual recibe un salario  que le proporciona el sustento para él y su familia, como todo padre responsable desea darle la mejor educación posible a sus hijos para que en el futuro sean personas de bien. En la comunidad de Atlántida, Honduras donde vive Marco, no hay acceso a energía eléctrica por lo que su hijo que está en la escuela debe alumbrarse con velas y lámparas a base de kerosén para poder hacer los deberes de la escuela, además a  la esposa de Marco se le dificultan muchas tareas del hogar por la falta de iluminación y la carga de celulares. Por estas razones Marco esta solicitando a Soluz Honduras un préstamo para adquirir un sistema solar que le ayudara a que hijo realice sus tareas de mejor manera y toda su familia pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marco is a hardworking man. He lives with his wife and three children. They have a small plot of land where he been growing African palm and mangosteens for the past three years and he also works on a farm in agriculture and cattle. He receives a salary for this work, which provides him with income to support himself and his family.

Like any responsible father he would like to give his children the best education possible so that in the future they will be good people.

In the community of Atlantida, Honduras, where Marco lives, there is no access to electricity and because of that his son who studies at school has to do his homework by candlelight and kerosene lamps. Marco's wife also has difficulty with many household tasks because of the lack of lighting and cellphone charge.

For these reasons Marco is applying for a loan through Soluz Honduras to purchase a solar electricity system that will help his son to do his homework better and will help his whole family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system for his home which will help him to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.name: Jehan

texts.en:
Jehan is 33 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.

Jehan is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins .

Jehan has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a package of sustainable solar products (battery, inverter and controller) to reactivate his solar lighting system.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se esfuerza por dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida, por esa razon desde hace 10 años se dedica a la compra y venta de joyería de plata, acero inoxidable y enchape, la venta la realiza de forma ambulante por las diferetes colonias, ella desea invertir en su negocio por lo que solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería como: anillos, cadenas, pulseras y aretes y asi poder btene mejores ganancias economicas para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old and she lives in her own home with her husband and daughter. She works hard to provide her family with better living conditions and consequently for the last 10 years she has made a living buying and selling silver, stainless steel and plated jewellery. She travels to different towns to sell her products.

She wishes to invest in her business, which is why she is requesting this loan through INTEGRAL. She will use it to invest in the purchase merchandise wholesale, including rings, chains, bracelets and earrings, and in this way she'll be able to obtain a better income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as rings, chains, bracelets and earrings wholesale

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo con 28 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y su menor hijo, en el distrito de Callayuc,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Alfredo cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Alfredo se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro hace 10 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos y para invertir en el mantenimiento de su finca. De esta manera obtendrá mayores rendimientos.

Alfredo es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 28 years old, is partnered and lives with his partner and his young son in the district of Callayuc, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department, in the country of Peru. Alfredo has very good personal and work references from the people who live in the zone. The inhabitants of this area work primarily in agriculture, sales and raising animals.

Alfredo works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee, with 10 years of experience in the field. He asks for a loan to purchase manure and to invest in maintenance of his farm. In this way, he will get better results.

Alfredo is a recurring borrower for Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase manure and to invest in maintenance of his farm.

loans.name: Jimmy Jonathan

texts.es: Jimmy  de 29 años de edad,  soltero y sin hijos, es un excelente estudiante de la facultad de Ingeniería Química. Estudia mucho para alcanzar sus objetivos en la vida. Jimmy  tiene la meta de terminar sus estudios de titulación con éxitos y poder ser un buen Ingeniero Químico. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  para el pago de su titulación universitaria. Jimmy  se encuentra muy agradecido con Kiva por el apoyo brindado y se despide con muchos deseos de culminar sus metas propuestas.
texts.en: Jimmy is 29 years of age and is single with no children. He is an excellent student of the Faculty of Chemical Engineering. He studies hard in order to reach his life goals. Jimmy's goal is to finish his degree studies successfully and to become a good chemical engineer. He will use the loan he has been granted to pay for his university fees. Jimmy is very grateful to Kiva for the support he has received and he says goodbye with many hopes to reach the goals he has proposed.

loans.use: to pay for his university degree

loans.name: Nerita

texts.en:
Nerita is 52 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Nerita requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Nerita has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Hermes

texts.es: Hermes hace 20 años es un ganadero y agricultor de granos básicos en la comunidad de Colon, Honduras; con este oficio está logrando uno de sus objetivos que es darles a sus hijos la mejor educación posible para que sean unos buenos profesionales en el futuro, sin embargo a sus hijos quienes están en la escuela en estos momentos algunas veces se les dificulta hacer tareas o estudiar por las noches, ya que en la comunidad donde viven no hay acceso a energía eléctrica y deben estar alumbrándose con velas y lámparas a base de querosén lo cual es perjudicial para la salud. Asimismo a Hermes se le dificulta poder comenzar su trabajo más temprano, ya que al no tener buena iluminación su esposa no puede despacharlo temprano. Por estas razones Hermes solicita a Soluz Honduras este préstamo para adquirir un sistema solar que les brindara la iluminación necesaria y además les brindara beneficios tales como poder tener acceso a cargar sus celulares y ya no caminar largas distancias para tener este servicio.
texts.en:
Hermes has been a cattle farmer and has cultivated basic grains in the Colon community in Honduras for 20 years. Through this occupation he is achieving one of his goals, which is to give his children the best education possible so that they can become good professionals in the future. However, it is sometimes difficult for his children who are currently at school to do their homework and study at night, because there is no access to electricity in the town where they live and they have to light candles or kerosene lamps, which are dangerous for their health. It is also difficult for Hermes to start work earlier because without good lighting his wife can't send him off to work early.

For these reasons Hermes is requesting this loan through Soluz Honduras to purchase a solar system which will provide them with necessary lighting. It will also give them benefits such as being able to charge their cellphones without having to walk long distances to access this service.

loans.use: to purchase a solar energy system for lighting which will improve living conditions in his home.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined.

She operates a farm where she grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

She will use the anticipated profits to set up a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a 54-year-old married woman with eight children. Two of them are still attending school. Four years ago, she started running a sari-sari (variety) store, selling commodities like biscuits, noodles, coffee, sugar, eggs, edible oil, soap and condiments. She cater mostly to neighbors in her place.

Her husband is a farmer. He grows and sells rice.

She is very industrious mother and does her best to support the needs of her family.

Currently, she needs capital to ensure that her store will have an adequate supplies of goods. In that way, she could serve her respective customers well and this will improve her earnings, too. Slowly, she could able to pay her obligations and start to invest in order to have other sources of income to improve the family's living condition.

Merlinda is very grateful for your continued support.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora and her family live in the town of Baybay, Leyte. She is a 59-year-old woman who is married and has six adult children. Her husband works hard as a “pedicab”, a cycle rickshaw (a vehicle with three wheels that is moved by foot pedals) driver, while Dioscora is engaged in a hog-raising business. She has been doing this for three years to help her husband with financial aspects.

She is asking for a bigger loan amount to finance feed for her sow and piglets.

In the future, she wishes to improve her business to enhance their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en: Tobias is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells water. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more water storage containers. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees

loans.use: to buy more water storage containers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una joven que presenta piezas fracturadas esto le ocasiona mucha sensibilidad y dolor por lo que no puede masticar bien sus alimentos, necesita urgentemente restauraciones antes de que pierda por completo los dientes. Desafortunadamente sus ingresos no le alcanzan ya que también se hace cargo de sus estudios
texts.en: She's a young woman who has broken teeth, which causes a lot of sensitivity and pain, and she can't chew her food well.  She urgently needs reconstruction before she loses her teeth completely.  Unfortunately her income isn't enough because she's also paying for her education.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 49 years old. She is married and blessed with four children.

Her business is selling clothes and farming. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of 33,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy a stock of clothing to sell. She will use the profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children, as well as to increase her savings.

Her hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is from Kafunjo, Ruhaama Ntungamo and is married with four kids, all of whom are going to school. The sole source of income for the family is the banana plantantion from where she gets income to take care of the family's financial obligations.

She is faced with the need to improve the quality of her banana yields, which has forced her into applying for for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 from Ugafode. This will help her to buy mulch and pay laborers to standardize her plantation.

She appreciates the financial support rendered to the active low-income population.

Pictured is Dinah (left), the UGAFODE staff (centre) and her husband on the banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy mulch.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious.

Esther operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, soap, flour, cooking fat and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items.

Her business goal is to open a wholesale business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a married woman. She has eight children. She describes herself to be courageous. She operates a dairy farm. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more animal feed and cows.

loans.use: to buy more animal feed and cows.

loans.name: Nelio

texts.en:
Nelio is a 58-year-old man who lives in the city of Baybay, Leyte. He is a married man and has four children. Nelio works hard to provide for the needs of his family.

He raised them by driving a habal-habal (a motorcycle with an extended seat to accommodate more passengers). He has been doing for more than five years.

Nelio is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle to continue earning each day.

In the future, he is thinking of other business that will enhance their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Alexis Ariel

texts.es:
Alexis, es un joven de 24 años de edad quien reside en compañía de sus hermanos y su madre quien es viuda, y de profesión perito mercantil y contador público, y que ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida al cuidado y apoyo de sus  hijos, anteriormente laboraba para una empresa extranjera, trabajo que tuvo que abandonar debido al padecimiento de una enfermedad muy fuerte. Alexis se encuentra en la etapa final de sus estudios universitarios, en el área de arquitectura, es por eso que han solicitado apoyo financiero, la responsabilidad de pago del préstamo será adquirido por la hermana, quien labora como médico.
Entre las cualidades del joven Alexis, se encuentra la solidaridad con personas necesitadas, es amable, sincero y afectivo con sus seres queridos.
Su motivación esta orientada al crecimiento personal y profesional, que pueda mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, en especial de su madre quien ha sido una mujer luchadora y que ha vencido una de las enfermedades que hoy en día es causa de muerte en el país, su madre es el mejor ejemplo a seguir ya que luego de la perdida de su padre ella quedó al mando de su hogar.
Mediante su carrera universitaria, contribuirá al desarrollo de su país ya que desea laborar en la infraestructura y desarrollo urbano.
Su enseñanza de vida la obtuvo cuando perdió a su padre y cuando estuvo a punto de perder a su madre, hoy en día da gracias a Dios por todas las bendiciones que ha dado a su familia.
Sus planes a futuro se centran en el desarrollo profesional y personal para engrandecer a su familia y a Dios principalmente.
texts.en:
Alexis, 24, is a young man who lives with his siblings and his mother, a widow who's an expert in commerce and a public accountant. Previously she worked for a foreign company, a job she had to leave when she had a severe illness.

Alexis is in the final stage of his college education in architecture, which is why he has applied for financial help. His sister, who works as a doctor, is going to assume responsible for payment of the loan. Through his college degree he'll contribute to his country's development, because he wants to work on infrastructure and urban development.

Among Alexis's qualities are solidarity with the needy, friendliness, sincerity, and affection with his loved ones. He focuses his motivation on personal and professional growth so he can improve his family's living conditions, especially for his mother. She has persevered and overcome one of the illnesses that is a current cause of death in his country. His mother is the best example he has, because she remained in charge of the household after the loss of his father.

He received a life lesson when he lost his father and almost lost his mother. Now he's grateful to God for all his family's blessings. His plans for the future focus on professional and personal development, primarily to honor his family and God.

loans.use: to complete his college education in architecture

loans.name: Six Stars Group

texts.en:
Stars are known to shine through the darkness, providing light to nocturnal dwellers. Stars are known to be bright and are linked with goodness. It was these characteristics of stars that they wanted to bring out in themselves that made Six Stars group take up that name. Their objective as women in business is to shine brightly providing guidance and mentoring to other women around them who want to empower themselves economically. Their dedication in using their hands has been fruitful as a means of survival. In the present state of the economy, the dollar is elusive and few are actually managing to access it. Six Stars has proved they have the strength and the will to earn that precious dollar.

Tendai and the other 3 members of Six Stars are on a successive second loan. She is a married woman, 35 years old and a mother of 3. She resides in Kuwadzana 5 in the capital city of Zimbabwe, Harare. She has proved beyond doubt that she has business acumen which just needed some persuasion to be released. Attending training sessions at Thrive helped her tap into her hidden potential and helped her become a better entrepreneur.

Tendai was given a loan of $300 on her 1st loan cycle and equipped with knowledge on how to grow her business through borrowings. Tendai wasted no time in applying that knowledge. She traveled approximately 475 km from Harare to Beira, in Mozambique, in search of very durable and quality fishing nets. She bought different types of fishing nets including 300×100 and of size 4 being the type that sinks deeper in the dams, lakes, etc. because they are so long and their catch is usually of bigger and better size.

She supplies the fishing nets to different fisheries surrounding one of the most popular and attractive lakes near Harare, Lake Chivero. She usually supplies them the 300 by 100 nets and the 200 by 100 nets which she also supplies. On top of that she supplies another market with 100 by 100 nets. This market consists of fisheries located in Darwendale dam near Harare. She is so knowledgeable about the fishing nets to the extent that one would mistake her for a fisherwoman.

Currently she requires a loan of $500 so as to restock from Maputo, Mozambique. This is approximately 928 km from Harare, Zimbabwe. She discovered that the nets from Maputo are more durable and cheaper in price. She also intends to restock the fishing nets in bulk so as to supply her clients whilst it is summer time when the fishing season is at its peak.

loans.use: to restock fishing nets from Maputo, Mozambique as they are stronger and cheaper than those she currently sells.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El es un joven casado hace un par de años, su esposa esta en espera de su primer hijo después de recibir un tratamiento ya que no podía embarazarse. El embarazo fue diagnosticado de alto riesgo por lo que el parto  tendrá que ser por cesárea para evitar riesgos al bebé a la hora del alumbramiento. Desafortunadamente por el tipo de embarazo de su esposa, esta dejo de trabajar por lo que ahora sólo cuentan con los ingreso de él.
texts.en: He's a young man who has been married a few years.  His wife is expecting their first child after receiving treatment because she couldn't get pregnant.  Her pregnancy was diagnosed as high risk, so she will have to have a cesarean section to avoid risks to the baby during delivery.  Unfortunately his wife stopped working because of her pregnancy, so now they only have his income.

loans.use: to pay for a cesarean section

loans.name: Julanda

texts.en: Julanda is a married woman. She has 2 children. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough water. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy another cow. She will use the anticipated profits to construct a cattle housing structure.

loans.use: to buy another cow

loans.name: Potato Group

texts.en:
The rooster signals the breaking of dawn and the beginning of a new day. In Mufakose, a high density surburb in Harare, women are heating bathing water for their children and husbands who will be going to work. Young girls and some old women are also seen sweeping the front of their yards with grass brooms. Vegetable vendors are conspicuous with their big reed baskets known as “Tswanda” in the local Shona language. They will be rushing to the vegetable markets to get the best vegetables at a cheaper price. In this entire activity there is a woman who is already up arranging her wares for resale. Zodwa, aged 43, runs a tuck shop. She stays with one dependent and her husband works at a local security company.

Zodwa is one of the two remaining members of Potato group. The group has applied for a third loan from Thrive microfinance. While her husband wakes up and goes to work, she also opens the tuck shop targeting the early birds. At first interaction with Thrive, she had a small business operating from her veranda with no proper structure. Her last two loans have helped her grow in business and she now operates from a proper built up structure. Her noticeable efforts need to be perfected by a capital boost to keep her business running well, hence the need to join Thrive. Zodwa enriched her business knowledge through the training she got. She learned how to save and how to grow her business through borrowing. The marketing training the group got from Thrive during a further loan cycle training has increased their ability to retain customers as they have learned the value in retaining customers.

With her third loan, Zodwa is planning to expand into the wholesale business. She wants to buy goods in bulk and wholesale to the vendors around her neighbourhood. She foresees this business increasing her turnover and also increasing her profits.

loans.use: To expand into the wholesale business. She wants to buy goods in bulk and wholesale to the vendors around her neighbourhood.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris is 50 years old. He is married and blessed with five children. His business is keeping goats and masonry. He has been in the business for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of eleven thousand Kenya shillings.

This is his first term with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to purchase more goats for rearing and animal feeds. He will use the profits from expanded business to educate his children and to service the loan.

His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable and build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for rearing and animal feed.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea has grown up around motorcycles her whole life. Her father was a motorcycle hobbyist, and raised her and her brother with the same love of motorcycles.

Andrea’s brother is a certified Harley-Davidson mechanic, and as a family, they worked for a local motorcycle mechanic in town. Andrea’s father and brother worked on repairing the bikes, while Andrea operated the front end and store to pay for her college education.

Eventually, the business they worked for closed down, leaving an opening in Imperial Valley for motorcycle repair. This inspired Andrea and her brother to start their own shop with the experience they had acquired.

The pair has managed to keep the starting costs low and pay out of their own pocket. Andrea plans to use her loan to pay for the business’ most crucial equipment, such as a motorcycle lift and tire changer.

loans.use: to pay for equipment for her startup motorcycle repair shop.

loans.name: Noremae

texts.en:
Noremae is a 27-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Noremae has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Noremae requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and ingredients for her business.

Noremae has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Noremae would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Geniline

texts.en:
Geniline is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Geniline is 30 years old and has three children who are in school.

Geniline has a general store business in the Philippines. Geniline requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Geniline has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Geniline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pig fattening business.

Vivian has been in this business for 11 years. Vivian earns more income from fishing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Vivian has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Loeurt's Group

texts.en: Loeurt’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Loeurt makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Longgena

texts.en:
Longgena is 49 years old and has five children. Longgena is married and has five children who are in school.

Longgena is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Longgena requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Longgena has been raising pigs for 6 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Longgena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jepun Sari Group

texts.en:
Having repaid their last loan correctly, the Jepun Sari group decided to continue their loans. The loan use will be for increasing their pig business by purchasing new piglets or quality feed. The group receives the same loan amount, each of them gets 3.000.000 IDR.

Ni Ketut will use her loan to purchase 3 super quality piglets for fattening. With her own money, she purchased feed and renovate the pig pens. She plans to sell the pigs near the holiday to get a good price. She hopes her plan will be running well. She and the group still need advice and loan support for their business until they ready and have enough capital to continue the business by themselves

2 members not in picture because of religious ceremony at their temple.

loans.use: to purchase 3 superior quality piglets.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 30 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Maribel works very hard to provide for them.

Maribel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Maribel has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Donalie

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Donalie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Donalie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell to customers.

Donalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 47 years old, married with three children.

Luzminda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Luzminda has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from buying and selling livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Luzminda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 43 years old and married with two children.

Maribel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a food vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as vegetables, fish, spices, etc.

Maribel has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the food vending for 14 years and also earns an income from general store.

Maribel aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as vegetables, fish, and spices.

loans.name: Liliana Alexandra

texts.es: Liliana una estudiante de 21 años de edad soltera. Ella es estudiante de la carrera profesional de idiomas inglés-frances.Liliana se siente feliz al poder continuar sus estudios gracias al préstamo. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de materiales de estudio como hojas cuadernos y libros. Actualmente Liliana está en el sexto ciclo de su carrera de estudios. El deseo de Liliana es de terminar satisfactoriamente su carrera y ser más competitiva. Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por apoyar a estudiantes como ella.
texts.en:
Liliana is a 21 year old student, who is single. She is studying for a degree in English and French language. She is happy that she is able to continue studying thanks to the loan.

This is why she is requesting a loan to buy study materials such as paper, books and notebooks.

Liliana is currently in the sixth stage of her studies. Her wish is to complete her degree satisfactorily, and to be more competitive.

She is grateful to Kiva lenders for supporting students like her.

loans.use: to buy study materials such as paper, books and notebooks.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is in agriculture and she is selling vegetables, garlic, turmeric and tomatoes. She is requesting a loan of $ 1000.00 to improve her business. And she will use this loan to buy more vegetables in other places. She will bring to the market for selling.

She started selling vegetables in 2013 with her own working capital of $300.00. Now she is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy more vegetables such as vegetable seeds, leeks, onions and other things to sell. Everyday her life is selling vegetables in the market because she is earning a good income from it.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, leeks, onions and other things.

loans.name: Martha Del Carmen

texts.es:
Pedro Vicente Maldonado un Cantón muy hermoso, su clima es cálido húmedo su gente es muy amable y trabajadora este Cantón es el punto de llegada de muchos turistas ya que a los alrededores del mismo tienen muchas hosterías en las que se puede descansar y ser tratados con mucha amabilidad.
En este Cantón vive y tiene su negocio la señora Martha una mujer luchadora de 33 años ella mantiene una sólida relación como casada, de la cual tienen 3 hijos todos están estudiando en la escuela y colegio del Cantón, el esposo trabaja como maestro albañil, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas como tripitas asadas, carne asada, a este negocio le dedica un promedio de 10 horas por día. Aprendió del mismo cuando trabajó como ayudante en un local de venta de estas comidas y luego decidió poner su propio negocio.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en el negocio para compra de mesas y sillas además de la ampliación del mismo; con esta nueva inversión esperan seguir mejorando sus ingresos ya que podrán atraer y atender a más clientes. La señora Martha agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
Pedro Vicente Maldonado is a beautiful Canton with a warm climate and
friendly, hard-working people. This Canton is the entry point for many tourists, so there are many hotels in the local area where they can rest and be treated with much kindness.,

It is in this Canton that Martha lives and workes. She is a determined, 33 year old woman who has a strong relationship with her spouse. Together they have three children who are all studying in the Canton's school and college. Her spouse is a master builder.

She sells fast food, such as grilled tripe and grilled meat, working for around 10 hours a day. She learned her trade when she worked as an assistant in a place that sold these foods, and then decided to start her own business.

She is requesting the loan to invest in the business: to buy tables and chairs and to expand the business. With this loan she hopes to be able to continue improving her income as she will be able to attract, and cater for more customers. Martha is grateful to Kiva for the help and the opportunities provided.

loans.use: to buy extra tables and chairs and expand the business so that she can give her customers a better service.

loans.name: Enrrique Ernesto

texts.es: Enrrique de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hija, el se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 15 años experiencia que le ha dado la oportunidad de vender una buena calidad de producto por esa razón posee clientes fijos, el cliente está solicitando un crédito ya que necesita comprar las herramientas necesarias para continuar con su trabajo como: trasmallos, redes y darle mantenimiento a la lancha que muestra en la fotografía ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y de ingresos.
texts.en:
Enrrique, age 30, lives in his own house with his life partner and their duagher. He has been a small-scale fisherman for 15 years. This experience has given him the chance to sell a good quality product. For this reason he has fixed customers.

Enrrique is requesting a loan because he needs to buy the tools that are necessary to continue with his work. He will buy things like trammel nets and other nets, and he will provide maintenance on his motorboat.

loans.use: to buy trammel nets and other nets and for maintenance on his motorboat.

loans.name: Pin's Group

texts.en: Pin’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Pin makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija y su sobrina, ella posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos de los gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para poder comprar mas productos como: sopas, frijoles, aceite, huevos, jabon, etc. por mayor y asi seguir con sus ventas que le generan mejores ingresos economcios.
texts.en:
Maria, age 45, lives in a house of her own along with her daughter and niece. She has had a store located at her place of residence for the last 10 years.

She has a lot of customers due to the variety of her products and her good prices. With her sales she is able to pay some of the household expenses.

She is requesting once again a loan to buy more products like soups, beans, oil, eggs, jam and other products in bulk. This will allow her to continue with her sales which give her good economic incomes.

loans.use: to buy soups, beans, oil, eggs, jam, and other products in bulk.

loans.name: Bích's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Bích is 38 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture raising pigs for more than 10 years. Bích lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village. And the income from this business is unstable because when some pig diseases happen, they could die, which would leave her nothing to sell. And she will be in financial trouble.

The main hardship that Bích faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

In 2013, Bích joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Bích has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Her group consists of four members.

In the future, Bích hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
“Chicken inasal” or barbecue chicken is very famous in the Visayas region of the Philippines. Customers keep coming back again and again due to its savory taste and aroma. This maybe the reason why chicken inasal is one of the icon products of this region. 

Jocelyn, 48 years old, a resident of Naga City, Cebu chose the right business to venture into. She runs a chicken barbecue stand for almost twenty years. Her husband, Cresaldo, a laborer, helps her in her business whenever he has time. They have children to whom they want to dedicate all their efforts. The couple works hard to support their children’s education until its completion. It’s their aspiration to improve the quality of living for them. 

However, Jocelyn also struggles a lot especially when the income from her business becomes unstable. Due to proliferation of many barbecue stands in their area, the competition gets stiff. Jocelyn longs to run her business consistently to gain better and steady income. You might be a great help to her through PHP 50,000 loan that she will use to buy volume of dressed chicken, sacks of charcoal, and additional ingredients for her business. It will not just provide for their everyday needs but it will also boost her savings for her children’s future and education. 

Jocelyn meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy volume of dressed chicken, sacks of charcoal and additional ingredients for her chicken barbecue business.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 53 years old and married with four children.

Amalia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Amalia has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from charcoal retailing.

Amalia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 37 years old and has one child. Jocelyn is married and has one child who is in school.
