Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business.

Jocelyn has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es: Victoriano es una gran persona, tiene  34 años de edad, con una linda familia por la que se esfuerza y esmera, el con sus créditos a logrado salir adelante con sus cultivos. Victoriano cuenta que con el préstamo anterior pudo comprar sus abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo a Dios gracias obtuvo una buena cosecha y en su mercado regional lo pudo vender. En esta ocasión solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de semillas de papa y fertilizantes porque la época de lluvia ya se está alejado por lo que  es buena época para la siembra de esta verdura.  Victoriano espera contar una vez más con el préstamo para que su vida siga trasformando.
texts.en:
Victoriano, age 34, is a great person. He puts forth much effort and dedication for the lovely family that he has. With his loans he has managed to get ahead with his crops. Victoriano says that with the previous loan he was able to buy fertlizers for the maintenance of his crops. Thank God, he had a good harvest that he was able to sell in his regional market.

This time he is requesting a new loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizers. The rainy season is ending, and that is a good time to plant this vegetable. Victoriano hopes to once again count on the loan in order for his life to continue to change.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 46 years old, married, and has four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Dina is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Dina has been raising livestock for 20 years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Rubilyn

texts.en:
Rubilyn is 36 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Rubilyn is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Rubilyn has been raising livestock for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming corn.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Marlen

texts.es:
La señora Marlen  de 33 años  de edad es casada,  vive con  su esposo tiene un  hijo que depende de ella vive en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 08 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería en general también vende   frescos, churros, granos básicos ubicado en la comunidad de, Nacaome valle  es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Esta solicitando el préstamo para Surtir el negocio  ya que viene la temporada buena en  la zona de su comunidad porque se  cultivan el melón para exportarlo a Estados Unidos, y sus clientes ahí trabajan. Solicita el crédito para una oportunidad es una persona muy agradecida y con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es poder mejorar su vivienda y poder tener una mejor vida.

San Lorenzo, honduras - de Septiembre del 2015.
texts.en:
Marlen, age 33, is married. She lives with her husband and her dependent son. For eight years she has been selling general grocery items and soft drinks, churros, and basic grains in the Nacaome Valley community. She is a hard-working woman with the desire to get ahead.

She is requesting the loan to stock her business. The good season in the area of her community is coming because they grow melons to export to the United States, and her customers work there. She is requesting the loan for an opportunity. She is a very grateful person, and she wishes to work with Prisma.

Her dream is to be able to improve her house and to be able to have a better life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September, 2015

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melinda is 57 years old now.

Melinda has a business buying and selling shoes in the Philippines. Melinda requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of shoes to sell.

Melinda has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Melinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of shoes to sell

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 57 years old, married, and has six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Anabelle has a food vending business in the Philippines. Anabelle requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Anabelle has been in this business for three years. In the future, Anabelle would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with nine children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from fishing. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Violeta dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 36 years old, married, and has two children.

She earns a living through her business fattening pigs in the Philippines. Jennifer is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase piglets, feed, vitamins and vaccines for her business.

Jennifer has been in the business of fattening pigs for five years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed, vitamins and vaccines for her business.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is 38 years old, married, and has seven children who are in school.

Minda is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Minda requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Minda has been in this business for three years, and has previously borrowed once from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Minda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 30 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marissa operates a general store business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for seven years.

Marissa requested a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ybone

texts.en:
Ybone is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional packs of frozen foods, bamboo sticks, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Ybone has been in this business for one year. Ybone earns additional income from raising goats.

Ybone has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional packs of frozen foods, bamboo sticks, spices, etc. for her business

loans.name: Pheak Group

texts.en: Pheak’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Pheak makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as farmer and seller to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Hòa's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hòa is 41 years old and she is married. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general things for more than 10 years. Hòa lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in her village.

The main hardship that Hòa faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by purchasing more items such as milk, sugar, sweet, candies to sell.

This is Hòa first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could improve her living standard.
In the future, Hòa hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more items such as milk, sugar, sweets, candies to sell.

loans.name: Indalecio

texts.es:
Indalecio con 45 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su cónyuge e hijos, en el distrito de Pimpingos,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Indalecio cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,ganadería,cultivo de productos de pan llevar y cría de animales menores.

Indalecio se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, de variedad Catimor. Indalecio cuenta con amplia experiencia en el rubro ya que anteriormente a cultivada café tradicional variedad nacional, ahora por cuestiones de enfermedades y plagas han renovado plantación variedad Catimor que es mucho más resistente a enfermedades. Cultivo de café lo realiza en terreno propio 1.5 hectáreas.Su producto lo vende en el propio distrito de Pimpingos a compradores de la zona que llevan a la Provincia de Jaén ha acopiadores mayoristas. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátano, vituca). Siendo estos para su consumo.El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento de 1.5 has de café en producción, asegurando campaña agrícola 2016 con una mayor producción, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtener mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Indalecio es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa. Firma con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Indalecio, age 45, is in a common-law marriage. He lives in his own house, which is made of basic materials, with his wife and children. He lives in the Pimpingos district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department, Peru. Indalecio has very good personal and work references from the inhabitants of the area. The inhabitants of this area mainly work in agriculture, with livestock, growing basic food crops, and raising small animals.

Indalecio is a farmer. Specifically, he grow the Catimor variety of coffee. Indaleciao has vast experience in the field becuase he previously cultivated the national variety of traditional coffee. Now, for reasons of diseases and pests, he has changed to the planting the Catimor variety. It is much more resistant to diseases. He grows coffee on 1.5 hectares, which is his own land. He sells the product in his own district, Pimpingos, to buyers in the area who take it to the wholesale stockpilers in the Jaén province.

He also raises small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs, and others) and grows basic food products (yucca, banana, taro) for their consumption.

The loan will be used for maintenace of the 1.5 hectares of coffee production. This will assure the 2016 growing season of greater production. This will be reflected in a greater volume of sales and, therefore, greater earnings. This way he will be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Indalecio is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa. He signs with his wife.

loans.use: to provide maintenance to his 1.5 hectares of coffee production, assuring the 2016 growing season of greater production.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 66 year old, with two children, living in Sapangdalaga, Misamis Occidental. She grows and harvests vegetables, work she has done since her husband passed away. She works on the farm since it was the only way they had to provide for the family needs. Teresita gets up early and harvests mature vegetables to sell in the village.

Teresita is requesting this loan to purchase new seedlings and pesticide. In the future,she wants to improve her gardening and to expand the area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
As a married parent, Marietta works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell scrap business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Marietta is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of scrap to sell for her buy and sell scrap business.

Marietta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of scrap to sell

loans.name: Mira Joy

texts.en:
Mira Joy is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mira Joy is 23 years old and has one child in school.

Mira Joy has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Mira Joy requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Mira Joy has been in this business for two years. In the future, Mira Joy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Benewelfa

texts.en:
Benewelfa works hard to support her family. Benewelfa is married and has a farming vegetables business in the Philippines.

Benewelfa requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Benewelfa has been in this business for 15 years now.

Benewelfa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 45 years old, married, and has three children.

Yolanda is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Yolanda requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Yolanda has been in business for ten years now. She has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Yolanda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 59 years old and married with two children. Lilia works very hard to provide for them.

Lilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Lilia has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, bread, biscuits, candies, noodles, coffee, etc. 

Lilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 28 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in school. Maricel works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Maricel has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Maricel would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Luz Victoria

texts.es:
Luz Victoria es una señora de 57 años, vive con su esposo y su nieto en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, cuentan con casa propia varios años.
Luz y su esposo viven con un nieto ya que sus padres están en el extranjero, juntos trabajan muy duro para salir adelante. Su esposo es un carpintero muy dedicado, lleva años de experiencia en esta labor a quien entrega todo su tiempo, mientras Luz recorre visitando a su clientela para venderle sus productos como sábanas, edredones y demás.
Luz es clienta de Fundación Alternativa, con el primer crédito pudo fortalecer su negocio, actualmente también vende calzado en las canchas deportivas de sector, le ha ido muy bien por lo que desea seguir incrementando y creciendo en este negocio. Nuevamente acude a la institución para recibir un crédito, con este dinero ella viajará a Ambato directamente a la fábrica para aprovechar precios y traer más mercadería, con estos ingresos aspira luego ponerse su propio local y ser una microempresaria que su negocio establecido. Agradece a todos quienes aportan en Kiva, para que los microempresarios puedan hacer parte de sus sueños en realidad.
texts.en:
Luz Victoria is a lady 57 years of age; she lives with her husband and grandson in the city of Santo Domingo; they have had their own home for several years.

Luz and her husband live with a grandson since his parents are abroad; together they work very hard to get ahead. Her husband is a very dedicated carpenter; he has years of experience in this work, to which he gives all his time, while Luz makes the rounds visiting her clients to sell them products such as sheets, quilts, and other items.

Luz is a client of Fundación Alternativa [Alternative Foundation]; with her first loan she was able to strengthen her business. She currently also sells athletic footwear; this has gone very well for her and so she wishes to keep increasing and growing this business. She is again applying to the institution for a loan; with this money she will travel to Ambato directly to the factory to take advantage of prices and bring more merchandise. With this income she aspires to then set up her own venue and to be a microentrepreneur with her business established. She thanks all those who contribute to Kiva, so that microentrepreneurs can turn part of their dreams into reality.

loans.use: purchase new merchandise directly from the factory; in this way she will increase her profits and she will be able to help her family with a better quality of life.

loans.name: Lizet

texts.es: Lizet de 20 años de edad,  soltera y sin hijos, es una excelente estudiante de Diseño Gráfico que esta estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Lizet con la ayuda de sus padres y con mucha dedicación a sus  estudios está logrando un buen record de notas y así poder ser una buena Diseñadora Gráfica.  Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  para el pago de sus pensiones universitarias. Lizet  se encuentra muy agradecida  con Kiva y Edaprospo por la ayuda brindada y se despide con muchos deseos de culminar sus metas propuestas.
texts.en: Lizet, 20 years of age, single and childless, is an excellent student of Graphic Design who is  studying hard to reach her goals in life. Lizet, with the help of her parents and with great dedication to her studies, is achieving a record of good grades to thus be able to be a good graphic designer. With the loan awarded, Lizet will pay for her university fees, as well as buy supplies for her studies. She is extremely grateful to Kiva and Edaprospo for the help provided, and she bids farewell with many wishes of accomplishing the goals she has set for herself.

loans.use: pay her university fees.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Narcisa works hard to support her family.

Narcisa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business such as meat, vegetables, spices, fish, etc.

Narcisa has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Narcisa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business such as meat, vegetables, spices, fish, etc.

loans.name: Norita

texts.en:
Norita is 45 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Norita has been farming rice for five years, and she also earns additional income from a general store.

Norita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer.

Norita is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Guardiana

texts.en:
Guardiana is marred and works hard to support her family. She sells bananas in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years.

Guardiana requested a loan from NWTF for 25,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 52 years old and has one child.

Nenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like beverages, rice, home products, and other groceries to sell.

Nenita has previously borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Nenita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like beverages, rice, home products, and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 56 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Shirley runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP (Philippines Peso) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal care products and other groceries.

She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Shirley would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Hilaria is 60 years old, married, and has six children.

Hilaria is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Hilaria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Hilaria has been in business for 26 years. She has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Hilaria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ellene

texts.en:
Ellene is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like canned good, noodles, sugar and other groceries.

Ellene dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, noodles, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Las Maravillas Group

texts.es:
mery es una mujer de 59 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 8, 12 y 16 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, honesta y muy amable. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por acoger la mayor parte de la población y por el comercio manufacturero.
Mery es de baja estatura, cabello gris y rostro arrugado (al centro viste blusa blanca y pantalón a puntos), su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como electricista y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua, luz y alcantarillado. La necesidad de mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar la banca de emprendimiento, los socios tienen negocios como; venta de comida rápida, venta de lácteos, venta de comida, venta de refrescos, venta de cosméticos, venta de productos naturales y llantería. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, ella compra ropa por fardos y la separa por género, edad y estación del año, una vez que ha separado la mercadería la vende de forma ambulante en lugares peatonales y zonas comerciales, “la ropa rota todo el tiempo por eso la separo, para vender mejor…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que su mercadería se vende normalmente, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar ropa por fardos. Su sueño es contar con el capital necesario para poder comprar su mercadería, ella desea comprar ropa de segunda mano por mayor, para separarla y venderla por género y edad. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 27 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Mery solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa de segunda mano por mayor para venderla por género y edad.
texts.en:
Mery is a 59 year old woman who lives with her partner. She has three children, aged 8, 12 and 16, and works selling second-hand clothing. She is a good mother, honest and very kind. She runs her business in the southern part of the city, which contains most of the city's population and is known for its manufacturing businesses.

Mery is short, with grey hair and wrinkles (in the centre, wearing a white top and spotted trousers). Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish. She lives with her partner, who is an electrician, and her children, who are in school. They live in a rented brick room with water, electricity and sewage services. 

The need to improve her business brought her to lead this communal bank. The members run businesses such as: selling fast food, selling dairy products, selling food, selling soft drinks, selling cosmetics, selling natural products and tyre fitting. Her business involves selling second-hand clothing. She buys bundles of clothing and separates them out by gender, age and time of year. Once separated, she sells the goods as a street vendor in pedestrian areas and commercial districts. "I always separate out damaged clothing for better sales," she says. 

The advantage of her business is that she sells her products normally. The disadvantage is the lack of money for buying bundles of clothes. She dreams of having enough capital to be able to buy these goods. She wants to buy second-hand clothing in bulk, so she can separate it and sell it by gender and age-group. This is the first loan series from the institution in her 27 years of carrying out this activity.

For these reasons, Mery is requesting a loan to buy second-hand clothing in bulk and sell it by gender and age-group.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes in bulk and sell them by gender and age-group.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 33 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.

Thelma is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Thelma requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Thelma has been in this business for three years. She has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 48 years old, married, and has nine children, four of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jesusa has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. Jesusa requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.

Jesusa has been in this business for six years. In the future, Jesusa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn, 47, is a married woman with three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. Analyn has had a tailoring business in the Philippines for four years. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring business. In the future, Analyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia, 47, is a married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. Virginia has had a food vending business in the Philippines for ten years. She requested a 9000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as meat and spices. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Reynelda

texts.en:
Reynelda is 41 years old, married, and has six children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a welding shop in the Philippines. Reynelda requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and equipment like a welding machine, rod, etc. and to pay for laborers' salaries.

Reynelda has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Reynelda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and equipment like a welding machine, rod, etc., and to pay for laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Edna works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Edna is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase bamboo, nails, paints and other materials needed for making furniture.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo, nails, paints and other materials needed for making furniture.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita works hard to support her family. Anecita is married and has had a tailoring business in the Philippines for ten years. She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase cloth, thread, pins and other sewing materials. In the future, Anecita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Noly

texts.en:
Noly is a widowed woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Noly has a food vending business in the Philippines. Noly requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Noly has been in this business for forty years. In the future, Noly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Nievesa

texts.en:
Nievesa is 45 years old, married, and has six children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Nievesa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Nievesa requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Nievesa has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Nievesa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 40 years old and has two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Aida has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Aida requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Aida has been in this business for three years. In the future, Aida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 62 years old, married, and has five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, chips, milk, sugar, coffee, etc. Elena has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Elena would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, chips, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre y su hija, ella se dedica desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de ropa y accesorios, su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere aumentar su mercaderia por esa razon solicita un credito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Olga is 45 years old and lives with her mother and her daughter. For several years she has been working selling clothes and accessories. Her business is located close to her house in a well travelled area, and her income is used to cover some house expenses. She wants to increase her stock which is why she requests a loan to buy more wholesale products and have a better income.

loans.use: buy wholesale clothes and accessories

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina is a widowed woman with two children. Segundina is 59 years old now. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Segundina has a buy-and-sell spice business in the Philippines. Segundina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of spices to sell.

Segundina has been in this business for 38 years. In the future, Segundina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of spices to sell.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela, 41, is a married woman with two children whom are both attending school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Shiela has a frozen food business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of frozen foods to resell.

Shiela has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods to resell.

loans.name: Glendy

texts.en:
Glendy, 26, is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years.

Glendy requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

In the future, Glendy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Ederlina

texts.en:
Ma. Ederlina is 47 years old, and has four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Ederlina has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Ma. Ederlina requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, and other supplies to use in her business.

Ma. Ederlina has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Ma. Ederlina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, and other supplies to use in her business

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
María, de 57 años de edad, no pudo estudia porque su familia vivía en condiciones de extrema pobreza; está soltera y vive solamente con 3 hijos en casa los cuales también trabajan.

María, se dedica al comercio de plásticos desde hace 15 años y gracias a esto ha sacado adelante a sus hijos y no les a faltado nada; ella antes se dedicaba a trabajos como empleada domésticos en casas particulares o con vecinos y familiares; ella camina de su casa al mercado durante 15 minutos todos los días, para llegar al puesto donde ella ofrece sus productos y se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para preparar el desayuno y salir a vender y regresa a la casa a las 3:00 p.m.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar guacales, coladores, tenedores, platos, peines y vasos para vender. 

María, sueña con seguir trabajando y con las ganancias mejorar su vivienda y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria, 57 years old, could not study because her family lived in extreme poverty.  She is single and lives with her 3 children at home.  They work also.

Maria works selling plastic products for 15 years and thanks to this she has brought up her children and they have not lacked anything.  She was previously employed in domestic work in private homes or with neighbors and relatives.

She walks from home to the market for 15 minutes every day to get to the place where she offers her products.  She gets up at 5:00 am to prepare breakfast and go out and sell and comes home at 3:00 pm.

Maria needs a loan to purchase pails, strainers, forks, plates, cups and combs to re-sell.

Maria dreams to be able to keep working and expand her business, and also to improve their home.

loans.use: to purchase pails, strainers, forks, plates, cups and combs to re-sell.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es una gran mujer, trabajadora y perseverante con sus objetivos en la vida, ella todos los días sale a la búsqueda de un mejor futuro para sus hijos.
Santos es una más de las personas que sus vidas sean visto beneficiadas por los créditos pues ella cuenta que con el préstamo anterior logro realizar la inversión en su negocio de cebolla y con ello sus ingresos mejoraron y hasta una tienda logro instalar, ella está contenta con este avance mas no conforme por esa razón solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra más cebollas por cuerda y satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes. Su esperanza de vida es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y tener un local propio para su tienda.
texts.en:
Santos is a great woman, hardworking and persevering with her goals in life; every day she goes out in search of a better future for her children.

Santos is one more of the individuals whose lives have been benefited by loans. She relates that with the previous loan she succeeded in making an investment in her onion business and with that her income improved, and she was even able to set up a store. She is happy but not satisfied with this progress, and for that reason she is applying for a new loan to buy more onions by the bundle and better meet the needs of her customers. Her hope in life is to improve her family’s quality of life and have a separate place for her store.

loans.use: buy onions by the bundle.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: Reina es una mujer de 45 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de platos típicos, además atiende una tienda de productos básicos, lo que le permite obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Reina vive con su hija de 18 años de edad a la que ha logrado sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo, ya que es madre soltera. Reina desea aumentar los productos que ofrece en su tienda y ofrecer una mayor variedad de platos típicos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: yuca, plátanos, leche, tomates para su venta de platos típicos y productos para la tienda. Con el crédito anterior Reina construyo el corredor de su vivienda, el cual le permite protegerse del clima mientras prepara sus platos típicos, por lo que se siente muy agradecida.
texts.en:
Reina is a 45-year-old woman who works in the sale of traditional dishes. She also tends to a store that sells basic products, which allows her to obtain a better economic income. Reina lives with her 18-year-old daughter, who she has helped to get ahead with a lot of effort, as she is a single mother. Reina hopes to increase the amount of products that she offers in her store, and to offer a larger variety of typical dishes. This is why she asks for a loan from FUSAI, to invest in yucca, bananas, milk, and tomatoes, for her sale of traditional dishes and products for her store.
With the previous loan, Reina built a roofed veranda, which allows her to protect herself from the weather while she prepares her traditional dishes, for which she is very grateful.

loans.use: to invest in yucca, bananas, milk, and tomatoes, for her sale of traditional dishes and products for her store.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina, 57, is a married woman with ten children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She runs a ready to wear clothing business in the Philippines. Felomina has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of ready to wear clothing to sell to her customers.

Felomina has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Felomina would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is 53 years old, married and has five children.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Gaudiosa has been pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Gaudiosa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marzolyn

texts.en:
Marzolyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living by selling vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marzolyn dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Felisidad

texts.en:
Felisidad works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bag-making business in the Philippines.

Felisidad requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

She has been in this business for ten years now.

Felisidad would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 39 years old, married, and has six children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Teresa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Teresa requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Teresa has been in this business for six years. In the future, Teresa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Miladis

texts.es: Miladis es una emprendedora mujer de 37 años de edad que fue motivada por una vecina para que emprendiera su propio negocio de venta de mercancías, ella consideró que esta propuesta podría ser muy beneficiosa para su familia y que contaba con el tiempo necesario para llevar a cabo este proyecto. Sus principales clientes se encuentran ubicados en las cercanías de su vivienda en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, y amplía su base de clientes con los referidos que su misma clientela le proporciona.  Miladis desea aprovisionarse de un nuevo surtido de prendas de vestir y calzado, sin embargo su capital no es suficiente para tal inversión, es por ello que para cumplir con este propósito aplicó a una solicitud de crédito y en la actualidad la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo está tramitando su primer credikiva.  Su principal desafío es fidelizar a su clientela con buenos precios, calidad y servicio, y su meta familiar es realizarle adecuaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Miladis is an enterprising woman of 37 years of age who was motivated by a neighbor to undertake her own business selling goods.  She felt that this proposal could be very beneficial for her family and she had the time needed to carry out this project. 

Her main customers are located in the vicinity of her home in a suburb of the city of Barranquilla, and she expands her customer base from the same referrals her customers provide. 

Miladis would like to stock up on a new range of clothing and footwear, but her capital is not sufficient for such an investment.  Which is why, to fulfill this goal, she is requesting a loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation who is currently processing her first credikiva. 

Her main challenge is to retain her customers through good prices, quality and service.  Her family goal is to make a better dwelling place.

loans.use: tio stock up a new range of clothing and footwear

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores, de 59 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, dejó la escuela porque a sus padres no les pareció importante la escuela, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, tiene 6 hijos pero todos se acompañaron y solo vive una nieta con ellos.

Dolores, se ha dedicado al cuidado de su hogar y ayudar a su esposo en la siembra de maíz y pipían, pero  desde hace un año pusieron un comedor junto a su hija, ella coloco este negocio para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, además de todo eso siempre le ayuda a su esposo en la agricultura.

Dolores, necesita el préstamo para comprar carne, tomates, aceite, mesas y sillas para el comedor.

Su sueño es mejorar el comedor, llegar a tener una tienda y construir una cocina.
texts.en:
Dolores is 59 years old. She went to school until the second grade. She quit school because her parents didn't think it was important. She is married, and her husband is a farmer. She has 6 children, but all are in relationships, and only a granddaughter lives with them.

Dolores has worked taking care of the home and helping her husband grow corn and squash, but a year ago she started an eatery with her daughter. She began the business to help her husband with the expenses of the home. But despite that, she still helps her husband with the farming. Dolores needs the loan to buy meat, tomatoes, oil, tables and chairs for the eatery. Her dream is to improve the eatery, and to one day have a store and build a kitchen.

loans.use: to buy meat, tomatoes, oil, tables and chairs for her eatery.

loans.name: Cerela

texts.en:
Cerela is 63 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Cerela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as home care products, beverages, and other groceries.

Cerela has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Cerela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as home care products, beverages, and other groceries.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She supplements this income with earnings from fattening pigs.

Nona dreams that, one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Tinidad

texts.en:
Tinidad is 42 years old and has two children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Tinidad operates a computer shop in the Philippines, which she has been doing for one year.

Tinidad requested a loan from NWTF for 9,000 PHP, which she will use to buy a mouse and other equipment needed in her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a mouse and other equipment needed in her business.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 61 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

Ester has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Ester would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en:
Gemalyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gemalyn is 25 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Gemalyn has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Gemalyn has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling ready to wear clothing in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy additional ready to wear blouses, t-shirts, etc. to sell for her business.

Leonisa has been in this business for 13 years. She earns additional income from food vending and a manicure/pedicure service.

Leonisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ready to wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 40 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. Emelda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell to her customers.

Emelda has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, cereals, coffee, sugar, etc.

In the future, Emelda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Servanda

texts.en:
Servanda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling rice in the Philippines.

Servanda requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

She has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Servanda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a hardworking female entrepreneur with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Angelita dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Rebeca Sarai

texts.es:
Rebeca, de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, se acompaño cuando tenía 13 años de edad, su pareja trabaja como carpintero, tiene 2 hijos, uno ya está en el kinder.

Rebeca, desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de mariscos, este oficio lo aprendió con una amiga y decidió dedicarse a este negocio por la necesidad de cubrir todos los gastos del hogar; para comprar el producto tiene que recorrer 10 kilómetros y cuando no puede ir solo llama por teléfono para que se lo envíen; ella vende el producto en los caseríos vecinos y lo hace casa por casa caminando y su horario depende de como este la venta, hay veces que en 4 horas ya lo ha vendido todo, pero aveces se tarda hasta 7 horas para venderlo.

Rebeca, necesita el préstamo para comprar camarón y pescado por mayor, para que se lo vendan más barato. 

Rebeca, sueña con tener una tienda, terminar sus estudios y construir su propia casa porque actualmente vive con su suegra.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 20 years old and studied up to 6th grade. At age 13 she joined with her domestic partner who works as a carpenter. They have two children, one of whom is in kindergarten.

Rebeca began selling shellfish six years ago. She learned the trade with a friend and decided to engage in this business out of her necessity to cover all the household expenses. She has to travel 10 kilometers to buy her product, but when she can't make the trip she just has to call and they will send it to her. She sells her product walking door-to-door in the neighboring hamlets. Her schedule depends on how sales are going. At times she sells everything in four hours, but sometimes it takes as long as seven hours.

Rebeca needs the loan to buy shrimp and fish at wholesale so she can sell it at a better price. She dreams of having a store, going back to school to finish her studies, and building her own house because she lives with her mother-in-law now.

loans.use: to buy shrimp and fish at wholesale.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 46 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Alona works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like coffee, juice, soft drinks, canned goods, bread, etc. to sell.

Alona has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, juice, soft drinks, canned goods, bread, etc.

In the future, Alona would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like coffee, juice, soft drinks, canned goods, bread, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Yessenia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Yessenia, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, no siguió estudiando porque se acompaño y su pareja se dedica a la pesca artesanal, aún no tienen hijos.

Yessenia, desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de mariscos y dice que lo aprendió con una amiga y que fue la necesidad de ayudar a su pareja en los gastos, lo que la llevo a tomar está decisión; anteriormente trabajó con una institución llamada mangle durante 3 años; ahora compra los mariscos en su cantón y los lleva a vender a la ciudad y para llegar hasta allá tiene que tomar un vehículo que la lleva hasta la carretera y luego toma un bus que la conduce hasta ese lugar.

Yessenia, necesita el préstamo para comprar concentrado para camarón.

Su sueño es construir su propia casa y para comprar un carro para comercializar camarón.
texts.en:
Yessenia is 23 years old. She went to school until high school. She didn't continue her studies because she entered a common law marriage. Her partner works in artisanal fishing. They don't have children yet. Three years ago Yessenia began selling shrimp. She says she learned from a friend, and made the decision because she needed to help her partner with the expenses. Previously she worked for an institution called Mangle for 3 years.

Now she buys shrimp in her village and takes them to the city to sell. To arrive there she has to take a vehicle that gets her to the highway, and from there take a bus to get to the city. Yessenia needs the loan to buy concentrated feed for shrimp. Her dream is to build her own house and to buy a car for selling shrimp.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed for shrimp.

loans.name: Claudia Veronica

texts.es:
Claudia, de 20 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica al trabajo del campo en la agricultura, tiene 1 hijo de 4 años de edad, el cual aún no va a la escuela.   

Claudia, tiene una pequeña venta de pupusas en su casa desde hace 1 año, ella aprendió a hacer pupusas gracias a su mamá y decidió poner su pequeño negocio en su vivienda; antes se dedicaba a la recolección de huevos de tortugas en su comunidad ya que es un lugar cerca de las costas y ellos recolectaban los huevos de tortuga y se los vendían a un vivero de tortugas en donde los encuban y las sueltan al nacer.- 

Claudia, necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz y harina para hacer la masa de las pupusas, así como también para comprar queso, frijoles, chicharrón y aceite. 

Claudia, sueña con comprar una plancha más para hacer más pupusas.
texts.en:
Claudia, who is 20 years old, studied until the 9th grade. She has a common-law spouse, and her partner works in the fields in agriculture. She has 1 son who is 4 years old, who still does not attend school.
For one year, Claudia has had a small pupusa (stuffed tortillas) sales location in her home. She learned to make pupusas thanks to her mother, and decided to open her small business in her home. Previously, she worked collecting turtle eggs in her community, as it is a place close to the coast. They would collect the turtle eggs and sell them to a turtle hatchery where they incubate them and then let them go when they are born.
Claudia needs the loan to buy maize and flour to make the dough for pupusas, and also to buy cheese, beans, pork rind, and oil.
Claudia dreams of buying a griddle so she can make more pupusas.

loans.use: to buy maize and flour to make the dough for pupusas (stuffed tortillas), and also to buy cheese, beans, pork rind, and oil.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es: María es una mujer de 25 de edad que se dedica a la venta de productos básicos en su vivienda, con lo que logra sacar adelante a su familia. María cuenta con casa propia desde hace 15 años, en la que habita actualmente junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de una niña de 8 años y un varón de 2 años de edad. María desea surtir más su tienda, ya que cada día cuenta con más clientes que solicitan sus productos, gracias a sus 15 años de experiencia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: granos básicos, lácteos, embutidos, aceite, sal, golosinas, bebidas entre otros productos necesarios para surtir su tienda y aumenta sus ventas.
texts.en:
María is 25 years old and sells basic products from her house. With the income she earns she manages to raise her family.

Maria has had her own house for 15 years and this is where she now lives with her life partner and their two children; an eight-year-old girl and a two-year-old boy.

Maria would like to stock her store up more because she has more customers every day who are looking for products thanks to her 15 years of experience. This is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan. She will use it to invest in basic grains, dairy products, sausages, oil, salt, snacks, drinks, and other items necessary to stock her store and increase sales.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy products, sausages, oil, salt, snacks, drinks, and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Nashiba

texts.en:
Nashiba is 29 years old, married, and has three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling cellphone accessories in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional cellphone accessories to sell.

Nashiba has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Nashiba would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional cellphone accessories to sell

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 61 years old and has five children. She is a married woman.

Leonora is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs and other supplies to raise livestock.

Leonora has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed twelve times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Leonora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs and other supplies to raise livestock.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is 48 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Virgilia has a business as a direct seller of Natasha and MSE products in the Philippines. Virgilia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products from Natasha and MSE to sell to her customers.

Virgilia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Virgilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products from Natasha and MSE to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rogelia works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling feed in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rogelia is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed to sell through her business.

Rogelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed to sell.

loans.name: Deopita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Deopita works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

Deopita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as spices, meat, beans, vegetables, etc. for her food vending business.

Deopita has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as spices, meat, beans, vegetables, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 41 years old and has five children. She is married, and her five children are in school.

Analyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Analyn has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 43 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom attend school. Belinda works very hard to provide for them.

Belinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Belinda has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Belinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 53 years old and married. She has five children, three of whom are in school. Esther works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Esther has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Esther would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Analee

texts.en:
Analee is 32 years old and married, with three children. With three children currently in school, Analee works very hard to provide for them.

Analee runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, sugar, eggs, coffee, soft drinks, and beer.

Analee has been in this business for five years and she sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, sugar, eggs, coffee, soft drinks, and beer.

In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, sugar, eggs, coffee, soft drinks, and beer.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 58 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Evangeline has a fishing business in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

Evangeline has been in this business for 27 years. Evangeline would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by selling charcoal in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from raising pigs. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of charcoal to resell.

Wilma dreams that one day, she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Aira

texts.en:
Aira is 32 years old and married with two children, who are in school. Aira works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Aira has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Aira would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

Adelaida requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Adelaida has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Adelaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana es una comerciante de 28 años de edad que encontró en la venta de mercancías una oportunidad de negocio muy rentable y guiada por su hermana quien llevaba muchos años en esta labor, inició a promocionar prendas de vestir y calzado para toda la familia.  Ana reside en compañía de su único hijo y su cónyuge en un barrio de Barranquilla, y con su trabajo ha logrado incrementar los ingresos del hogar.  Todos los días de la semana está dispuesta a realizar ventas a partir de las 8 a.m., ella comparte su tiempo entre las labores del hogar, el cuidado de su hijo y su negocio; lo que más le agrada es poder cumplir a cabalidad cada uno de sus roles.  En la actualidad  está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en ropa y calzado para aprovechar la fuerte demanda que se avecina.  Ana tiene metas definidas para su negocio y a futuro se proyecta como propietaria de un almacén. Su meta familiar es mejorar las condiciones de habitabilidad de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana is a 28 year old businesswoman who found a profitable business opportunity in merchandise sales.  Guided by her sister, who has many years of experience in the industry, she began to sell garments and footwear for the whole family.  

Ana lives with her partner and her only son in a neighborhood of Barranquilla.  Through her work she has been able to increase her household income.  She makes sales each day starting at 8am, and splits her time between her household tasks, taking care of her children, and her business.  What makes her happiest is being able to fulfill each of her roles.  

She is currently processing her first Kiva credit with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in clothing and footwear to take advantage of the increased demand of the approaching season.  Ana has very defined goals for her business and in the future she hopes to be the owner of a grocery store.  Her family goal is to improve the living conditions of her household.

loans.use: to invest in clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Sitare

texts.en: Sitare is 60 years old. She is single. Sitare is IDP (Internally Displaced Person), lives in Bilesuvar region. She was farmer who has dedicated her whole life to this business. Sitara's monthly income is very low, i.e 120 Azn but this is not enough for meeting daily expenses. Sitara is old but even though being aged, she is very energetic and very experienced hardworking and respected woman. She has working in this job over 20 years.  Her brother is helping Sitara. Sitara wants to expand business together with her brother and to buy fruit trees and seeds. So she need some money and Kiva Lenders support.

loans.use: to buy fruit trees and seeds

loans.name: Maria Albertina

texts.es:
La señora, María Flores de  62 años de edad  vive con su esposo, tiene casa propia y vive en Nacaome Valle,  al sur de Honduras se dedica desde hace 12 años a su negocio, compra y venta de pan y a la venta de golosinas sus clientes son los vecinos del barrio y personas amigas que salen a vender  al mercado municipal de su lugar.
 La señora es una mujer trabajadora con muchos deseos de salir adelante, y agradece a  Prisma por la oportunidad que le pueden brindar. Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de pan, refrescos con el apoyo del crédito ella  pretende surtir y mejorar su negocio y vivienda
 Su sueño es que en su próximo crédito generar más sus ingresos.


San Lorenzo Valle Honduras - Septiembre 2015.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Flores is 62 years old and lives with her husband in their own home in the Nacaome Valle, in the south of Honduras. For 12 years she has dedicated herself to her business of buying and selling breads and sweets.  

Her clients are her neighbors and friends who go out to sell at the local municipal market.  

She is a hard-working woman with the desire to get ahead in life, and thanks Prisma for the opportunity it can provide.  She is requesting a loan to buy bread and drinks.  She hopes to stock her store and improve her business and her home.   Her dream is that with her next credit she will generate more income.  

San Lorenzo Valle Honduras - September 2015.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alejandra Doris

texts.es:
Alejandra es una mujer de 54 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija independiente de 30 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es constante, emprendedora y muy optimista. Su negocio lo realiza en la populosa zona ‘Max paredes’ caracterizada por el comercio formal e informal, librerías en medio de pollerías y tiendas de limpieza al lado de cambio de aceita para autos, todo se acomoda en esta área.
Alejandra es morena de baja estatura y rostro arrugado, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y para el comercio habla español. Su vida la comparte con su hija que trabaja, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano de mujer, como; chompas, chaquetas, abrigos y otros, “vendo ropa de mujer temporada de invierno, es la temporada predominante durante todo el año…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa abrigada se vende continuamente, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para poder tener el negocio en movimiento. Su sueño es comprarse un puesto de venta fijo para dejar de vender en la calle, ella desea comprar ropa de segunda mano por fardo para contar con mercadería en exposición. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Alejandra solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa de segunda mano por fardos y con los beneficios comprar un puesto de venta fijo.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a woman of 54 years old, single; she has a daughter 30 years of age who is independent, and her business is selling second-hand clothes. She is steadfast, enterprising, and very optimistic. She does business in the populous area ‘Max paredes’, characterized by formal and informal trade, bookstores amid pollerías [shops making and selling polleras (typical skirts)] and cleaning supply stores beside car oil change places; everything fits into this area.

Alejandra is brown-skinned, short in stature with a wrinkled face; her mother tongue is Aymara, which she speaks with her family, and for business she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her daughter, who works. They live in a rented brick room that has water, electricity, and sewerage. Her business is selling second-hand women’s clothing, such as: sweaters, jackets, coats and other items, “I sell women’s clothing for winter; it’s the season predominant throughout the year ...” she relates. Her business’s advantage is that warm clothes sell continuously; its disadvantage is the lack of money to be able to keep the business running.

Her dream is to buy herself a permanent sales stall in order to stop selling in the street. She wishes to buy second-hand clothes by the bale in order to have merchandise on display. This is her 1st loan cycle with the institution in the five years that she has been engaged in this business. It is for these reasons that Alejandra is applying for a loan to buy second-hand clothing by the bale and with the benefits buy a permanent sales stall.

loans.use: buy second-hand clothing by the bale and with the benefits buy a permanent sales stall.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 46 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell.

Janeth has been in this business for five years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Janeth aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from reselling frozen products.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for eight years. She has been sustaining her business through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: José María

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre muy trabajador, con grandes aspiraciones en la vida, tiene 41 años de edad, él cuenta que su crédito lo pudo invertir en la compra de fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de ejote, afortunadamente obtuvo una buena cosecha y en su mercado regional lo pudo vender. Jose tiene la necesidad de un nuevo préstamo para la compra de semillas de papa y abono químico, pues la época ya se acerca y él espera poder cultivar a tiempo.
Su gran esperanza de vida es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is a very hard-working man, with great aspirations in life. He is 41 years old. He says that he was able to invest his loan in the purchase of fertilizers for the maintenance of his green bean crops. Fortunately, he obtained a good harvest and he was able to sell in the market in his region. Jose needs a new loan to buy potato seeh and chemical fertilizer, as the season is coming closer and he hopes to be able to farm on time.
His great hope in life is to be able to improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to buy potato seed and chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Santa Catalina

texts.es:
La historia de Santa es la de una mujer guerrera, una persona que lo dejo todo por criar a sus hijos, una mujer muy humilde, con muy bajos recursos, pero esto nunca fue una excusa para ella, salía todos los días a buscarse algún alimento para sus hijos, realizaba cualquier trabajo honesto que tuvieran para ella.
Ahora se encuentra sacando adelante una profesión como independiente y para ello necesita tu ayuda un pequeño monto para comprar mercancía (venta de productos de uso personal), lociomes, accesorios, cosméticos y así tener un empleo fijó y seguir luchando como la guerrera que es por cambiar su realidad.
texts.en:
Santa's story is of a warrior woman, a woman who left everything to raise her children, a very humble woman, with very few resources, but this was never an excuse for her. She went out every day to seek some food for her children and did whatever type of honest work that there was for her.

Now she is getting ahead in a profession independently, and for this she needs your help for a small amount to purchase merchandise - personal products like lotions, cosmetics, and accessories - and, so, to have steady work and continue fighting like the warrior woman she is to change her reality.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like personal products like lotions, cosmetics, and accessories to have steady work.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Janeth is 40 years old.

Janeth has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Janeth requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more variety of fruit to sell in her fruit stall.

Janeth has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Janeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more variety of fruit to sell in her fruit stall.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 62 years old and has four children. She is a married woman.

Guillerma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Guillerma requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Guillerma has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Guillerma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Jesebel

texts.en:
Jesebel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.
