Jesebel requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like fishing net, etc. for her business.

Jesebel has been in this business for 15 years now.

Jesebel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fishing net, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Mariée, Adjo est une femme âgée de 36 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Adjo vit avec ses six enfants et son mari. Adjo est une revendeuse  de chaussures qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en circulant les quartiers environnant. Adjo demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat des douzaines de chaussures en vue de mieux revendre et de gagner des bénéfices afin de pouvoir aider son mari à bien prendre en charge leurs enfants dans leur éducation scolaire puis à certaines dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: Adjo is 36, married, and she lives in Adidogomé with her husband and her six children.  Adjo resells shoes and stocks up four times per month at the market.  She resells her merchandise from home and also as an itinerant sellers in the surrounding neighborhoods.  Adjo is taking this loan to buy 16 dozen shoes in order to increase her sales and make a profit.  Thanks to this loan, she will be able to help her husband to take good care of the children's education and to cover some day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy 16 dozen shoes.

loans.name: San Marcos Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Marcos está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, son de la ciudad de Concepción, una zona alejada de la capital, en especial este grupo está muy alejada de la capital, tiene poco acceso a ciertos medios de comunicación, y ellas quieren crecer y salir adelante.
La Sra. Beata, quien hace trabajos de manicura por su barrio y otras zonas, comenta que ya tiene muy buena clientela, que siempre le hace muchos pedidos de su trabajo. Ella es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, es por eso que le está yendo muy bien.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar esmaltes, alicates, limas, acetonas y otros insumos que necesita para poder seguir ofreciendo un servicio de calidad a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de mejorar su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The San Marcos group is in its first loan cycle in the women's committee program. They live in the city of Concepción, an area far from the capital. Since they are in an especially remote location, this group has little access to certain means of communication, and they want to grow and get ahead.

Senora Beata works as a manicurist for her neighborhood and other areas. She comments that she already has a very good clientele, who often request her services. She is a woman who is very good at what she does, so her business is going very well for her.

She is requesting this loan to buy nail polish, nail clippers, files, nail polish remover, and other supplies that she needs in order to continue offering quality service to her customers. She is thankful for this opportunity to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, nail clippers, files, nail polish remover, and other manicure supplies.

loans.name: Marvin Consepcion

texts.es:
El señor  Marvin de 35  años de edad es soltero y  vive con su familia  que no depende de él,  se dedica desde  hace 05  años a la venta de leña y leche en su comunidad, sus clientes son todos  sus vecinos amistades y demás personas que transitan por su comunidad
 Don. Marvin cuenta con su propio ganado y terrenos,  él es un                hombre que lucha día con día  para  pode mejorar su cálida de vida                                                                                                        está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de 1 Lote de Leña seca para vender a sus clientes,  con este crédito él pretende mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, es un persona  con deseo de trabajar con Prisma.

Su sueño es  mejorar su negocio y su calidad de vida.
San Lorenzo  Honduras – Septiembre 2015
texts.en:
Marvin is 35 years old, he is single, and lives with his family, who do not depend on him. He has worked for 5 years in the sale of firewood and milk in his community. He clients are all his neighbors, friends, and other people who circulate in his community.
Marvin has his own livestock and plots of land. He is a man who fights every day to be able to improve his quality of life. He is asking for the loan to buy one batch of dry firewood to sell to his clients. With this loan, he wants to improve his income and his quality of life.
He is a person with the desire to work with Prisma. His dream is to improve his business and his quality of life.
San Lorenzo Honduras - September 2015.

loans.use: to purchase one batch of dry firewood to sell.

loans.name: Lordita

texts.en:
Lordita is 60 years old and married with four children.

Lordita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lordita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lordita has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Lordita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rafael Augusto

texts.es: Rafael de 38 años es un microempresario que reside en Barranquilla un municipio del departamento del Atlántico que maneja una gastronomía variada y se reconoce en todo el país por su despliegue de sabores. Aunque Rafael no estudió cocina y se dedicaba a una profesión totalmente diferente, una amiga lo capacitó y encontró en estas comidas la oportunidad de iniciar su propio negocio, puesto que había quedado desempleado y con la liquidación que recibió emprendió este proyecto. Hoy en día cuenta con dos años de estar brindándoles a los Barranquilleros, exquisitas empanadas, carimañolas, arepas de huevo, patacones, arepas dulces con anís a partir de las 4 p.m. hasta las 9 p.m., En la actualidad está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en materias primas para su producción de alimentos entre ellas harina, azúcar y maíz, así mismo comprará un freidor eléctrico.  Rafael es soltero y sus metas se basan en conseguir con su trabajo los medios para adquirir una vivienda y crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Rafael, 38, is a micro-entrepreneur living in Barranquilla, a municipality in the Atlantico region, which has a richly varied culinary culture, known throughout the country for its range of flavors. Although Rafael did not study cooking and has a completely different profession, a friend trained him, and with the dishes he learned, he saw an opportunity to open his own business, since he had been laid off and with the severance package he received he started up this venture. For two years now he has been offering to Barranquilleros exquisite empanadas, meat pies, egg arepas, plantain sandwiches, sweet arepas with anis, from 4 PM until 9 PM. He is applying for his first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which he will invest in basic ingredients such as flour, sugar and corn, and he will buy an electric fryer. Rafael is single, and his goal is to grow his business and with his earnings buy his own home.

loans.use: to buy basic ingredients for his food production including flour, sugar and corn, and to purchase an electric fryer.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marilyn is 47 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Marilyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

Marilyn has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mercedita is 53 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Mercedita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Mercedita requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Mercedita has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Mercedita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Marlo Edgardo

texts.es:
Marlo, de 27 años de edad, está soltero y en su casa vive con sus padres y dos de sus hermanos.

Marlo, se dedica a la música, él pertenece a un grupo musical desde hace más de 4 años, de igual manera también se dedica a la agricultura y en esta labor colaboran sus padres.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes, abono y pesticidas para sembrar maíz y de esa manera asegurar una buena producción y generar ingresos para su hogar.

En el futuro pretende formar su propio hogar y seguir trabajando la tierra para poder darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Marlon, 27, is single and lives at home with his parents two of his siblings.

Marlon works as a musician. He has been part of a band for more than four years. He also works in agriculture with his parents.

He needs this loan to buy chemical and organic fertilizers and also pesticides in order to grow corn and ensure good production to generate income for his household.

In the future, he intends to start his own household and continue working the land in order to give his family the best.

loans.use: to buy chemical and organic fertilizers and also pesticides to grow corn and ensure good production.

loans.name: Ariza

texts.es: Ariza es una joven que vive junto a su familia. Con el propósito de ampliar la vivienda y mejorar las condiciones de vida, solicita un préstamo de quinientos dólares ($ 500 ), para la compra de materiales de construcción que le permitan llevar a cabo su proyecto.
texts.en: Ariza is a young woman who lives with her family. With the purpose of improving her home and her living condition, she is asking for a loan of five hundred dollars ($500) for the purchase of construction materials that will allow her to carry out her project.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve her home

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.es: Doña Merlyn trabaja en su propia tienda de abarrotes, en la cual ofrece diversidad de productos a sus clientes. Solicita un préstamo de un millón cincuenta mil colones (₡ 1 050 000), para la compra de productos que comercializa en su tienda, entre estos,productos alimenticios, de uso personal, de uso doméstico. Esto con el fin de aumentar su volumen de inventario y de esta forma incrementar las ventas de su negocio.
texts.en: Merlyn works in her own grocery store which offers a variety of products to her customers. She’s asking for a loan for ₡1,050,000 Costa Rican dollars (CRC) to buy merchandise such as foodstuffs, personal products, and household products. All of these products will allow her to increase her inventory and increase her business sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Super Group

texts.en:
Spaceman shops in a high density suburb is an area characterised by a lot of activity. There are many business ventures going on there from super markets, vegetable vendors, fuel stations, cobblers, etc. It is also serves as a pick and drop off point for many transport operators providing bus services. Behind the shopping complex there is a plank and plastic roadside stall built strategically where there are many passer-bys.

The stall has products ranging from children’s snacks, some basic everyday household needs and some clothing items. Maria, the owner of that stall specifically sells snacks, biscuits, freezits and sweets in front to capture the eyes of children passing by with their parents so as to attract the adults to her stall. This busy area makes her get a lot of sales from people to and from Spaceman who use that alley a lot.

Maria is a young mother of four children, two of them school-going. She is married and her husband is unemployed. Her major business is the cross border business, though she is not crossing a lot these days as she is nursing a four-month-old infant. She would sell her cross border wares to people around her neighbourhood and in companies in town. After she realised that she had to pause crossing because of the young infant in her care, Maria decided to restock grocery items and snacks for selling by her gate side. She also liaised with her relatives overseas to send her good second-hand clothing to sell to the low income market. She then sells both clothing and groceries, thereby managing to earn an honest living.

Maria joined Thrive Microfinance along with other members from her group, called Super. She is the “baby “in the group as all the other three members are her “mothers”. Because of her age and writing skills, Maria was nominated the group secretary, a role which she takes seriously. She makes sure that she announces meeting dates on time and writes the minutes at every meeting exactly as she learned from the training she attended at Thrive. She is also the one who regularly checks on the records of the older women to see if they are doing everything correctly.

With a loan from Kiva, Maria would like to buy new children’s clothing to sell. She also wants to add on to the refreshment side of her business and add more soft drinks, juices, mineral water and freezits, as it is a hot summer and these are in demand. She does not want to lack any of the things a customer might want from her stall.

loans.use: to buy new children’s clothing to sell. She also wants to add on to the refreshment side of her business and add more soft drinks, juices, mineral water and freezits.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos Alberto con 41 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia ,junto a su cónyuge e hijo, en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Carlos Alberto se dedica a brindar los servicios agrícolas de jornalería, contando con herramientas propias, como moto lineal, mochila de fumigar, palana, pico y oz, así mismo cuenta con una moto lineal la cuál le sirve como medio de transporte a su centro de labores, con más de 05 años de experiencia en el negocio.Solicita préstamo para arreglos de vivienda y para mantenimiento de su moto lineal, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio. De esta manera podrá mejorar su productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los habitantes de la zona.

Carlos Alberto es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido dos créditos de 1000,00 y 1000,00 los cuáles los a pagado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto is 41 years old and is in a common-law marriage. He lives in his own house with his life partner and son in the Oyotun district of Chiclayo Province, which is in the department of Lambayeque in rural Peru. Most people in this region work in agriculture, trade, and livestock.

Carlos Alberto works in the agricultural sector as a day laborer. He has his own tools such as a backpack sprayer, shovel, pickaxe and sickle. He also has a motorcycle which is his means of transport to where he works. He has been doing this work for more than five years.

He is asking for a loan so he can do repairs on his house and to perform maintenance on his motorcycle. This investment will put his equipment in better working order which will have a positive impact on his ability to work. It will increase his productivity and allow him to better tend to the diverse needs of the people in his region.

Carlos Alberto is a repeat borrower and member of Edpyme Alternative. He has had two loans of 1000.00 PEN each and has paid them back punctually.

loans.use: to do repairs on his house and perform maintenance on his motorcycle.

loans.name: Mukaushande Group

texts.en:
Grace is a 27-year-old woman; with 3 other women they make up the Mukaushande Group (which is a Shona phrase translated to English as ‘get up and work’). She is married to a self-employed vendor and they have two children, one of which is going to school.

Grace runs a flea market table in a suburb of Harare. While most people who run flea market stalls in the area are selling clothes, shoes or blankets, Grace is in a unique trade supplying kitchenware, mainly cups, plates and pots. She restocks the kitchenware from shops in town and sometimes from South Africa and Botswana by sending cross boarder traders to restock for her.

She works at her flea market alone without much help from anyone, so on days when she wants to restock she has to wake up early so that she is waiting outside the shop by 8:00am before they even open. She then quickly buys her products using a carefully constructed list. After this she then rushes back to her flea market stall and displays the new products for sale. When her children are on school holidays, they assist with selling at the flea market.

Grace has been in this business for three years now, and she and her group are applying for a loan of $1,000 to finance their businesses. She plans to use her portion of the loan to do the cross boarder trading herself, as kitchenware is cheaper to buy from South Africa.

loans.use: to start sourcing kitchenware from South Africa and Botswana to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo a sus 45 años de edad, es soltero. Se ha dedicado a las labores del campo desde que tenía 12 años, pues viene de una familia campesina muy humilde, con quien aprendió todo lo relacionado con el cuidado de animales y la agricultura. 

Actualmente posee cultivos en la finca donde vive; de estas actividades percibe los ingresos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su hogar. 

Es un hombre pujante, activo y trabajador, lucha diariamente con esmero y dedicación para sacar adelante a sus familiares, hermanos, padres, personas que dependen de él, no solo dle dinero, sino la fuerza motivacional que les brinda. Solicita el crédito como apoyo para continuar con sus labores, con el dinero comprará una guadañadora y una motosierra con las cuales mantendrá sus cultivos libres de maleza, para que la cosecha sea más productiva y pueda ser vendida con mayor facilidad en el mercado, generando así un margen de utilidad más amplio. 

Gerardo con su humildad y su sencillez sólo desea poder tener una estabilidad económica favorable, lo que para él significa disfrutar de buenas condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Gerardo, aged 45, is single. He has been working in the fields since he was 12 years old, because he comes from a very humble, rural family, who taught him everything about caring for livestock and agriculture.

Currently, he cultivates crops at the farm where he lives, which brings in sufficient earnings to cover his household costs.

He is vigorous, active and hard-working, and works diligently and conscientiously every day to help his family get ahead. He is requesting a loan to support his business, and will use the money to buy a strimmer and a chainsaw for clearing weeds from his crops. This will ensure a better harvest, and allow him to sell his produce more easily, increasing his income.

Gerardo, humble and simple, wishes only for economic stability, so that he can enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a strimmer and a chainsaw to keep his crops free of weeds.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, a 40-year-old Palestinian father of three, lives with his wife and three children in a camp for the Palestinian refugees located in North Lebanon. His wife is unemployed and his children will be all graduating from school in the upcoming years, education being a priority in the family.

15 years ago, Mohammad rented a car and started to work as a taxi driver inside the camp. and since 2012 he has bought a car and started his own business in order to reduce renting costs and increase his profitability.

Mohammad's ambition is to see his business grow. He is asking for a 1,543,992 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva partner Ibdaa for the first time. He will be using the loan to cover maintenance costs needed for his car. This way, he will be reducing the risks of eventual break downs and he will be able to serve more customers in better conditions.

After working as a driver for 15 years, Mohammad has become well know in the area where he lives, but also throughout the camp. He has his own clients who trust him for his reliability and punctuality.

loans.use: to cover his car's maintenance costs

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel con 22 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus hijos, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

María Isabel se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, como patos,cuyes y cerdos, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 05 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una moto carguera así mismo para realizar arreglos en sus corrales. De esta manera le facilitará obtener ingresos adicionales.

María Isabel si cuenta con experiencia crediticia.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is 22 years old and lives in a common law marriage with her spouse and children in the district of Zana, province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque, Peru. The people of this town are devoted mostly to agriculture and livestock trade.

Maria Isabel works in the breeding and sale of small animals such as ducks, guinea pigs and pigs, and has 5 years experience in the field.

She is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle and also to fix her pens. This will provide additional income.

Maria Isabel has had loan experience.

loans.use: for the purchase of a cargo motorbike.

loans.name: Corina

texts.es:
Corina es una mujer de 39 años de edad, soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 2, 13 y 20 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es buena madre, conversadora y muy amigable. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por recibir la migración campo ciudad, área donde los pobladores son multilingües.
Corina es morena de cabello negro y físico mediano, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y su hijo menor aún no está en edad escolar, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida, ella tiene un carrito hamburguesero dónde prepara diferentes comidas como; hamburguesas, pollo frito, carne a la plancha y lo acompaña con arroz, yuca o ensalada, “inicié mi negocio con mi carro que esta viejo y es pequeño, necesito mejorar el negocio renovando mi carrito…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es que su carro es pequeño y no abastece la demanda. Su sueño es tener un puesto de comida cómodo, ella desea comprar un carro hamburguesero grande para poder preparar más comida y abastecer la demanda. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Corina solicita un préstamo para comprar un carro hamburguesero grande para vender más comida.
texts.en:
Corina is a 39-year-old woman, she is single, and she has three sons who are 2, 13, and 20 years old. Her business is food sales.
She is a good mother, very talkative and friendly. She has her business in the neighborhood 'plan 3000,' known for receiving the migration from the fields to the city, an area where the citizens are multilingual.
Corina is brown skinned, with black hair, and a medium physique. Her mother tongue is Guarani, which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish because of general culture. She shares her life with her children who study at school. The youngest one is not yet of school age. They live in a house that is the property of the family. It is made of brick and has potable water, electricity, and a sewage system.
Her business is the sale of food. She has a hamburger cart where she prepares different meals, such as hamburgers, fried chicken, and grilled meats, which she serves together with rice, yucca, or salad. "I started my business with my cart, which is old and small. I need to improve the business by renovating my cart..." she says. The advantage of her business is that she can count on daily sales. The disadvantage is that her cart is small and does not meet the demand.
Her dream is to have a comfortable food stall. She wants to buy a big hamburger cart to be able to prepare more food and meet the demand. In the 3 years that she has had this occupation, this is the first sequence of loans with the institution.
It is for these reasons that Corina asks for a loan, to buy a big hamburger cart to sell more food.

loans.use: to buy a big hamburger cart to sell more food.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 47 years old and has one child in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cherry has a fishing business in the Philippines. Cherry requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy gasoline, fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

Cherry has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Cherry would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Juana De Jesus

texts.es:
Juana, de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado y no pudo seguir estudiando por falta de dinero, está soltera y tiene 4 hijos que están estudiando y en su casa también vive su mamá.

Juana, vende ropa en su comunidad desde hace 4 años y también trabaja lavando y planchado en casa particulares; antes se dedicaba solo a los trabajos domésticos, pero ahora tiene 2 fuentes de ingresos, ella camina por toda la comunidad para ofrecer la ropa que vende y sus hijos le ayudan cuando salen de la escuela; ella sale a vender 3 veces por semana y el horario de venda es de 8:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m. y se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para prepara el desayuno para sus hijos y para su mamá y luego poder salir temprano a vender.

Juana, necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa para niños, niñas, jóvenes, adultos, como camisas, pantalones, calcetines y otros.

Juana, sueña con apoyar a sus hijos para que tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
Juana is 43 years old and studied until ninth grade, but couldn't continue studying due to a lack of money.  She is single and has 4 children who are studying, and her mother also lives there.  

Juana has sold clothing in her community for four years, and she also works washing and ironing clothing in individual houses. Before, she made a living through her housework, but now she has two sources of income.  

She walks around her community to sell clothing, and her children help her when they get out of school.  She goes out to sell 3 times a week, and her schedule is 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. and she gets up at 5:00 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her children and mother and then be able to leave early to sell.  

Juana needs the loan to buy clothing for children, teenagers and adults, such as shirts, pants, socks and others.  Juana dreams of supporting her children so that they have a good education.

loans.use: to buy clothing for children, teenagers and adults such as shirts, pants, socks and others.

loans.name: Jeannine

texts.fr:
Jeannine est une femme active, dynamique de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et son époux est électricien-mécanicien. Le couple est parents de deux enfants de 20 et 30 ans. Ces derniers ont déjà leurs propres job donc ne dépendent plus de leur parent.
Elle exploite une activité d'élevage de porc il y a maintenant 7 ans à part l'exercice d'une épi-gargote. L'élevage de porc est très intéressant selon elle et complémentaire avec l'autre activité car les déchets constituent des aliments pour les cheptels.
Le rêve du couple est de pouvoir ouvrir un garage pour Monsieur un jour, le revenu généré par l’élevage de porc est destiné dans leur épargne depuis le début de cette année.
texts.en:
Jeannine is a 50-year-old dynamic and active woman. Her husband is an electrician and mechanic. They have two children ages 20 and 30 years old who both have their own occupations and are no longer depending on their parents.

Jeannine started breeding pigs 7 years ago as a sideline to her grocery store/canteen business. She finds pig farming very interesting and a convenient complement to her other activity as food scraps help to feed the animals.

The couple's dream is for Jeannine's husband to own a garage. Therefore, the income generated by the pig farm has been set aside as savings since the beginning of the year.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and some hog feed.

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en:
Adeline is a hard-working woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Adeline dreams that, one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Nelson Norvey

texts.es:
Nelson, a sus 29 años de edad, es padre de 2 hijos. Toda su vida ha vivido en el campo, donde aprendió todas las labores agropecuarias gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre. 

Actualmente se dedica a la producción de café, de esta manera genera los ingresos necesarios para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. El cliente es un hombre juicioso, disciplinado y trabajador, a pesar de las adversidades, siempre busca opciones que le permitan progresar. Por esto se anima a solicitar el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, semillas de café y fertilizantes), necesarios  para abonar sus tierras. 

De esta forma podrá ayudarse para que su cultivo se mantenga sano y productivo, así tendrá la oportunidad de incrementar sus ventas y recibir mejores ingresos con los cuales desea dar una excelente educación a sus hijos y continuar sustentando las necesidades de su familia para que en un futuro cercano puedan disfrutar de mejores condiciones y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nelson, 29, is a father of two children. He has lived all of his life in the countryside, where he learned all about farming thanks to his father's teachings. Today he works growing coffee, and in this way generates enough money to cover the basic needs of his home. 

He is a judicious, disciplined and hard-working man in spite of adversity, always looking for ways to get ahead. This is why he is pushing himself to ask for a loan and to invest it in the purchase of agricultural supplies (manure, coffee seeds and fertilizers) that are necessary to fertilize his fields. 

In this way, he will be able to keep his crops healthy and productive, and have the opportunity to increase his sales and receive a higher income, which he hopes can be used to give an excellent education to his children and continue supporting the needs of his family, so that in the near future they can enjoy better conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies (manure, coffee seeds and fertilizers) necessary to fertilize his lands.

loans.name: Morina

texts.en:
Morina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines.

Morina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Morina has been in this business for 13 years now.

In the future, Morina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

Myrna requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Virginia is 52 years old, and has one child who is still in school.

Virginia has a buy-and-sell scrap materials business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more scrap materials to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for ten years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to sell.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es padre de 3 hijos y es casado. Aparte de su familia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 32 años. 

Aprendió de este negocio empíricamente, es decir a través de la práctica y la observación de otras personas. El y su familia viven en zona rural de Sonson en la cual no es fácil tener acceso a servicios financieros como los que ofrece la Corporación Interactuar. 

Su crédito lo piensa usar en la compra de insumos agropecuarios como semillas, productos para el control de plagas, y abonos para realizar mantenimiento y sostenimiento a sus cultivos.

Gracias a este crédito, la economía y  calidad de vida de su familia mejoraría pues podrá aumentar sus ingresos. 

Antonio sueña terminar con la legalización de los papeles de su tierra y así tener en pleno el control de sus tierras.
 
¡Impacte la vida de Antonio y su familia con un crédito!
texts.en:
Antonio is married and has three children. In addition to his family, he has devoted his life to farming for 32 years. He learned this business through his own experiences and by observing others.

Antonio and his family live in the rural area of Sonson, where it's difficult to gain access to financial services like those offered by the Corporación Interactuar. He plans to use his loan to buy farming supplies like seeds, pest control products, and fertilizer to maintain and sustain his crops. Thanks to this loan, his family's household budget and quality of life will improve since he will be able to earn more income.

Antonio dreams of finishing the process of legalizing his property rights so that he will have full control of his land.

Have a positive impact on the lives of Antonio and his family: Make a loan!

loans.use: to buy farming supplies like seeds, pest control products, and fertilizer to maintain and sustain his crops.

loans.name: Elipio

texts.es:
Elipio con 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltero,vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, siendo el cultivo de arroz el de mayor producción, así como el comercio en general.

Elipio se dedica a brindar servicio de mantenimiento y reparación de motos en general, cuenta con un taller propio, con más de 02 años de experiencia en el rubro de la mecánica.Solicita préstamo para la compra de algunas herramientas y así mismo para arreglos de su local. De esta manera podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Elipio es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Elipio is 20 years old and is single. He lives with his parents in the district of Pucará, Jaén province, in the department of Cajamarca, Perú. The inhabitants of the area work mainly in agriculture, rice being the major crop and also in general commerce.

Elipio works providing motor maintenance and repairs services. He has his own shop and has more than two years experience in the field of mechanics. He is requesting this loan to buy some tools and make some repairs on his shop. Doing this he can acquire an acceptable profit and improve his quality of living.

Elipio is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy some tools and also to make repairs at his shop.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 28 years old and married with three children. With two of her children currently in school, Analyn works very hard to provide for them.

Analyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Analyn has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, chocolate drinks, juice, milk, canned goods, detergent soap, etc.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Olivier

texts.fr: Olivier est un brave père de famille de quatre garçons. Ces derniers sont âgés de 2, 6, 12, et 15 ans. Trois de ses enfants sont scolarisés. Sa femme (mère de ses enfants) travaille en tant que machiniste dans une entreprise de zone franche et c'est lui qui s'occupe de l'élevage et des cultures ainsi que son fils. La demande de prêt, c'est pour financer l'élevage de porc, Il voudrait ajouter trois têtes de porcin pour renforcer la petite ferme.
texts.en: Olivier is a brave father of four boys ages 2, 6, 12, and 15 years old, three of whom go to school. His wife (and the mother of his children) works as a machinist in a free-zone company, so he is the one who looks after the family's farming activities with the help of his son. He is seeking this loan to finance his pig breeding activity. He plans to add 3 piglets to his small farm.

loans.use: to buy 3 piglets.

loans.name: Winefreda

texts.en:
Winefreda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Winefreda requested a PHP 10,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and tools for her business.

She has been in this business for 16 years now.

Winefreda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and tools for her business.

loans.name: Mahmad

texts.en:
Mahmad is a kind man. He has higher education. He is clever and always tries for the well-being of his family.

He is married and has a child. He has worked in IMON International for more than three years. He is an LO.

Mahmad does his job well and he is industrious. He now needs financial support because his mother is ill. He must buy medicines for her. He is asking for a loan of 1,000 TJS to buy medicines for his mother’s treatment. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment of his mother

loans.name: Eden

texts.es:
Eden con 33 años de edad,de estado civil separado, vive sólo en el distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Eden cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, siendo el cultivo de arroz el de mayor producción, así como el comercio en general,etc.

Eden se dedica a brindar servicio de mantenimiento y reparación de motos en general, cuenta con taller propio, con más de 08 años de experiencia en el rubro de la mecánica.Solicita préstamo para la compra de una comprensadora para realizar sus trabajos mecánicos. De esta manera podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que de esta manera mejore su calidad de vida.

Eden es socio reactivado para Edpyme Alternativa, este es su segundo crédito.
texts.en:
Eden is 33 years old and separated. He lives alone in the district of Pucará, in Jaén province, in the department of Cajamarca, Peru. He has very good references both personal and professional. The residents of Pucará work mainly in agriculture, with rice being the most produced crop, as well as in general commerce, etc.

Eden earns his living providing general motorcycle maintenance and repair. He has his own shop with more than eight years of experience in the mechanical field. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of a compressor to carry out his mechanical work. In this way, he will be able to earn an acceptable profit in order to improve his quality of life.

Eden is a returning member of Edpyme Alternativa. This is his second loan.

loans.use: to buy a compressor to carry out his mechanical work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the repair of a food cart and for the purchase of another food cart, to make sandwiches and hot dogs.

loans.name: Rizalene

texts.en:
Rizalene is 39 years old and single, with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Rizalene has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buy-and-sell ready to wear.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Verginita

texts.en:
Verginita is 60 years old and married with four children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Verginita has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 43 years old and married, with four children. Three of her children attend in school, and she is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lucia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 32 years old, with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, and other groceries.

Rosalie has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from buy-and-sell charcoal.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, and other groceries

loans.name: Paraiso De Jesus Group

texts.es: Domitila es una mujer emprendedora  que sale adelante por su menor hijo de trece años que se encuentra en etapa escolar, ella se dedica a la atención de su bodega donde vende toda clases de víveres,cervezas,gaseosas y mas, ella se levanta muy temprano para atender su bodega ya que sus clientes la buscan para las compras del desayuno, sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y gente cercana al lugar donde vive que la buscan por el buen trato que reciben. el préstamo que solicitó  lo invertirá para surtir mas su bodega en la compra de víveres como arroz,azúcar,leche,gaseosas,cervezas y mas.Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la confianza y el apoyo que recibe y pide que no dejen de apoyar a gente que como ella lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Domitila is an enterprising woman who prospers for the sake of her youngest son, who is 13 years old and currently in school. She makes a living running a small grocery store, where she sells all kinds of food products, beers, soft drinks and more. 

She rises early in the morning to attend to her grocery store, as her customers go to her for their breakfast shopping. Her main customers are her neighbors and people who live nearby her, who seek her out for the agreeable treatment provided. 

The loan requested will go to supplying her business further by purchasing food products, such as rice, sugar, milk, soft drinks, beers and more. She thanks the Kiva supporters for the trust and assistance she receives and urges that they keep supporting people like her in need.

loans.use: to purchase food products, such as rice, sugar, oil, soft drinks and more.

loans.name: Girly Rose

texts.en:
Girly Rose is 29 years old and married, with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Girly Rose has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, personal care products, and school supplies.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Yến's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Yến is 38 years old and she is married. 
She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years.
Yến lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is unstable because when some disease on poultry happens, they could die, which left her nothing to sell. And she will be financial trouble.
The main hardship that Yến faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to expand her business and increase the income by purchasing baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.
In 2014, Yến joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Yến has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the leader of three-member group.
In the future, Yến hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to expand her business and increase income by purchasing baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Aluncia

texts.en:
Aluncia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business farming rice in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Aluncia has been in this business for 11 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Aluncia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 53 years old and married with six children.

Aurelia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aurelia has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Aurelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Methodia

texts.en:
Methodia works hard to support her family. Methodia is married and has a business of selling ornamental plants in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials like flower pots, rope, etc., for her business.

Methodia has been in this business for ten years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like flower pots, rope, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Mom makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller and fisherman to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Dulce Amanecer Maranniyoc Group

texts.es:
La socia Albina pertenece al banco comunal DULCE AMANECER MARANIYOC, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia continua  dedicándose al cultivo de frutas como plátanos, naranjas  entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia  lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solcito el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes entre otros.
Los demás socios en general agraden el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Albina is a member of the community bank Dulce Amanecer Maraniyoc. The bank is located in the Vilcabamba district of the La Convención province in the department of Cusco.

The member continues to make a living cultivating fruits such as bananas and oranges among others. She is a responsible and determined person. She has had her business for a long time, and it brings her personal satisfaction as it is the way that she support her family.

The member is asking for the loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizers, among other supplies. As a group, the members are grateful for the loan and promise to make the established payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers, among other supplies.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 33 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Marissa works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Marissa has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 34 years old, married with four children. One of whom is in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Julie has a motorcycle passenger business in the Philippines. Julie requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy wheels and spare parts for her motorcycle passenger.

Julie has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Julie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and spare parts for her motorcycle passenger.

loans.name: Helen Rose

texts.en:
Helen Rose is 32 years old and married with one child who is in school.

Helen Rose is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Helen Rose requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Helen Rose has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helen Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 53 years old and married.

Angelina is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Angelina requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Angelina has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Angelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Cristabel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cristabel, de 43 años de edad, no pudo estudiar, está soltera, tiene 2 hijas, pero solo una vive con ella y su nieta.

Cristabel, vende semillas de marañón desde hace 10 años, pero también se ha dedicado a ayudarle a una vecina a vender pan y tamales 3 veces a la semana; ella sale a ofrecer tamales y pan en el caserío y camina alrededor de 5 kilómetros cuando sale a vender tamales o pan y la semilla de marañón la llegan a traer a su casa y la semilla de marañón la  prepara su hija y se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. 

Cristabel, necesita el préstamo para comprar semillas de marañón para la venta.

Cristabel, sueña con seguir trabajando para poder mejorar su vivienda pues no está en muy buenas condiciones.
texts.en: Cristabel is 43 years old, single, and was not able to go to school. She lives with one of her two daughters and her granddaughter.  She has been selling cashew nuts for 10 years, but also works helping her neighbour to sell bread and tamales three times a week. She offers tamales and bread in her village and walks around 5 kilometers when she goes out to sell them.  The cashew nuts are delivered to her house, prepared by her daughter and she gets up at 5:00 a.m.  Cristabel needs the loan to buy cashew nuts to sell. Cristabel's dream is to continue to work in order to improve her house which is not in a good condition.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Arlene is 44 years old, and two of her children are currently in school.

Arlene has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Arlene has been in this business for three years. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Albai Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Albai de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Doña Albai, who is 55 years old, lives in her own house with her husband. For 10 years she has made a living making and selling tortillas. Her business is run out of her place of residence, and she has many customers. Through the sales she makes she is able to pay some of her home expenses. 

The client is asking again for a loan to buy wholesale corn and lime in order to continue making tortillas and so continue with her work and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn and lime.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
La señora Narcisa de 63  años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijas  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 15 años al negocio de venta de cuajada y leche, y también cuenta con su molino eléctrico para quebrar el maíz de sus vecinos amistades y demás personas que transitan por la zona,  radica  vive en  el morancito al sur de Honduras, ella es una mujer con deseo de salir adelante y tener éxito en su vida. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de 1 baca parida para generar más leche y obtener mejores ganancias en su negocio,  con el apoyo de este crédito  pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma
Su sueño es tener un negocio grande para la mejora de su vida.

San Lorenzo Honduras -  Septiembre 2015
texts.en:
Narcisa, 63, lives with her husband and daughters in her own home. For 15 years she has been in the business of selling curds and milk, and she also has her electric grinder to break corn for her neighbors, friends, and other people who pass through the area. She lives in Morancito in the south of Honduras; she is a woman with the desire to get ahead and succeed in life.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of one milk-producing cow to generate more milk and obtain better profits in her business. With the support of this loan she aims to improve her income and also her quality of life. She is a client with the desire to work with Prisma. Her dream is to have a big business for the improvement of her life.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2015

loans.use: buy one milk-producing cow.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines.

Merlina requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana continúa con su negocio de panadería casera. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió comprando utensilios de cocina y harina por quintal, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque el pan se vendió continuamente. Actualmente su negocio trabaja diariamente incluso los domingos, las ventas son buenas porque logra vender toda su producción, “existe gran demanda de pan, sobre todo por las mañanas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias y acaba toda su producción, la desventaja es la falta de un horno nuevo y más grande para poder hornear mayor cantidad de pan. Su sueño es tener una panadería amplia y completa, ella desea comprar un horno industrial grande para hornear mayor cantidad de pan a diario. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Roxana solicita un préstamo para comprar un horno industrial grande para hornear más cantidad de pan.
texts.en:
Roxana still has her home-made bread business. She invested her last loan in the purchase of kitchen utensils and hundredweights of flour. She repaid her loan punctually because the bread sold continually.

Currently, Roxana's business is open every day, even on Sundays. Her sales are good because she is able to sell everything she produces. She says, “There is a great demand for bread, especially in the mornings." Her business's advantage is that she sells every day and sells everything she bakes. A difficulty is that she doesn't have a new, bigger oven to bake a larger quantity of bread.

Roxana's hope is to have a large, full service bakery. She wants to buy a large, industrial oven so she can bake a larger quantity of bread each day. This is Roxana's second lending cycle with the institution in the six years that she has had her business.

Those are the reasons Roxana is requesting a loan- to purchase a large, industrial oven to be able to bake greater quantities of bread.

loans.use: to purchase a large, industrial oven so she can bake a greater quantity of bread.

loans.name: Gremialistas Group

texts.es:
Marlen es una mujer de 52 años de edad, soltera, tiene hijos independientes, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es emprendedora, amable y muy conversadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por la multiculturalidad de sus pobladores esto debido a la recepción de la migración campo ciudad de todos los rincones del país.
Marlen es  morena, de cabello negro y físico mediano (sentada al centro, viste blusa amarilla), su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que son independientes y trabajan, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. El deseo de mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar la banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios son; taller de soldadura, venta de comida tradicional, panadería, venta de refrescos, venta de productos naturales para la salud, confección de ropa deportiva y servicio de taxi. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, actividad que realiza ambulantemente, en la calle sobre un plástico expone la ropa separándola por género y edad, “vendemos pura ropa de verano porque es el único clima que tenemos todo el año…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que existe demanda en el mercado, la desventaja es la falta de mercadería para competir. Su sueño es comprar un puesto de venta fijo, ella desea comprar ropa de segunda mano por mayor para hacer frente a la competencia. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Marlen solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa de segunda mano por mayor para hacer frente a la competencia.
texts.en:
Marlen, 52, is single and has independent children. Her business is selling used clothing.

She is enterprising, kind and very much a conversationalist. She conducts her business in the neighborhood called "Plan 3000" which is known for the multicultural identity of its people as a result of the migration from the countryside to the city from all corners of the country.

Marlen has a dark complexion, black hair and a medium build (she is seated in the middle in a yellow blouse). Her native tongue is Guarani and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her independent children who work. They live in a rented room made of brick and concrete which has running water, electricity and sewage.

Her desire to improve her business is what motivated her to lead the community bank group. The members of the group are involved in businesses including a welding shop, sale of traditional foods, a bakery, soft drink sales, natural health products sales, manufacturing of sportswear and a taxi service. Marlen's business is selling used clothing which she does as a street vendor. She sets up plastic tarp and displays the clothing by gender and age. "We always sell summer clothing because it is the only climate we have all year long..." she says.

The advantage of her business is that there is a market demand for her products. The disadvantage is the lack of merchandise to compete. Her dream is to buy a stall for permanent sales. She wants to buy used clothing wholesale in order to be competitive. This is her first loan through the institution in the three years she has been in business.

These are the reasons why Marlen is requesting the loan to buy used clothing wholesale in order to face her competition.

loans.use: to buy used clothing wholesale to be more competitive.
